        FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

      • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

      • id: (integer)

        Unique id to identify the violation

      • layerTime: (integer)

        LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

      • link: (string)

        Link is the vendor link to the CVE

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

      • packageVersion: (string)

        PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

      • published: (integer)

        Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

      • riskFactors: (object)

        RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

      • severity: (string)

        Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

      • status: (string)

        Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

      • templates: (object)

        Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

      • text: (string)

        Text that explains the violation

      • title: (string)

        Title is the compliance title

      • twistlock: (boolean)

        Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

      • type: (object)

        Type is the vulnerability's type.

      • vecStr: (string)

        VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

      • vulnTagInfos: (object)

        VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

        • comment: (string)

          Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag name

    • complianceIssuesCount: (integer)

      ComplianceIssuesCount is the total number of compliance issues

    • complianceRiskScore: (number)

      ComplianceRiskScore is the image's compliance risk score

    • creationTime: (datetime)

      CreationTime is the time when the image was created

    • ecsClusterName: (string)

      EcsClusterName is the ECS cluster name

    • err: (string)

      Err indicates an error occurred during image health scan

    • externalLabels: (object)

      ExternalLabels are the k8s external labels of all the containers running this image

      • key: (string)

        Key is the label key

      • sourceName: (string)

        SourceName is the source name e.g., for a Namespace, source name can be 'twistlock'

      • sourceType: (object)

        SourceType is source type

      • timestamp: (datetime)

        Timestamp is the time in which the label was fetched

      • value: (string)

        Value is the label value

    • firstScanTime: (datetime)

      FirstScanTime indicates the first time when this image was scanned (preserved during version updates)

    • history: (object)

      History is the docker image history

      • baseLayer: (boolean)

        BaseLayer indicates this layer originated from the base image

      • created: (integer)

        Created is the creation date of a image layer

      • id: (string)

        ID is the layer ID

      • instruction: (string)

        Instruction is the docker file instruction and arguments which created this layer

      • sizeBytes: (integer)

        SizeBytes is the layer size in bytes

      • tags: (string)

        ImageNames holds the image tags

      • vulnerabilities: (object)

        Vulnerabilities holds the list of the vulnerabilities that originated from this layer

        • -: (string)

          LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

        • applicableRules: (string)

          ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

        • binaryPkgs: (string)

          BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

        • block: (boolean)

          Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

        • cause: (string)

          Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

        • custom: (boolean)

          Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

        • cve: (string)

          CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

        • cvss: (number)

          Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerabilities description.

        • discovered: (datetime)

          Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

        • exploit: (object)

          Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

        • fixLink: (string)

          FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

        • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

          GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

        • id: (integer)

          Unique id to identify the violation

        • layerTime: (integer)

          LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

        • link: (string)

          Link is the vendor link to the CVE

        • packageName: (string)

          PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

        • packageVersion: (string)

          PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

        • published: (integer)

          Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • severity: (string)

          Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

        • status: (string)

          Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

        • templates: (object)

          Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

        • text: (string)

          Text that explains the violation

        • title: (string)

          Title is the compliance title

        • twistlock: (boolean)

          Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

        • type: (object)

          Type is the vulnerability's type.

        • vecStr: (string)

          VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

        • vulnTagInfos: (object)

          VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

          • comment: (string)

            Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

          • name: (string)

            Name is the tag name

    • hostDevices: (object)

      HostDevices is a map from host network device name to IP address

      • ip: (string)

        IP is the network device IPv4 address

      • name: (string)

        Name is the network device name

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the name of the host that was scanned

    • hosts: (object)

      Hosts is an index for host scanning results. The key is the host being scanned

    • id: (string)

      Id is the image id

    • image: (object)

      Image is the image metadata associated with docker inspect

      • created: (datetime)

        Created is the image creation time

      • entrypoint: (string)

        Entrypoint is the combined entrypoint of the image (entrypoint + CMD)

      • env: (string)

        Env is the image environment variables

      • healthcheck: (boolean)

        HealthCheck indicates whether health check is enabled

      • history: (object)

        History holds the image history

        • baseLayer: (boolean)

          BaseLayer indicates this layer originated from the base image

        • created: (integer)

          Created is the creation date of a image layer

        • id: (string)

          ID is the layer ID

        • instruction: (string)

          Instruction is the docker file instruction and arguments which created this layer

        • sizeBytes: (integer)

          SizeBytes is the layer size in bytes

        • tags: (string)

          ImageNames holds the image tags

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities holds the list of the vulnerabilities that originated from this layer

          • -: (string)

            LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

          • applicableRules: (string)

            ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

          • binaryPkgs: (string)

            BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

          • cause: (string)

            Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

          • custom: (boolean)

            Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

          • cve: (string)

            CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

          • cvss: (number)

            Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

          • description: (string)

            Description is the vulnerabilities description.

          • discovered: (datetime)

            Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

          • exploit: (object)

            Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

          • fixLink: (string)

            FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

          • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

            GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

          • id: (integer)

            Unique id to identify the violation

          • layerTime: (integer)

            LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

          • link: (string)

            Link is the vendor link to the CVE

          • packageName: (string)

            PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

          • packageVersion: (string)

            PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

          • published: (integer)

            Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

          • riskFactors: (object)

            RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

          • severity: (string)

            Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

          • status: (string)

            Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

          • templates: (object)

            Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

          • text: (string)

            Text that explains the violation

          • title: (string)

            Title is the compliance title

          • twistlock: (boolean)

            Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

          • type: (object)

            Type is the vulnerability's type.

          • vecStr: (string)

            VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

          • vulnTagInfos: (object)

            VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

            • comment: (string)

              Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

            • name: (string)

              Name is the tag name

      • id: (string)

        ID is the image ID

      • layers: (string)

        Layers are the image filesystem layers

      • os: (string)

        OS is the image os type

      • repoDigest: (string)

        RepoDigests are the image repo digests

      • repoTags: (string)

        RepoTags are the image repo tags

      • user: (string)

        User is the image user

      • workingDir: (string)

        WorkingDir is the base working directory of the image

    • installedProducts: (object)

      InstalledProducts contains data about running product in environment

      • apache: (string)

        Apache indicates the apache server version, empty in case apache not running

      • awsCloud: (boolean)

        AWSCloud indicates whether AWS cloud is used

      • docker: (string)

        Docker represents the docker daemon version

      • hasPackageManager: (boolean)

        HasPackageManager indicates whether package manager is installed on the OS

      • k8sApiServer: (boolean)

        K8sApiServer indicates whether a kubernetes api server is running

      • k8sControllerManager: (boolean)

        K8sControllerManager indicates whether a kubernetes controller manager is running

      • k8sEtcd: (boolean)

        K8sEtcd indicates whether etcd is running

      • k8sFederationApiServer: (boolean)

        K8sFederationApiServer indicates whether a federation api server is running

      • k8sFederationControllerManager: (boolean)

        K8sFederationControllerManager indicates whether a federation controller manager is running

      • k8sKubelet: (boolean)

        K8sKubelet indicates whether kubelet is running

      • k8sProxy: (boolean)

        K8sProxy indicates whether a kubernetes proxy is running

      • k8sScheduler: (boolean)

        K8sScheduler indicates whether the a kubernetes scheduler is running

      • kubernetes: (string)

        Kubernetes represents the kubernetes version

      • openshift: (boolean)

        Openshift indicates whether openshift is deployed

      • osDistro: (string)

        OSDistro specify os distribution

      • serverless: (boolean)

        Serverless indicates whether evaluated on a serverless environment

      • swarmManager: (boolean)

        SwarmManager indicates whether a swarm manager is running

      • swarmNode: (boolean)

        SwarmNode indicates whether the node is part of an active swarm

    • instances: (object)

      Instances holds details about each occurrence of the image (tag + host)

      • host: (string)
      • image: (string)
      • modified: (datetime)
      • registry: (string)
      • repo: (string)
      • tag: (string)
    • k8sClusterAddr: (string)

      K8sClusterAddr is the endpoint for Kubernetes API server

    • labels: (string)

      Labels are the image labels

    • layers: (string)

      Layers is the image's filesystem layers, each layers is a sha256 digest of the filesystem diffSee: https://windsock.io/explaining-docker-image-ids/

    • missingDistroVulnCoverage: (boolean)

      MissingDistroVulnCoverage states whether the image os is covered in the IS

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces are the k8s namespaces of all the containers running this image

    • repoDigests: (string)

      RepoDigests are the digests of the image. Used for content trust (notary). Has a digest per tag.

    • riskFactors: (object)

      RiskFactors are the aggregated risk factors of the image

    • scanID: (integer)

      ScanID is the ID of the scan

    • scanTime: (datetime)

      ScanTime is the time when the image was scanned

    • scanVersion: (string)

      ScanVersion is the defender version that published the image.

    • tags: (object)

      Tags are tags associated with the given image

      • digest: (string)

        Digest is the image digest (requires V2 and later registry)

      • id: (string)

        ID is the id of image

      • registry: (string)

        Registry is the registry name to which the image belongs

      • repo: (string)

        Repository is the repository name to which the image belongs

      • tag: (string)

        Tag is the tag of the image

    • topLayer: (string)

      TopLayer is the sha256 of the image's last layer which is the last element of the Layers field

    • trustStatus: (object)

      TrustStatus is the image trust status. Range of acceptable values: trusted, untrusted

    • twistlockImage: (boolean)

      TwistlockImage indicates if the image is a Twistlock image

    • type: (object)

      Type is the scan result type. Range of acceptable values: image, ciImage, container, host, registry, serverlessScan, ciServerless, vm, pcf, cloudDiscovery, cloudCompliance, serverlessRadar, serverlessAutoProtect

    • vulnerabilities: (object)

      Vulnerabilities are the CVE vulnerabilities of the image

      • -: (string)

        LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

      • applicableRules: (string)

        ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

      • binaryPkgs: (string)

        BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

      • block: (boolean)

        Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

      • cause: (string)

        Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

      • custom: (boolean)

        Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

      • cve: (string)

        CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

      • cvss: (number)

        Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

      • description: (string)

        Description is the vulnerabilities description.

      • discovered: (datetime)

        Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

      • exploit: (object)

        Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

      • fixLink: (string)

        FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

      • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

      • id: (integer)

        Unique id to identify the violation

      • layerTime: (integer)

        LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

      • link: (string)

        Link is the vendor link to the CVE

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

      • packageVersion: (string)

        PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

      • published: (integer)

        Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

      • riskFactors: (object)

        RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

      • severity: (string)

        Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

      • status: (string)

        Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

      • templates: (object)

        Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

      • text: (string)

        Text that explains the violation

      • title: (string)

        Title is the compliance title

      • twistlock: (boolean)

        Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

      • type: (object)

        Type is the vulnerability's type.

      • vecStr: (string)

        VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

      • vulnTagInfos: (object)

        VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

        • comment: (string)

          Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag name

    • vulnerabilitiesCount: (integer)

      VulnerabilitiesCount is the total number of vulnerabilities

    • vulnerabilityDistribution: (object)

      VulnerabilityDistribution is the distribution of vulnerability issues

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • vulnerabilityRiskScore: (number)

      VulnerabilityRiskScore is the image's CVE risk score

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/docker get put

    get

    Retrieves a list of all access control rules for Docker Engine commands.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/docker

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    Updates all Docker Engine access control rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove Docker access control rules is:

    1. Get all Docker access control rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/docker \
 | jq '.' > docker_access_control_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your docker_access_control_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/docker \
--data-binary "@docker_access_control_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/docker

    Retrieves a list of all access control rules for Docker Engine commands.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/docker

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Internal id representation

    • policyType: (object)

      Type is the policy type

    • rules: (object)

      Rules holds all policy rules

      • action: (string)

        Actions lists the effected actions

      • alertThreshold: (object)

        AlertThreshold is the threshold for assessing vulnerabilities

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disable indicates that all vulnerabilities are supressed

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity for which a vulnerability is added

      • allCompliance: (boolean)

        AllCompliance indicates whether to display all compliance checks (passed +failed)

      • auditAllowed: (boolean)

        AuditAllowed defines whether we audit successful transactions

      • blockMsg: (object)

        BlockMsg is the message that will be displayed when policy rule blocks

      • blockThreshold: (object)

        BlockThreshold is the threshold used for blocking vulnerabilities

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates that blocking is enabled

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity score for which blocking is enabled

      • condition: (object)

        Condition specifies policy enforcement conditions

        • device: (string)

          Device allowed volume host device (wildcard). If a container create command specifies a non matching host device, the action will be blocked.

        • readonly: (boolean)

          Readonly specifies whether or not a rule applies only to read only commands (AKA HTTP GET requests).

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities represents block and scan severity-based vulnerabilities conditions

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates whether this vulnerability should cause an access block

          • id: (integer)

            Id of the vulnerability

          • minSeverity: (number)

            MinSeverity is the minimal severity for which this rule applies (lower severity vulnerabilities will be filtered)

      • cveRules: (object)

        CVERules are rules associated with a specific vulnerability

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this CVE is allowed

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the allowed CVE

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID is the CVE to allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the effect which which applies if the rule applies. Range of acceptable values: allow, deny, block, alert

      • graceDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of days from time of publiciation for which a vulnerability is considered active

      • group: (string)

        Groups is the groups that are applicable to the policy

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • onlyFixed: (boolean)

        OnlyFixed indicates only fixed vulnerabilities should be included

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • principal: (string)

        Principals is the users that are applicable to the policy

      • resource: (string)

        Deprecated: Used to support older defenders prior to 2.3 - do not remove.

      • resources: (object)

        Resources is a list of resources for which this rule applies

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • tags: (object)

        tags are tag rules associated with a specific tag

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this tag has a specific action

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the tag

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag to ignore/alert

      • verbose: (boolean)

        Verbose indicates whether to display a detailed message when operation is blocked

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/docker

    Updates all Docker Engine access control rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove Docker access control rules is:

    1. Get all Docker access control rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/docker \
 | jq '.' > docker_access_control_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your docker_access_control_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/docker \
--data-binary "@docker_access_control_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Internal id representation

    • policyType: (object)

      Type is the policy type

    • rules: (object)

      Rules holds all policy rules

      • action: (string)

        Actions lists the effected actions

      • alertThreshold: (object)

        AlertThreshold is the threshold for assessing vulnerabilities

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disable indicates that all vulnerabilities are supressed

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity for which a vulnerability is added

      • allCompliance: (boolean)

        AllCompliance indicates whether to display all compliance checks (passed +failed)

      • auditAllowed: (boolean)

        AuditAllowed defines whether we audit successful transactions

      • blockMsg: (object)

        BlockMsg is the message that will be displayed when policy rule blocks

      • blockThreshold: (object)

        BlockThreshold is the threshold used for blocking vulnerabilities

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates that blocking is enabled

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity score for which blocking is enabled

      • condition: (object)

        Condition specifies policy enforcement conditions

        • device: (string)

          Device allowed volume host device (wildcard). If a container create command specifies a non matching host device, the action will be blocked.

        • readonly: (boolean)

          Readonly specifies whether or not a rule applies only to read only commands (AKA HTTP GET requests).

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities represents block and scan severity-based vulnerabilities conditions

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates whether this vulnerability should cause an access block

          • id: (integer)

            Id of the vulnerability

          • minSeverity: (number)

            MinSeverity is the minimal severity for which this rule applies (lower severity vulnerabilities will be filtered)

      • cveRules: (object)

        CVERules are rules associated with a specific vulnerability

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this CVE is allowed

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the allowed CVE

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID is the CVE to allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the effect which which applies if the rule applies. Range of acceptable values: allow, deny, block, alert

      • graceDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of days from time of publiciation for which a vulnerability is considered active

      • group: (string)

        Groups is the groups that are applicable to the policy

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • onlyFixed: (boolean)

        OnlyFixed indicates only fixed vulnerabilities should be included

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • principal: (string)

        Principals is the users that are applicable to the policy

      • resource: (string)

        Deprecated: Used to support older defenders prior to 2.3 - do not remove.

      • resources: (object)

        Resources is a list of resources for which this rule applies

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • tags: (object)

        tags are tag rules associated with a specific tag

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this tag has a specific action

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the tag

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag to ignore/alert

      • verbose: (boolean)

        Verbose indicates whether to display a detailed message when operation is blocked

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/app/app-embedded get put

    get

    AppEmbeddedAppFirewallPolicy returns the embedded defender application firewall runtime policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    SetAppEmbeddedAppFirewallPolicy sets the given embedded defender firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/app/app-embedded

    AppEmbeddedAppFirewallPolicy returns the embedded defender application firewall runtime policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

      • intelGathering: (object)

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/app/app-embedded

    SetAppEmbeddedAppFirewallPolicy sets the given embedded defender firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

      • intelGathering: (object)

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/app/container get put

    get

    Retrieves a list of all application firewall (CNAF) rules.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/app/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    Updates all application firewall (CNAF) rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove application firewall rules is:

    1. Get all application firewall rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/app/container \
 | jq '.' > app_firewall_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your app_firewall_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/app/container \
--data-binary "@app_firewall_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/app/container

    Retrieves a list of all application firewall (CNAF) rules.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/app/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/app/container

    Updates all application firewall (CNAF) rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove application firewall rules is:

    1. Get all application firewall rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/app/container \
 | jq '.' > app_firewall_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your app_firewall_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/app/container \
--data-binary "@app_firewall_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow
