          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/app/container/impacted get

    get

    ContainerAppFirewallPolicyImpacted returns a list of containers for which the firewall policy applies to. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    get /policies/firewall/app/container/impacted

    ContainerAppFirewallPolicyImpacted returns a list of containers for which the firewall policy applies to. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • ruleName: (string)

      RuleName is the rule name to apply

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Id is the container id

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections to which this container applies

    • firewallProtected: (boolean)

      FirewallProtected indicates this container is protected by firewall

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname on which the container is deployed

    • info: (object)

      Info is the full container info

      • -: (object)

        AppProfiles are the application profile

      • allCompliance: (object)

        AllCompliance are all the container compliance checks that passed (all failed tests are filtered)

        • compliance: (object)

          Compliance are all the passed compliance checks

          • -: (string)

            LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

          • applicableRules: (string)

            ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

          • binaryPkgs: (string)

            BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

          • cause: (string)

            Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

          • custom: (boolean)

            Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

          • cve: (string)

            CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

          • cvss: (number)

            Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

          • description: (string)

            Description is the vulnerabilities description.

          • discovered: (datetime)

            Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

          • exploit: (object)

            Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

          • fixLink: (string)

            FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

          • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

            GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

          • id: (integer)

            Unique id to identify the violation

          • layerTime: (integer)

            LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

          • link: (string)

            Link is the vendor link to the CVE

          • packageName: (string)

            PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

          • packageVersion: (string)

            PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

          • published: (integer)

            Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

          • riskFactors: (object)

            RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

          • severity: (string)

            Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

          • status: (string)

            Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

          • templates: (object)

            Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

          • text: (string)

            Text that explains the violation

          • title: (string)

            Title is the compliance title

          • twistlock: (boolean)

            Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

          • type: (object)

            Type is the vulnerability's type.

          • vecStr: (string)

            VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

          • vulnTagInfos: (object)

            VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

            • comment: (string)

              Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

            • name: (string)

              Name is the tag name

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether passed compliance checks is enabled by policy

      • app: (string)

        App is the app that is hosted in the container

      • cloudMetadata: (object)

        CloudMetadata is the cloud provider metadata for the scanner host

        • accountID: (string)

          AccountID is the cloud account ID

        • id: (string)

          ID is the instance unique ID

        • image: (string)

          Image is the image name

        • name: (string)

          Name is the instance name

        • provider: (object)

          Provider is the cloud provider (AWS/GCP/Azure). Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

        • region: (string)

          Region the instance region

        • type: (string)

          Type is the instance type

      • complianceDistribution: (object)

        ComplianceDistribution is the distribution of compliance issues

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • complianceIssues: (object)

        ComplianceIssues are all the container compliance issues

        • -: (string)

          LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

        • applicableRules: (string)

          ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

        • binaryPkgs: (string)

          BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

        • block: (boolean)

          Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

        • cause: (string)

          Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

        • custom: (boolean)

          Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

        • cve: (string)

          CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

        • cvss: (number)

          Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerabilities description.

        • discovered: (datetime)

          Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

        • exploit: (object)

          Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

        • fixLink: (string)

          FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

        • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

          GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

        • id: (integer)

          Unique id to identify the violation

        • layerTime: (integer)

          LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

        • link: (string)

          Link is the vendor link to the CVE

        • packageName: (string)

          PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

        • packageVersion: (string)

          PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

        • published: (integer)

          Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • severity: (string)

          Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

        • status: (string)

          Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

        • templates: (object)

          Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

        • text: (string)

          Text that explains the violation

        • title: (string)

          Title is the compliance title

        • twistlock: (boolean)

          Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

        • type: (object)

          Type is the vulnerability's type.

        • vecStr: (string)

          VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

        • vulnTagInfos: (object)

          VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

          • comment: (string)

            Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

          • name: (string)

            Name is the tag name

      • complianceIssuesCount: (integer)
      • complianceRiskScore: (number)

        ComplianceRiskScore is the container's compliance risk score

      • externalLabels: (object)

        ExternalLabels is the external labels e.g., kubernetes namespace labels

        • key: (string)

          Key is the label key

        • sourceName: (string)

          SourceName is the source name e.g., for a Namespace, source name can be 'twistlock'

        • sourceType: (object)

          SourceType is source type

        • timestamp: (datetime)

          Timestamp is the time in which the label was fetched

        • value: (string)

          Value is the label value

      • id: (string)

        Id is the container id

      • image: (string)

        Image is the canonical image name

      • imageID: (string)

        ImageId is the image id

      • imageName: (string)

        Deprecated: The image name as stated in the docker run command

      • infra: (boolean)

        Infra represents any container that belongs to the infrastructure

      • installedProducts: (object)

        InstalledProducts contains data about running product in environment

        • apache: (string)

          Apache indicates the apache server version, empty in case apache not running

        • awsCloud: (boolean)

          AWSCloud indicates whether AWS cloud is used

        • docker: (string)

          Docker represents the docker daemon version

        • hasPackageManager: (boolean)

          HasPackageManager indicates whether package manager is installed on the OS

        • k8sApiServer: (boolean)

          K8sApiServer indicates whether a kubernetes api server is running

        • k8sControllerManager: (boolean)

          K8sControllerManager indicates whether a kubernetes controller manager is running

        • k8sEtcd: (boolean)

          K8sEtcd indicates whether etcd is running

        • k8sFederationApiServer: (boolean)

          K8sFederationApiServer indicates whether a federation api server is running

        • k8sFederationControllerManager: (boolean)

          K8sFederationControllerManager indicates whether a federation controller manager is running

        • k8sKubelet: (boolean)

          K8sKubelet indicates whether kubelet is running

        • k8sProxy: (boolean)

          K8sProxy indicates whether a kubernetes proxy is running

        • k8sScheduler: (boolean)

          K8sScheduler indicates whether the a kubernetes scheduler is running

        • kubernetes: (string)

          Kubernetes represents the kubernetes version

        • openshift: (boolean)

          Openshift indicates whether openshift is deployed

        • osDistro: (string)

          OSDistro specify os distribution

        • serverless: (boolean)

          Serverless indicates whether evaluated on a serverless environment

        • swarmManager: (boolean)

          SwarmManager indicates whether a swarm manager is running

        • swarmNode: (boolean)

          SwarmNode indicates whether the node is part of an active swarm

      • labels: (string)

        Labels are the container labels (https://docs.docker.com/engine/userguide/labels-custom-metadata/)

      • name: (string)

        Name is the container name

      • namespace: (string)

        Namespace is the k8s deployment namespace

      • network: (object)

        Network is the container network info

        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the ports details associated with the container

          • container: (integer)

            Container is the mapped port inside the container

          • host: (integer)

            Host is the host port number

          • hostIP: (string)

            HostIP is the host IP

          • listening: (boolean)

            Listening indicates whether the port is in listening mode

          • nat: (boolean)

            NAT indicates the port is exposed using NAT

      • processes: (object)

        Processes are the processes that are running inside the container

        • name: (string)

          Name is a process name

      • profileID: (string)

        ProfileID is the container profile id

      • sizeBytes: (integer)
    • scanTime: (datetime)

      ScanTime is the container scan time

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/app/host get put

    get

    HostAppFirewallPolicy returns the host application firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    SetHostAppFirewallPolicy sets the given host firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/app/host

    HostAppFirewallPolicy returns the host application firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

      • intelGathering: (object)

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/app/host

    SetHostAppFirewallPolicy sets the given host firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

      • intelGathering: (object)

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/app/serverless get put

    get

    ServerlessAppFirewallPolicy returns the serverless application firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    SetServerlessAppFirewallPolicy sets the given serverless firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/app/serverless

    ServerlessAppFirewallPolicy returns the serverless application firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

      • intelGathering: (object)

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/app/serverless

    SetServerlessAppFirewallPolicy sets the given serverless firewall policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal policy id

    • maxPort: (integer)

      MaxPort is the maximum port to use in the application firewall

    • minPort: (integer)

      MinPort is the minimum port to use in the application firewall

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of app firewall rules

      • attackToolsEnabled: (boolean)

        AttackToolsEnabled indicates whether attack tool protection is enabled

      • blacklist: (object)

        Blacklist contains CIDR blacklist configurations

        • advancedProtection: (boolean)

          AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (premium feeds) is enabled

        • subnets: (string)

          CustomSubnets are the blocked subnets

      • certificate: (object)

        Certificate contains the TLS certificate associated with the firewall instance

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clickjackingEnabled: (boolean)

        ClickjackingEnabled indicates whether clickjacking protection is enabled

      • cmdiEnabled: (boolean)

        CMDiEnabled indicates whether cmdi protection is enabled

      • codeInjectionEnabled: (boolean)

        CodeInjectionEnabled indicates whether code injection protection is enabled

      • csrfEnabled: (boolean)

        CSRFEnabled indicates whether CSRF protection is enabled

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the firewall rule effect. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • headers: (object)

        HeadersCfg contains configurations related to header analysis

        • specs: (object)

          Spec are the header configuration specification

          • allow: (boolean)

            Allow indicates whether to block or allow the flow

          • name: (string)

            Name is the blacklist header name

          • values: (string)

            Values are the of set wildcard expression that represents the header value

      • intelGathering: (object)

        IntelGathering contains intelligence gathering protection configuration

        • bruteforceEnabled: (boolean)

          BruteForceEnabled indicates brute-force analysis is enabled

        • dirTraversalEnabled: (boolean)

          DirTraversalEnabled indicates directory traversal is enabled

        • infoLeakageEnabled: (boolean)

          InfoLeakageEnabled indicates information leakage protection is enabled

        • removeFingerprintsEnabled: (boolean)

          RemoveFingerprints indicates server fingerprints should be removed

        • trackErrorsEnabled: (boolean)

          TrackErrorsEnabled indicates tracking for errors is enabled

      • lfiEnabled: (boolean)

        LFIEnabled indicates whether lfi protection is enabled

      • libinject: (object)

        Libinject contains configurations for injection detection

        • sqliEnabled: (boolean)
        • xssEnabled: (boolean)
      • malformedReqEnabled: (boolean)

        MalformedReqEnabled indicates whether malformed requests analyis is enabled

      • maliciousUpload: (object)

        MaliciousUpload contains the malicious upload analysis configuration

        • allowedExtensions: (string)

          AllowedExtensions are allwoed file extensions

        • allowedFileTypes: (object)

          AllowedFileTypes are allowed file types. Range of acceptable values: pdf, officeLegacy, officeOoxml, odf, jpeg, png, gif, bmp, ico, avi, mp4, aac, mp3, wav, zip, gzip, rar, 7zip

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether the configuration is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • portMaps: (object)

        PortMaps is a list of port maps, between exposed to internal port

        • exposed: (integer)

          Exposed is an exposed port that the proxy is listening on

        • internal: (integer)

          Internal is an internal port that the application is listening on

        • tls: (boolean)

          TLS is an indication whether the connection is secured or not

      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources contains the rule applicable resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • shellshockEnabled: (boolean)

        ShellshockEnabled indicates whether shell-shock protection is enabled

      • whitelistSubnets: (string)

        WhitelistSubnets are allowed subnets

      • whitelistURLs: (string)

        WhitelistURLs is a list of explicitly allowed paths, no firewall rules are being enforced on them

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/network/container get put

    get

    Retrieves a list of all network firewall (CNNF) rules.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    Updates all network firewall (CNNF) rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove rules is:

    1. Get all rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/container \
 | jq '.' > network_firewall_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your network_firewall_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/container \
--data-binary "@network_firewall_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/network/container

    Retrieves a list of all network firewall (CNNF) rules.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • entities: (object)

      Entities are the network firewall entities referenced by the policy

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    • policy: (object)

      Policy is the network firewall policy

      • _id: (string)
      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether network firewall feature is enabled

      • multiHostDetection: (boolean)

        MultiHostDetection enables detecting app to app connections between separated hosts

      • rules: (object)

        Rules is the list of network firewall rule specifications

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

        • dst: (object)

          Dst is the source entity of the firewall rule

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the firewall effect of the rule. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

        • id: (object)

          ID is the rule ID

        • learning: (boolean)

          Learning indicates whether network models should be use as a fallback when resolving rule

        • modified: (datetime)
        • name: (string)
        • notes: (string)

          Notes are the rule's user notes

        • owner: (string)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the entity port range specifications

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • previousName: (string)

          PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

        • src: (object)

          Src is the source entity of the firewall rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/network/container

    Updates all network firewall (CNNF) rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove rules is:

    1. Get all rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/container \
 | jq '.' > network_firewall_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your network_firewall_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/container \
--data-binary "@network_firewall_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • entities: (object)

      Entities are the network firewall entities referenced by the policy

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    • policy: (object)

      Policy is the network firewall policy

      • _id: (string)
      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether network firewall feature is enabled

      • multiHostDetection: (boolean)

        MultiHostDetection enables detecting app to app connections between separated hosts

      • rules: (object)

        Rules is the list of network firewall rule specifications

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

        • dst: (object)

          Dst is the source entity of the firewall rule

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the firewall effect of the rule. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

        • id: (object)

          ID is the rule ID

        • learning: (boolean)

          Learning indicates whether network models should be use as a fallback when resolving rule

        • modified: (datetime)
        • name: (string)
        • notes: (string)

          Notes are the rule's user notes

        • owner: (string)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the entity port range specifications

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • previousName: (string)

          PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

        • src: (object)

          Src is the source entity of the firewall rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/network/entities get put

    get

    Retrieves a list of all CNNF network objects.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/entities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    Updates the list of CNNF network objects.

    The following example curl command updates the network objects. There is an example of all three types (images,subnets, and applications ):

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d \
'[
{"_id":"Ubuntu","type":"container","resource":{"images":["ubuntu:latest"],"labels":["*"]}},
{"_id":"Google DNS","type":"subnet","resource":{"labels":["*"]},"subnets":[{"name":"8.8.8.8/24","cidr":"8.8.8.8/24"}]},
{"_id":"SSH","type":"appID","resource":{"appIDs":["ssh"]},"subnets":[]}
]' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/entities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/network/entities

    Retrieves a list of all CNNF network objects.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/entities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (object)

      ID is the entity ID

    • domains: (string)

      Domains is the list of DNS domain names

    • name: (string)

      Name is the entity name

    • resource: (object)

      Resource is the entity resource

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • regions: (string)
      • services: (string)
    • subnets: (object)

      Subnets are the CIDR format network

      • cidr: (string)

        CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

      • name: (string)

        Name is the given name to represent the range

    • type: (object)

      Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/network/entities

    Updates the list of CNNF network objects.

    The following example curl command updates the network objects. There is an example of all three types (images,subnets, and applications ):

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d \
'[
{"_id":"Ubuntu","type":"container","resource":{"images":["ubuntu:latest"],"labels":["*"]}},
{"_id":"Google DNS","type":"subnet","resource":{"labels":["*"]},"subnets":[{"name":"8.8.8.8/24","cidr":"8.8.8.8/24"}]},
{"_id":"SSH","type":"appID","resource":{"appIDs":["ssh"]},"subnets":[]}
]' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/firewall/network/entities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (object)

      ID is the entity ID

    • domains: (string)

      Domains is the list of DNS domain names

    • name: (string)

      Name is the entity name

    • resource: (object)

      Resource is the entity resource

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • regions: (string)
      • services: (string)
    • subnets: (object)

      Subnets are the CIDR format network

      • cidr: (string)

        CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

      • name: (string)

        Name is the given name to represent the range

    • type: (object)

      Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/firewall/network/host get put

    get

    HostNetworkFirewallPolicy returns the host network firewall runtime policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    SetHostNetworkFirewallPolicy sets the given firewall policyRemark: this api is used for set and import of policy, when entities are provided this is an import otherwise just setting the policyRemark: this api will fail if there is a collision with existing container entities. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/firewall/network/host

    HostNetworkFirewallPolicy returns the host network firewall runtime policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • entities: (object)

      Entities are the network firewall entities referenced by the policy

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    • policy: (object)

      Policy is the network firewall policy

      • _id: (string)
      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether network firewall feature is enabled

      • multiHostDetection: (boolean)

        MultiHostDetection enables detecting app to app connections between separated hosts

      • rules: (object)

        Rules is the list of network firewall rule specifications

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

        • dst: (object)

          Dst is the source entity of the firewall rule

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the firewall effect of the rule. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

        • id: (object)

          ID is the rule ID

        • learning: (boolean)

          Learning indicates whether network models should be use as a fallback when resolving rule

        • modified: (datetime)
        • name: (string)
        • notes: (string)

          Notes are the rule's user notes

        • owner: (string)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the entity port range specifications

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • previousName: (string)

          PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

        • src: (object)

          Src is the source entity of the firewall rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/firewall/network/host

    SetHostNetworkFirewallPolicy sets the given firewall policyRemark: this api is used for set and import of policy, when entities are provided this is an import otherwise just setting the policyRemark: this api will fail if there is a collision with existing container entities. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • entities: (object)

      Entities are the network firewall entities referenced by the policy

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    • policy: (object)

      Policy is the network firewall policy

      • _id: (string)
      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether network firewall feature is enabled

      • multiHostDetection: (boolean)

        MultiHostDetection enables detecting app to app connections between separated hosts

      • rules: (object)

        Rules is the list of network firewall rule specifications

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

        • dst: (object)

          Dst is the source entity of the firewall rule

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the firewall effect of the rule. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

        • id: (object)

          ID is the rule ID

        • learning: (boolean)

          Learning indicates whether network models should be use as a fallback when resolving rule

        • modified: (datetime)
        • name: (string)
        • notes: (string)

          Notes are the rule's user notes

        • owner: (string)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the entity port range specifications

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • previousName: (string)

          PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

        • src: (object)

          Src is the source entity of the firewall rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/kubernetes-audit get put

    get

    KubernetesAuditPolicy returns the Kubernetes audit policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    SetKubernetesAuditPolicy validates and sets the given Kubernetes audit policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/kubernetes-audit

    KubernetesAuditPolicy returns the Kubernetes audit policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the Kubernetes audit policy ID

    • customRulesIDs: (integer)

      CustomRulesIDs is a list of the custom runtime rules ids that apply to this policy

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled specifies if Kubernetes audits are enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/kubernetes-audit

    SetKubernetesAuditPolicy validates and sets the given Kubernetes audit policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the Kubernetes audit policy ID

    • customRulesIDs: (integer)

      CustomRulesIDs is a list of the custom runtime rules ids that apply to this policy

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled specifies if Kubernetes audits are enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik
