      • resources: (object)

        Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • serviceRules: (object)

        ServiceRules is a list of rules how to act when an service attempts to obtain each capability

        • capabilities: (object)

          Capabilities is a list of capability rules

          • effect: (object)

            Effect is the runtime effect that will be applied if the model is not used and the capability is not allowed. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

          • type: (object)

            Type is the capability type. Range of acceptable values: SYSTEM_LOGS, DOCKER, DOCKER_SOCKET, USERS_ADMIN, INSTALLER, KUBERNETES, OPENSHIFT, SSH, SHELL, NET, HOSTS_CONFIG, SERVICE_OPERATOR, GCLOUD, PRIVILEGED_PROCESSES, SECRETS_MANAGER

        • serviceName: (string)

          ServiceName is the name of the service

      • staticProfiles: (boolean)

        StaticProfilesEnabled indicates whether to use Twistlock static service profiles or not

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /policies/runtime/host

    SetHostRuntimePolicyRule set the specified rule first. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • advancedProtection: (object)

      AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds) is enabled. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

    • anomalousAppDetection: (object)

      AnomalousAppsDetection is the anomalous app detection rule

      • blacklist: (string)

        Blacklist is the blacklist app list

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates that anomalous app detection is enabled

      • whitelist: (string)

        Whitelist is the whitelist app list

    • capabilitiesEffect: (object)

      CapabilitiesEffect is the runtime effect when there is no specific rule to apply for the event. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

    • cryptoMiners: (object)

      CryptoMiners indicates whether to detect crypto miners or not and what effect to apply. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

    • customRules: (object)

      CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

      • _id: (integer)

        ID is the custom runtime rule id

      • action: (object)

        Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

    • disabled: (boolean)

      Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

    • dns: (object)

      DNS are the runtime DNS rules

      • blacklist: (string)
      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • whitelist: (string)
    • fileIntegrityRules: (object)

      FileIntegrityRules are the file integrity monitoring rules

      • dir: (boolean)

        Dir indicates that the path is a directory

      • exclusions: (string)

        Exclusions are filenames that should be ignored while generating auditsThese filenames may contain a wildcard regex pattern, e.g. foo*.log, *.cache

      • metadata: (boolean)

        Metadata indicates that metadata changes should be monitored (e.g. chmod, chown)

      • path: (string)

        Path is the path to monitor

      • procWhitelist: (string)

        ProcWhitelist are the processes to ignoreFilesystem events caused by these processes DO NOT generate file integrity events

      • read: (boolean)

        Read indicates that reads operations should be monitored

      • recursive: (boolean)

        Recursive indicates that monitoring should be recursive

      • write: (boolean)

        Write indicates that write operations should be monitored

    • forensic: (object)

      Forensic are the host forensic settings

      • activitiesDisabled: (boolean)

        ActivitiesDisabled indicates if the host activity collection is enabled/disabled

      • dockerEnabled: (boolean)

        DockerEnabled indicates whether docker commands are collected

      • readonlyDockerEnabled: (boolean)

        ReadonlyDockerEnabled indicates whether docker readonly commands are collected

      • serviceActivitiesEnabled: (boolean)

        ServiceActivitiesEnabled indicates whether activities from services are collected

      • sshdEnabled: (boolean)

        SshdEnabled indicates whether ssh commands are collected

      • sudoEnabled: (boolean)

        SudoEnabled indicates whether sudo commands are collected

    • logInspectionRules: (object)

      LogInspectionRules is a list of log inspection rules

      • path: (string)

        Path is the log path

      • regex: (string)

        Regex are the regular expressions associated with the rule if it is a custom one

    • modified: (datetime)
    • name: (string)
    • network: (object)

      Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

      • blacklistIPs: (string)
      • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

        BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

        BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • detectPortScan: (boolean)

        DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

        SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

      • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

        SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

      • whitelistIPs: (string)

        WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

      • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

        WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

        WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
    • notes: (string)

      Notes are the rule's user notes

    • owner: (string)
    • previousName: (string)

      PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    • resources: (object)

      Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)
    • serviceRules: (object)

      ServiceRules is a list of rules how to act when an service attempts to obtain each capability

      • capabilities: (object)

        Capabilities is a list of capability rules

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the runtime effect that will be applied if the model is not used and the capability is not allowed. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • type: (object)

          Type is the capability type. Range of acceptable values: SYSTEM_LOGS, DOCKER, DOCKER_SOCKET, USERS_ADMIN, INSTALLER, KUBERNETES, OPENSHIFT, SSH, SHELL, NET, HOSTS_CONFIG, SERVICE_OPERATOR, GCLOUD, PRIVILEGED_PROCESSES, SECRETS_MANAGER

      • serviceName: (string)

        ServiceName is the name of the service

    • staticProfiles: (boolean)

      StaticProfilesEnabled indicates whether to use Twistlock static service profiles or not

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/runtime/host

    Updates all host runtime rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove compliance rules is:

    1. Get all host runtime rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
 -X GET
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/host \
 | jq '.' > host_runtime_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your host_runtime_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
-X PUT \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/host \
--data-binary "@host_runtime_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the host runtime policy internal id

    • learningDisabled: (boolean)

      LearningDisabled indicates all learning (behavioral and static) is disabled)

    • owner: (string)

      Owner is the host runtime policy owner

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of host runtime rules

      • advancedProtection: (object)

        AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds) is enabled. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • anomalousAppDetection: (object)

        AnomalousAppsDetection is the anomalous app detection rule

        • blacklist: (string)

          Blacklist is the blacklist app list

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates that anomalous app detection is enabled

        • whitelist: (string)

          Whitelist is the whitelist app list

      • capabilitiesEffect: (object)

        CapabilitiesEffect is the runtime effect when there is no specific rule to apply for the event. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • cryptoMiners: (object)

        CryptoMiners indicates whether to detect crypto miners or not and what effect to apply. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • customRules: (object)

        CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

        • _id: (integer)

          ID is the custom runtime rule id

        • action: (object)

          Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • dns: (object)

        DNS are the runtime DNS rules

        • blacklist: (string)
        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • whitelist: (string)
      • fileIntegrityRules: (object)

        FileIntegrityRules are the file integrity monitoring rules

        • dir: (boolean)

          Dir indicates that the path is a directory

        • exclusions: (string)

          Exclusions are filenames that should be ignored while generating auditsThese filenames may contain a wildcard regex pattern, e.g. foo*.log, *.cache

        • metadata: (boolean)

          Metadata indicates that metadata changes should be monitored (e.g. chmod, chown)

        • path: (string)

          Path is the path to monitor

        • procWhitelist: (string)

          ProcWhitelist are the processes to ignoreFilesystem events caused by these processes DO NOT generate file integrity events

        • read: (boolean)

          Read indicates that reads operations should be monitored

        • recursive: (boolean)

          Recursive indicates that monitoring should be recursive

        • write: (boolean)

          Write indicates that write operations should be monitored

      • forensic: (object)

        Forensic are the host forensic settings

        • activitiesDisabled: (boolean)

          ActivitiesDisabled indicates if the host activity collection is enabled/disabled

        • dockerEnabled: (boolean)

          DockerEnabled indicates whether docker commands are collected

        • readonlyDockerEnabled: (boolean)

          ReadonlyDockerEnabled indicates whether docker readonly commands are collected

        • serviceActivitiesEnabled: (boolean)

          ServiceActivitiesEnabled indicates whether activities from services are collected

        • sshdEnabled: (boolean)

          SshdEnabled indicates whether ssh commands are collected

        • sudoEnabled: (boolean)

          SudoEnabled indicates whether sudo commands are collected

      • logInspectionRules: (object)

        LogInspectionRules is a list of log inspection rules

        • path: (string)

          Path is the log path

        • regex: (string)

          Regex are the regular expressions associated with the rule if it is a custom one

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • network: (object)

        Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

        • blacklistIPs: (string)
        • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

          BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

          BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • detectPortScan: (boolean)

          DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

          SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

        • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

          SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

        • whitelistIPs: (string)

          WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

        • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

          WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

          WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • resources: (object)

        Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • serviceRules: (object)

        ServiceRules is a list of rules how to act when an service attempts to obtain each capability

        • capabilities: (object)

          Capabilities is a list of capability rules

          • effect: (object)

            Effect is the runtime effect that will be applied if the model is not used and the capability is not allowed. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

          • type: (object)

            Type is the capability type. Range of acceptable values: SYSTEM_LOGS, DOCKER, DOCKER_SOCKET, USERS_ADMIN, INSTALLER, KUBERNETES, OPENSHIFT, SSH, SHELL, NET, HOSTS_CONFIG, SERVICE_OPERATOR, GCLOUD, PRIVILEGED_PROCESSES, SECRETS_MANAGER

        • serviceName: (string)

          ServiceName is the name of the service

      • staticProfiles: (boolean)

        StaticProfilesEnabled indicates whether to use Twistlock static service profiles or not

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/runtime/serverless get post put

    get

    Retrieves the list of rules that make up your serverless runtime policy.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/serverless

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    SetServerlessRuntimePolicyRule adds the given serverless runtime policy rule. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    put

    Updates all serverless runtime rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove compliance rules is:

    1. Get all host runtime rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
 -X GET
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/serverless \
 | jq '.' > serverless_runtime_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your serverless_runtime_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
-X PUT \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/serverless \
--data-binary "@serverless_runtime_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/runtime/serverless

    Retrieves the list of rules that make up your serverless runtime policy.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/serverless

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the container runtime policy ID

    • learningDisabled: (boolean)

      LearningDisabled whether automatic behavioral learning is enabled

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of rules in the policy

      • advancedProtection: (boolean)

        AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds for container, added whitelist rules for serverless) is enabled

      • cloudMetadataEnforcement: (boolean)

        CloudMetadataEnforcement indicates whether cloud metadata enforcement is enabled, to catch containers that access the cloud provider metadata api

      • customRules: (object)

        CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

        • _id: (integer)

          ID is the custom runtime rule id

        • action: (object)

          Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • dns: (object)

        DNS are the runtime DNS rules

        • blacklist: (string)
        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • whitelist: (string)
      • filesystem: (object)

        Filesystem contains configurations related to filesystem

        • backdoorFiles: (boolean)

          BackdoorFiles represents if backdoor files should be monitored (currently, ssh/administrative access files)

        • blacklist: (string)

          Blacklist is a list of paths to explicitly block file writes

        • checkNewFiles: (boolean)

          CheckNewFiles raises alert on every known file type (binary, secret) modification

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • whitelist: (string)

          Whitelist is a list of paths to ignore file writes

      • kubernetesEnforcement: (boolean)

        KubernetesEnforcement indicates whether Kubernetes enforcement is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • network: (object)

        Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

        • blacklistIPs: (string)
        • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

          BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

          BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • detectPortScan: (boolean)

          DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

          SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

        • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

          SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

        • whitelistIPs: (string)

          WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

        • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

          WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

          WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • processes: (object)

        Processes are the process features that are enabled for this rule

        • blacklist: (string)
        • blockAllBinaries: (boolean)

          BlockAllBinaries indicates that all processes except the main process are blocked

        • checkCryptoMiners: (boolean)

          CheckCryptoMiners indicates that the rule will detect crypto miners

        • checkLateralMovement: (boolean)

          CheckLateralMovement indicates that the rule will processes that can be used for lateral movement exploit

        • checkNewBinaries: (boolean)

          CheckNewBinaries indicates that binaries that do not belong to the original image are not allowed to run

        • checkParentChild: (boolean)

          CheckParentChild indicates that the rule will check parent child relationship when comparing spawned processes in the model

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • skipModified: (boolean)

          SkipModified indicates whether to trigger audits/incidents when a modified proc is spawned

        • whitelist: (string)
      • resources: (object)

        Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /policies/runtime/serverless

    SetServerlessRuntimePolicyRule adds the given serverless runtime policy rule. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • advancedProtection: (boolean)

      AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds for container, added whitelist rules for serverless) is enabled

    • cloudMetadataEnforcement: (boolean)

      CloudMetadataEnforcement indicates whether cloud metadata enforcement is enabled, to catch containers that access the cloud provider metadata api

    • customRules: (object)

      CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

      • _id: (integer)

        ID is the custom runtime rule id

      • action: (object)

        Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

    • disabled: (boolean)

      Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

    • dns: (object)

      DNS are the runtime DNS rules

      • blacklist: (string)
      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • whitelist: (string)
    • filesystem: (object)

      Filesystem contains configurations related to filesystem

      • backdoorFiles: (boolean)

        BackdoorFiles represents if backdoor files should be monitored (currently, ssh/administrative access files)

      • blacklist: (string)

        Blacklist is a list of paths to explicitly block file writes

      • checkNewFiles: (boolean)

        CheckNewFiles raises alert on every known file type (binary, secret) modification

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • whitelist: (string)

        Whitelist is a list of paths to ignore file writes

    • kubernetesEnforcement: (boolean)

      KubernetesEnforcement indicates whether Kubernetes enforcement is enabled

    • modified: (datetime)
    • name: (string)
    • network: (object)

      Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

      • blacklistIPs: (string)
      • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

        BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

        BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • detectPortScan: (boolean)

        DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

        SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

      • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

        SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

      • whitelistIPs: (string)

        WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

      • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

        WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

        WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
    • notes: (string)

      Notes are the rule's user notes

    • owner: (string)
    • previousName: (string)

      PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    • processes: (object)

      Processes are the process features that are enabled for this rule

      • blacklist: (string)
      • blockAllBinaries: (boolean)

        BlockAllBinaries indicates that all processes except the main process are blocked

      • checkCryptoMiners: (boolean)

        CheckCryptoMiners indicates that the rule will detect crypto miners

      • checkLateralMovement: (boolean)

        CheckLateralMovement indicates that the rule will processes that can be used for lateral movement exploit

      • checkNewBinaries: (boolean)

        CheckNewBinaries indicates that binaries that do not belong to the original image are not allowed to run

      • checkParentChild: (boolean)

        CheckParentChild indicates that the rule will check parent child relationship when comparing spawned processes in the model

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • skipModified: (boolean)

        SkipModified indicates whether to trigger audits/incidents when a modified proc is spawned

      • whitelist: (string)
    • resources: (object)

      Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/runtime/serverless

    Updates all serverless runtime rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove compliance rules is:

    1. Get all host runtime rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
 -X GET
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/serverless \
 | jq '.' > serverless_runtime_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your serverless_runtime_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
-X PUT \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/runtime/serverless \
--data-binary "@serverless_runtime_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the container runtime policy ID

    • learningDisabled: (boolean)

      LearningDisabled whether automatic behavioral learning is enabled

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of rules in the policy

      • advancedProtection: (boolean)

        AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds for container, added whitelist rules for serverless) is enabled

      • cloudMetadataEnforcement: (boolean)

        CloudMetadataEnforcement indicates whether cloud metadata enforcement is enabled, to catch containers that access the cloud provider metadata api

      • customRules: (object)

        CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

        • _id: (integer)

          ID is the custom runtime rule id

        • action: (object)

          Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • dns: (object)

        DNS are the runtime DNS rules

        • blacklist: (string)
        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • whitelist: (string)
      • filesystem: (object)

        Filesystem contains configurations related to filesystem

        • backdoorFiles: (boolean)

          BackdoorFiles represents if backdoor files should be monitored (currently, ssh/administrative access files)

        • blacklist: (string)

          Blacklist is a list of paths to explicitly block file writes

        • checkNewFiles: (boolean)

          CheckNewFiles raises alert on every known file type (binary, secret) modification

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • whitelist: (string)

          Whitelist is a list of paths to ignore file writes

      • kubernetesEnforcement: (boolean)

        KubernetesEnforcement indicates whether Kubernetes enforcement is enabled

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • network: (object)

        Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

        • blacklistIPs: (string)
        • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

          BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

          BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • detectPortScan: (boolean)

          DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

          SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

        • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

          SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

        • whitelistIPs: (string)

          WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

        • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

          WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

          WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • processes: (object)

        Processes are the process features that are enabled for this rule

        • blacklist: (string)
        • blockAllBinaries: (boolean)

          BlockAllBinaries indicates that all processes except the main process are blocked

        • checkCryptoMiners: (boolean)

          CheckCryptoMiners indicates that the rule will detect crypto miners

        • checkLateralMovement: (boolean)

          CheckLateralMovement indicates that the rule will processes that can be used for lateral movement exploit

        • checkNewBinaries: (boolean)

          CheckNewBinaries indicates that binaries that do not belong to the original image are not allowed to run

        • checkParentChild: (boolean)

          CheckParentChild indicates that the rule will check parent child relationship when comparing spawned processes in the model

        • effect: (object)

          Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • skipModified: (boolean)

          SkipModified indicates whether to trigger audits/incidents when a modified proc is spawned

        • whitelist: (string)
      • resources: (object)

        Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/runtime/serverless/encode get

    get

    EncodeServerlessRule encodes a serverless policy rule to base64. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    get /policies/runtime/serverless/encode

    EncodeServerlessRule encodes a serverless policy rule to base64. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • consoleAddr: (string)

      ConsoleAddr is the remote console address

    • function: (string)

      Function is the name of the function

    • updateIntervalMs: (integer)

      UpdateIntervalMs is the interval between defender policy requests from the console in milliseconds

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • data: (string)

      Data is a base64-encoded serverless runtime rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/secrets get put

    get

    Retrieves a list of all secrets rules.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    Updates all secrets rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    Each rule specifies how and where specified secrets from a given store are injected into running containers.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove secrets rules is:

    1. Get all secrets rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/secrets \
 | jq '.' > secrets_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your secrets_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/secrets \
--data-binary "@secrets_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/secrets

    Retrieves a list of all secrets rules.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal secret policy id

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of secret injection rules

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • injection: (object)

        Injection is the injection method (file or envvar). Range of acceptable values: envvar, filesystem

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • readAllPerm: (boolean)

        ReadAllPerm indicates whether file permissions of injected secrets allow read by root only or by all users

      • resources: (object)

        Resources are the resources that apply to the rule

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • secrets: (object)

        Secrets are the encrypted secrets to inject

        • folder: (string)

          Folder is one of the following:Cyberark: Name of the folder for secrets held in Cyberark storeHashicorp: The directory path for secrets held in Hashicorp storeAWS: The name of the secret in AWS Secrets Manager or AWS Parameter Store

        • key: (string)

          Key is the secret's identifier in the secrets store

        • name: (string)

          Name is the name of the secret as input from the user

        • safe: (string)

          Safe is the name of the safe, for secrets held in Cyberark store

        • store: (string)

          Store is the name of the secrets store where the secret is held

        • value: (object)

          Value is the secret's actual value

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • version: (string)

          Version is the Azure secret version

      • targetDir: (string)

        TargetDir is the target directory to inject secret files to if we choose filesystem injection

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/secrets

    Updates all secrets rules in a single shot. Updating all rules at the same time makes it possible to maintain strict ordering between rules.

    Each rule specifies how and where specified secrets from a given store are injected into running containers.

    The procedure to add, edit, or remove secrets rules is:

    1. Get all secrets rules using the GET endpoint.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all rules, pretty-print the JSON response, and save the results to a file.

     $ curl -k \
 -u <USER> \
 https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/secrets \
 | jq '.' > secrets_rules.json

    1. Modify the JSON output according to your needs.

    2. Update rules by pushing the new JSON payload.

      The following curl command installs the rules defined in your secrets_rules.json file. Do not forget to specify the @ symbol.

      $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
-H "Content-Type:application/json" \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/secrets \
--data-binary "@secrets_rules.json"

    Any previously installed rules are overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the internal secret policy id

    • rules: (object)

      Rules is the list of secret injection rules

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • injection: (object)

        Injection is the injection method (file or envvar). Range of acceptable values: envvar, filesystem

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • readAllPerm: (boolean)

        ReadAllPerm indicates whether file permissions of injected secrets allow read by root only or by all users

      • resources: (object)

        Resources are the resources that apply to the rule

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • secrets: (object)

        Secrets are the encrypted secrets to inject

        • folder: (string)

          Folder is one of the following:Cyberark: Name of the folder for secrets held in Cyberark storeHashicorp: The directory path for secrets held in Hashicorp storeAWS: The name of the secret in AWS Secrets Manager or AWS Parameter Store

        • key: (string)

          Key is the secret's identifier in the secrets store

        • name: (string)

          Name is the name of the secret as input from the user

        • safe: (string)

          Safe is the name of the safe, for secrets held in Cyberark store

        • store: (string)

          Store is the name of the secrets store where the secret is held

        • value: (object)

          Value is the secret's actual value

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • version: (string)

          Version is the Azure secret version

      • targetDir: (string)

        TargetDir is the target directory to inject secret files to if we choose filesystem injection

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/vulnerability/ci/images get put

    get

    ImageCIVulnerabilityPolicy returns the CI image vulnerabilities policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    put

    SetPolicy sets the given access/vulnerability or compliance policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/vulnerability/ci/images

    ImageCIVulnerabilityPolicy returns the CI image vulnerabilities policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Internal id representation

    • policyType: (object)

      Type is the policy type

    • rules: (object)

      Rules holds all policy rules

      • action: (string)

        Actions lists the effected actions

      • alertThreshold: (object)

        AlertThreshold is the threshold for assessing vulnerabilities

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disable indicates that all vulnerabilities are supressed

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity for which a vulnerability is added

      • allCompliance: (boolean)

        AllCompliance indicates whether to display all compliance checks (passed +failed)

      • auditAllowed: (boolean)

        AuditAllowed defines whether we audit successful transactions

      • blockMsg: (object)

        BlockMsg is the message that will be displayed when policy rule blocks

      • blockThreshold: (object)

        BlockThreshold is the threshold used for blocking vulnerabilities

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates that blocking is enabled

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity score for which blocking is enabled

      • condition: (object)

        Condition specifies policy enforcement conditions

        • device: (string)

          Device allowed volume host device (wildcard). If a container create command specifies a non matching host device, the action will be blocked.

        • readonly: (boolean)

          Readonly specifies whether or not a rule applies only to read only commands (AKA HTTP GET requests).

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities represents block and scan severity-based vulnerabilities conditions

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates whether this vulnerability should cause an access block

          • id: (integer)

            Id of the vulnerability

          • minSeverity: (number)

            MinSeverity is the minimal severity for which this rule applies (lower severity vulnerabilities will be filtered)

      • cveRules: (object)

        CVERules are rules associated with a specific vulnerability

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this CVE is allowed

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the allowed CVE

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID is the CVE to allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the effect which which applies if the rule applies. Range of acceptable values: allow, deny, block, alert

      • graceDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of days from time of publiciation for which a vulnerability is considered active

      • group: (string)

        Groups is the groups that are applicable to the policy

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • onlyFixed: (boolean)

        OnlyFixed indicates only fixed vulnerabilities should be included

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • principal: (string)

        Principals is the users that are applicable to the policy

      • resource: (string)

        Deprecated: Used to support older defenders prior to 2.3 - do not remove.

      • resources: (object)

        Resources is a list of resources for which this rule applies

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • tags: (object)

        tags are tag rules associated with a specific tag

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this tag has a specific action

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the tag

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag to ignore/alert

      • verbose: (boolean)

        Verbose indicates whether to display a detailed message when operation is blocked

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /policies/vulnerability/ci/images

    SetPolicy sets the given access/vulnerability or compliance policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Internal id representation

    • policyType: (object)

      Type is the policy type

    • rules: (object)

      Rules holds all policy rules

      • action: (string)

        Actions lists the effected actions

      • alertThreshold: (object)

        AlertThreshold is the threshold for assessing vulnerabilities

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disable indicates that all vulnerabilities are supressed

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity for which a vulnerability is added

      • allCompliance: (boolean)

        AllCompliance indicates whether to display all compliance checks (passed +failed)

      • auditAllowed: (boolean)

        AuditAllowed defines whether we audit successful transactions

      • blockMsg: (object)

        BlockMsg is the message that will be displayed when policy rule blocks

      • blockThreshold: (object)

        BlockThreshold is the threshold used for blocking vulnerabilities

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates that blocking is enabled

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity score for which blocking is enabled

      • condition: (object)

        Condition specifies policy enforcement conditions

        • device: (string)

          Device allowed volume host device (wildcard). If a container create command specifies a non matching host device, the action will be blocked.

        • readonly: (boolean)

          Readonly specifies whether or not a rule applies only to read only commands (AKA HTTP GET requests).

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities represents block and scan severity-based vulnerabilities conditions

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates whether this vulnerability should cause an access block

          • id: (integer)

            Id of the vulnerability

          • minSeverity: (number)

            MinSeverity is the minimal severity for which this rule applies (lower severity vulnerabilities will be filtered)

      • cveRules: (object)

        CVERules are rules associated with a specific vulnerability

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this CVE is allowed

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the allowed CVE

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID is the CVE to allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the effect which which applies if the rule applies. Range of acceptable values: allow, deny, block, alert

      • graceDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of days from time of publiciation for which a vulnerability is considered active

      • group: (string)

        Groups is the groups that are applicable to the policy

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • onlyFixed: (boolean)

        OnlyFixed indicates only fixed vulnerabilities should be included

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • principal: (string)

        Principals is the users that are applicable to the policy

      • resource: (string)

        Deprecated: Used to support older defenders prior to 2.3 - do not remove.

      • resources: (object)

        Resources is a list of resources for which this rule applies

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • tags: (object)

        tags are tag rules associated with a specific tag

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this tag has a specific action

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the tag

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag to ignore/alert

      • verbose: (boolean)

        Verbose indicates whether to display a detailed message when operation is blocked

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /policies/vulnerability/ci/serverless get put

    get

    CIServerlessVulnerabilityPolicy returns the CI serverless vulnerabilities policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    put

    SetPolicy sets the given access/vulnerability or compliance policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /policies/vulnerability/ci/serverless

    CIServerlessVulnerabilityPolicy returns the CI serverless vulnerabilities policy. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Internal id representation

    • policyType: (object)

      Type is the policy type

    • rules: (object)

      Rules holds all policy rules

      • action: (string)

        Actions lists the effected actions

      • alertThreshold: (object)

        AlertThreshold is the threshold for assessing vulnerabilities

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disable indicates that all vulnerabilities are supressed

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity for which a vulnerability is added

      • allCompliance: (boolean)

        AllCompliance indicates whether to display all compliance checks (passed +failed)

      • auditAllowed: (boolean)

        AuditAllowed defines whether we audit successful transactions

      • blockMsg: (object)

        BlockMsg is the message that will be displayed when policy rule blocks

      • blockThreshold: (object)

        BlockThreshold is the threshold used for blocking vulnerabilities

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates that blocking is enabled

        • value: (number)

          Value is the minimum severity score for which blocking is enabled

      • condition: (object)

        Condition specifies policy enforcement conditions

        • device: (string)

          Device allowed volume host device (wildcard). If a container create command specifies a non matching host device, the action will be blocked.

        • readonly: (boolean)

          Readonly specifies whether or not a rule applies only to read only commands (AKA HTTP GET requests).

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities represents block and scan severity-based vulnerabilities conditions

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates whether this vulnerability should cause an access block

          • id: (integer)

            Id of the vulnerability

          • minSeverity: (number)

            MinSeverity is the minimal severity for which this rule applies (lower severity vulnerabilities will be filtered)

      • cveRules: (object)

        CVERules are rules associated with a specific vulnerability

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this CVE is allowed

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the allowed CVE

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID is the CVE to allow

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect is the effect which which applies if the rule applies. Range of acceptable values: allow, deny, block, alert

      • graceDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of days from time of publiciation for which a vulnerability is considered active

      • group: (string)

        Groups is the groups that are applicable to the policy

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • onlyFixed: (boolean)

        OnlyFixed indicates only fixed vulnerabilities should be included

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

      • principal: (string)

        Principals is the users that are applicable to the policy

      • resource: (string)

        Deprecated: Used to support older defenders prior to 2.3 - do not remove.

      • resources: (object)

        Resources is a list of resources for which this rule applies

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • tags: (object)

        tags are tag rules associated with a specific tag

        • description: (string)

          Description is the description of why this tag has a specific action

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the relevant action: block/alert/none. Range of acceptable values: ignore, alert, block

        • expiration: (object)

          Expiration is the expiration date for the tag

          • date: (datetime)

            Date is the vulnerability expiration date

          • enabled: (boolean)

            Enabled indicates that the grace period is enabled

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag to ignore/alert

      • verbose: (boolean)

        Verbose indicates whether to display a detailed message when operation is blocked

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers
