        Text that explains the violation

      • title: (string)

        Title is the compliance title

      • twistlock: (boolean)

        Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

      • type: (object)

        Type is the vulnerability's type.

      • vecStr: (string)

        VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

      • vulnTagInfos: (object)

        VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

        • comment: (string)

          Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag name

    • vulnerabilitiesCount: (integer)

      VulnerabilitiesCount is the total number of vulnerabilities

    • vulnerabilityDistribution: (object)

      VulnerabilityDistribution is the distribution of vulnerability issues

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • vulnerabilityRiskScore: (number)

      VulnerabilityRiskScore is the image's CVE risk score

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Profiles

    Manage the runtime models (profiles) created for each image in your environment. For more information about how models are used to secure you running containers, see Runtime defense.

    /profiles/container get

    get

    Retrieves the details and state of all runtime models.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to install a list of all runtime models in the system:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/container

    Retrieves the details and state of all runtime models.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to install a list of all runtime models in the system:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Id is the profile ID

    • accountIDs: (string)

      AccountIDs are the cloud account IDs associated with the container runtime profile

    • archived: (boolean)

      Archive indicates whether this profile is archived

    • capabilities: (object)

      Capabilities are extended capabilities that are added to the profile based on static analysis

      • ci: (boolean)

        CI indicates the container allowed to write binaries to disk and run them

      • cloudMetadata: (boolean)

        CloudMetadata indicates the given container can query cloud metadata api

      • dnsCache: (boolean)

        DNSCache are DNS services that are used by all the pods in the cluster

      • k8s: (boolean)

        Kubernetes indicates the given container can perform k8s networking tasks (e.g., contact to api server)

      • proxy: (boolean)

        Proxy indicates the container can listen on any port and perform multiple outbound connection

      • sshd: (boolean)

        Sshd indicates whether the container can run sshd process

      • unpacker: (boolean)

        Unpacker indicates the container is allowed to write shared libraries to disk

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections to which this profile applies

    • created: (datetime)

      Created is the profile creation time

    • entrypoint: (string)

      Entrypoint is the image entrypoint

    • events: (object)

      Events are the last historical interactive process events for this profile, they are updated in a designated flow

      • _id: (string)

        ID is the history event entity

      • command: (string)

        Command is the process that was executed

      • hostname: (string)

        Hostname is the hostname on which the command was invoked

      • time: (datetime)

        Time is the time of the event

    • filesystem: (object)

      Filesystem is the profile filesystem metadata

      • behavioral: (object)

        Behavioral is filesystem data learned from behavioral analysis

        • mount: (boolean)

          Mount indicates whether the given folder is a mount

        • path: (string)

          Path is the file path

        • process: (string)

          Process is the process that accessed the file

        • time: (datetime)

          Time is the time in which the file was added

      • static: (object)

        Static is filesystem data learned from static analysis

        • mount: (boolean)

          Mount indicates whether the given folder is a mount

        • path: (string)

          Path is the file path

        • process: (string)

          Process is the process that accessed the file

        • time: (datetime)

          Time is the time in which the file was added

    • hash: (object)

      Hash is an uint32 hash associated with the profile

    • hostNetwork: (boolean)

      HostNetwork whether the instance share the network namespace with the host

    • hostPid: (boolean)

      HostPid indicates whether the instance share the pid namespace with the host

    • image: (string)

      Image is the image name that represents the image

    • imageID: (string)

      ImageID is the profile's image ID

    • infra: (boolean)

      InfraContainer indicates this is an infrastructure container

    • istio: (boolean)

      Istio states whether it is an istio-monitored profile

    • k8s: (object)

      K8s holds Kubernetes related data

      • clusterRoles: (object)

        ClusterRoles are the cluster roles of the associated service account

        • labels: (object)

          Labels are the labels associated with the role

          • key: (string)

            Key is the key of the label

          • value: (string)

            Value is the value of the label

        • name: (string)

          Name is the role name

        • roleBinding: (string)

          RoleBinding is the name of the role binding used for display

        • rules: (object)

          Rules are the list of rules associated with the cluster role

          • apiGroups: (string)
          • nonResourceURLs: (string)
          • resourceNames: (string)
          • resources: (string)
          • verbs: (string)
      • roles: (object)

        Roles are the roles of the associated service account

        • labels: (object)

          Labels are the labels associated with the role

          • key: (string)

            Key is the key of the label

          • value: (string)

            Value is the value of the label

        • name: (string)

          Name is the kubernetes role name

        • namespace: (string)

          Namespace is the namespace associated with the role

        • roleBinding: (string)

          RoleBinding is the name of the role binding used for display

        • rules: (object)

          Rules are the policy rules associated with the role

          • apiGroups: (string)
          • nonResourceURLs: (string)
          • resourceNames: (string)
          • resources: (string)
          • verbs: (string)
      • serviceAccount: (string)

        ServiceAccount is the service account used to access Kubernetes apiserverThis field will be empty if the container is not running inside of a Pod

    • label: (string)

      Label is the profile's label

    • lastUpdate: (datetime)

      Modified is the last time when this profile was modified

    • learnedStartup: (boolean)

      LearnedStartup indicates that startup events were learned

    • namespace: (string)

      Namespace is the k8s deployment namespace

    • network: (object)

      Network is the profile networking metadata

      • behavioral: (object)

        Behavioral is the behavioral network data learned from behavioral analysis

        • dnsQueries: (object)

          DNSQueries is the learned DNS queries

          • domainName: (string)

            DomainName is the queried domain name

          • domainType: (string)

            DomainType is the queried domain type

        • listeningPorts: (object)

          Listening is the learned listening ports

          • app: (string)

            App is the name of the app

          • portsData: (object)

            PortsData is listening port data for this app

            • all: (boolean)

              All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

            • ports: (object)

              Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

              • port: (integer)

                Port is the port number

              • time: (datetime)

                Time is the learning timestamp of this port

        • outboundPorts: (object)

          OutboundPorts is the learned outbound ports

          • all: (boolean)

            All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

          • ports: (object)

            Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

            • port: (integer)

              Port is the port number

            • time: (datetime)

              Time is the learning timestamp of this port

      • static: (object)

        Static is the static network data learned from static analysis

        • listeningPorts: (object)

          Listening are the listening ports learned by static analysis

          • app: (string)

            App is the name of the app

          • portsData: (object)

            PortsData is listening port data for this app

            • all: (boolean)

              All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

            • ports: (object)

              Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

              • port: (integer)

                Port is the port number

              • time: (datetime)

                Time is the learning timestamp of this port

    • os: (string)

      OS is the profile image OS

    • processes: (object)

      Processes is the profile processes metadata

      • behavioral: (object)

        Behavioral are process details learned from behavioral analysis

        • command: (string)

          Command is the executed command

        • md5: (string)

          MD5 is the process binary MD5 sum

        • modified: (boolean)

          Modified indicates the process binary was modified after the container has started

        • path: (string)

          Path is the process binary path

        • ppath: (string)

          PPath is the parent process path

        • time: (datetime)

          Time is the time in which the process was added. If the process was modified, Time is the modification time

      • static: (object)

        Static are process details learned from static analysis

        • command: (string)

          Command is the executed command

        • md5: (string)

          MD5 is the process binary MD5 sum

        • modified: (boolean)

          Modified indicates the process binary was modified after the container has started

        • path: (string)

          Path is the process binary path

        • ppath: (string)

          PPath is the parent process path

        • time: (datetime)

          Time is the time in which the process was added. If the process was modified, Time is the modification time

    • relearningCause: (string)

      RelearningCause is a string that describes the reasoning for a profile to enter the learning mode afterbeing activated

    • remainingLearningDurationSec: (number)

      RemainingLearningDurationSec represents the total time left that the system need to finish learning this image

    • state: (object)

      State is the current state of the profile. Range of acceptable values: learning, dryRun, learningExtended, manualLearning, manualRelearning, active, manualActive

    • version: (string)

      Version is the latest defender version for which this profile was updated

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/download get

    get

    Retrieves the details and state of all runtime models in CSV format

    The following example command uses curl to downlad a complete list in CSV format.

    NOTE: the -o option can help with saving the data to a file

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o {local_file_name} \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/download

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/container/download

    Retrieves the details and state of all runtime models in CSV format

    The following example command uses curl to downlad a complete list in CSV format.

    NOTE: the -o option can help with saving the data to a file

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o {local_file_name} \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/download

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/learn post

    post

    Puts all containers into relearn mode.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k -G \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /profiles/container/learn

    Puts all containers into relearn mode.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k -G \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/{id}/forensic get

    get

    Returns the forensic data for a container, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents.

    The following example command retrieves forensic data for a specific container, where id is the profle ID (model) that Twistlock created for the container, and hostname is the machine where the Defender detected the incident.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/{id}/forensic?hostname={hostname}"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/container/{id}/forensic

    Returns the forensic data for a container, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents.

    The following example command retrieves forensic data for a specific container, where id is the profle ID (model) that Twistlock created for the container, and hostname is the machine where the Defender detected the incident.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/{id}/forensic?hostname={hostname}"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • format: (string)

      Format is the forensic data format

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname for which data should be fetched

    • incidentID: (string)

      IncidentID is the incident ID in case the request kind is an incident

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit is the number of events to return

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • -: (object)

      SrcProfileHash is the source profile hash, used to resolve the source image

    • allPorts: (boolean)

      AllPorts indicates all listening ports are allowed

    • attack: (object)

      Attack is the event attack type. Range of acceptable values: cloudMetadataProbing, kubeletMetadataProbing, kubeletMetricProbing, kubectlSpawned, kubectlDownloaded, horizontalPortScanning, verticalPortScanning, explicitlyDeniedIP, customFeedIP, feedIP, unexpectedOutboundPort, suspiciousNetworkActivity, unexpectedListeningPort, explicitlyDeniedListeningPort, explicitlyDeniedOutboundPort, listeningPortModifiedProcess, outboundPortModifiedProcess, feedDNS, explicitlyDeniedDNS, dnsQuery, unexpectedProcess, portScanProcess, malwareProcessCustom, malwareProcessFeed, explicitlyDeniedProcess, modifiedProcess, cryptoMinerProcess, lateralMovementProcess, policyHijacked, administrativeAccount, sshAccess, explicitlyDeniedFile, malwareFileCustom, malwareFileFeed, execFileAccess, elfFileAccess, secretFileAccess, regFileAccess, fileIntegrity, alteredBinary, malwareDownloaded, suspiciousELFHeader, customRule, unexpectedApp

    • category: (object)

      Category is the incident category. Range of acceptable values: portScanning, hijackedProcess, dataExfiltration, kubernetes, backdoorAdministrativeAccount, backdoorSSHAccess, cryptoMiner, lateralMovement, bruteForce, serviceViolation, customRule, alteredBinary, suspiciousBinary

    • command: (string)

      Command is the event command

    • containerId: (string)

      ContainerID is the event container id

    • dstIP: (string)

      DstIP is the destination IP of the connection

    • dstPort: (object)

      DstPort is the destination port

    • dstProfileID: (string)

      DstProfileID is the profile ID of the connection destination

    • effect: (string)

      Effect is the runtime audit effect

    • listeningStartTime: (datetime)

      listeningStartTime is the port listening start time

    • message: (string)

      Message is the runtime audit message

    • networkCollectionType: (object)

      NetworkCollectionType is the type of the network collection method

    • outbound: (boolean)

      Outbound indicates if the port is outbound

    • path: (string)

      Path is the event path

    • pid: (integer)

      Pid is the event process id

    • port: (integer)

      Port is the listening port

    • ppid: (integer)

      PPid is the event parent process id

    • process: (string)

      Process is the event process

    • srcIP: (string)

      SrcIP is the source IP of the connection

    • srcProfileID: (string)

      SrcProfileID is the profile ID of the connection source

    • static: (boolean)

      Static indicates the event was added to the profile without behavioral indication

    • timestamp: (datetime)

      Timestamp is the event timestamp

    • type: (object)

      Type is the event type. Range of acceptable values: Process spawned, Binary created, Container started, Listening port, Connection established, Runtime audit, Runtime profile process, Runtime profile filesystem, Runtime profile networking, Incident

    • user: (string)

      User is the event user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/{id}/forensic/bundle get

    get

    Returns the forensic data for a container, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents. This will return a tar.gz file as a zipped file.

    The following example command retrieves forensic data for a specific container, where id is the profle ID (model) that Twistlock created for the container, and hostname is the machine where the Defender detected the incident.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o twistlock_container_forensics.tar.gz
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/{id}/forensic/bundle?hostname={hostname}"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/container/{id}/forensic/bundle

    Returns the forensic data for a container, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents. This will return a tar.gz file as a zipped file.

    The following example command retrieves forensic data for a specific container, where id is the profle ID (model) that Twistlock created for the container, and hostname is the machine where the Defender detected the incident.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o twistlock_container_forensics.tar.gz
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/{id}/forensic/bundle?hostname={hostname}"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • format: (string)

      Format is the forensic data format

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname for which data should be fetched

    • incidentID: (string)

      IncidentID is the incident ID in case the request kind is an incident

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit is the number of events to return

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/{id}/hosts get

    get

    Return the host/hosts where this container is running.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/container endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/hosts

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/container/{id}/hosts

    Return the host/hosts where this container is running.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/container endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/hosts

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/{id}/learn post

    post

    Specify the learning mode for a profile.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/container endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"state":"manualLearning"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /profiles/container/{id}/learn

    Specify the learning mode for a profile.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/container endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"state":"manualLearning"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • profileID: (string)

      ID is the profile ID to relearn

    • state: (object)

      State is the target profile state. Range of acceptable values: learning, dryRun, learningExtended, manualLearning, manualRelearning, active, manualActive

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/container/{id}/rule get

    get

    Return the runtime rule/policy that is associated with this container.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/container endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/rule

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    get /profiles/container/{id}/rule

    Return the runtime rule/policy that is associated with this container.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/container endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/rule

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • advancedProtection: (boolean)

      AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds for container, added whitelist rules for serverless) is enabled

    • cloudMetadataEnforcement: (boolean)

      CloudMetadataEnforcement indicates whether cloud metadata enforcement is enabled, to catch containers that access the cloud provider metadata api

    • customRules: (object)

      CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

      • _id: (integer)

        ID is the custom runtime rule id

      • action: (object)

        Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

    • disabled: (boolean)

      Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

    • dns: (object)

      DNS are the runtime DNS rules

      • blacklist: (string)
      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • whitelist: (string)
    • filesystem: (object)

      Filesystem contains configurations related to filesystem

      • backdoorFiles: (boolean)

        BackdoorFiles represents if backdoor files should be monitored (currently, ssh/administrative access files)

      • blacklist: (string)

        Blacklist is a list of paths to explicitly block file writes

      • checkNewFiles: (boolean)

        CheckNewFiles raises alert on every known file type (binary, secret) modification

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • whitelist: (string)

        Whitelist is a list of paths to ignore file writes

    • kubernetesEnforcement: (boolean)

      KubernetesEnforcement indicates whether Kubernetes enforcement is enabled

    • modified: (datetime)
    • name: (string)
    • network: (object)

      Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

      • blacklistIPs: (string)
      • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

        BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

        BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • detectPortScan: (boolean)

        DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

        SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

      • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

        SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

      • whitelistIPs: (string)

        WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

      • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

        WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

        WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
    • notes: (string)

      Notes are the rule's user notes

    • owner: (string)
    • previousName: (string)

      PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    • processes: (object)

      Processes are the process features that are enabled for this rule

      • blacklist: (string)
      • blockAllBinaries: (boolean)

        BlockAllBinaries indicates that all processes except the main process are blocked

      • checkCryptoMiners: (boolean)

        CheckCryptoMiners indicates that the rule will detect crypto miners

      • checkLateralMovement: (boolean)

        CheckLateralMovement indicates that the rule will processes that can be used for lateral movement exploit

      • checkNewBinaries: (boolean)

        CheckNewBinaries indicates that binaries that do not belong to the original image are not allowed to run

      • checkParentChild: (boolean)

        CheckParentChild indicates that the rule will check parent child relationship when comparing spawned processes in the model

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • skipModified: (boolean)

        SkipModified indicates whether to trigger audits/incidents when a modified proc is spawned

      • whitelist: (string)
    • resources: (object)

      Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/host get

    get

    Retrieves the details and state of each host service runtime model on a host-by-host basis. The returned JSON object has the following structure:

    • host1:
    • service1: model
    • service2: model
    • host2:
    • service1: model
    • service3: model
    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/host

    Retrieves the details and state of each host service runtime model on a host-by-host basis. The returned JSON object has the following structure:

    • host1:
    • service1: model
    • service2: model
    • host2:
    • service1: model
    • service3: model
    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • devices: (object)

      Devices are a map from host network device name to IP address

      • ip: (string)

        IP is the network device IPv4 address

      • name: (string)

        Name is the network device name

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname represents the host name

    • services: (object)

      Services holds service profile for all running services on host

      • _id: (string)

        ID represents the service name

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs are the cloud accounts associated with the profile

      • collections: (string)

        Collections are the applied collections

      • created: (datetime)

        Created is the profile creation time

      • hash: (object)

        Hash is the service profile hash

      • hosts: (object)

        Hosts is a map of hosts in which the service is running on

      • modified: (datetime)

        Modified is the last modification time

      • network: (object)

        Network is the profile networking metadata

        • capabilities: (object)

          Capabilities contains the service networking capabilities (DNS caches and proxy)

          • ci: (boolean)

            CI indicates the container allowed to write binaries to disk and run them

          • cloudMetadata: (boolean)

            CloudMetadata indicates the given container can query cloud metadata api

          • dnsCache: (boolean)

            DNSCache are DNS services that are used by all the pods in the cluster

          • k8s: (boolean)

            Kubernetes indicates the given container can perform k8s networking tasks (e.g., contact to api server)

          • proxy: (boolean)

            Proxy indicates the container can listen on any port and perform multiple outbound connection

          • sshd: (boolean)

            Sshd indicates whether the container can run sshd process

          • unpacker: (boolean)

            Unpacker indicates the container is allowed to write shared libraries to disk

        • listeningPorts: (object)

          ListeningPorts is the learned listening ports

          • all: (boolean)

            All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

          • ports: (object)

            Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

            • port: (integer)

              Port is the port number

            • time: (datetime)

              Time is the learning timestamp of this port

        • outboundPorts: (object)

          OutboundPorts is the learned outbound ports

          • all: (boolean)

            All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

          • ports: (object)

            Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

            • port: (integer)

              Port is the port number

            • time: (datetime)

              Time is the learning timestamp of this port

      • path: (string)

        Path is the service main process path

      • privileged: (boolean)

        Privileged indicates whether the service is privileged (privileged services do not learn or audit on capabilities)

      • relearningCause: (string)

        RelearningCause indicates the cause for relearning state

      • remainingLearningDurationSec: (number)

        RemainingLearningDurationSec represents the total time left that the system need to finish learning the service

      • state: (object)

        State is the service runtime profile state. Range of acceptable values: learning, dryRun, learningExtended, manualLearning, manualRelearning, active, manualActive

      • user: (string)

        User represents the service user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/host/download get

    get

    Retrieves the details and state of each host service runtime model in CSV format.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o {local_file_name} \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host/download

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/host/download

    Retrieves the details and state of each host service runtime model in CSV format.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o {local_file_name} \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host/download

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/host/{id}/forensic get

    get

    Returns the forensic data for a host, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host/{id}/forensic"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/host/{id}/forensic

    Returns the forensic data for a host, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host/{id}/forensic"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • format: (string)

      Format is the forensic data format

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname for which data should be fetched

    • incidentID: (string)

      IncidentID is the incident ID in case the request kind is an incident

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit is the number of events to return

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • attack: (object)

      Attack is the event attack type. Range of acceptable values: cloudMetadataProbing, kubeletMetadataProbing, kubeletMetricProbing, kubectlSpawned, kubectlDownloaded, horizontalPortScanning, verticalPortScanning, explicitlyDeniedIP, customFeedIP, feedIP, unexpectedOutboundPort, suspiciousNetworkActivity, unexpectedListeningPort, explicitlyDeniedListeningPort, explicitlyDeniedOutboundPort, listeningPortModifiedProcess, outboundPortModifiedProcess, feedDNS, explicitlyDeniedDNS, dnsQuery, unexpectedProcess, portScanProcess, malwareProcessCustom, malwareProcessFeed, explicitlyDeniedProcess, modifiedProcess, cryptoMinerProcess, lateralMovementProcess, policyHijacked, administrativeAccount, sshAccess, explicitlyDeniedFile, malwareFileCustom, malwareFileFeed, execFileAccess, elfFileAccess, secretFileAccess, regFileAccess, fileIntegrity, alteredBinary, malwareDownloaded, suspiciousELFHeader, customRule, unexpectedApp

    • capability: (object)

      Capability is the event capability. Range of acceptable values: SYSTEM_LOGS, DOCKER, DOCKER_SOCKET, USERS_ADMIN, INSTALLER, KUBERNETES, OPENSHIFT, SSH, SHELL, NET, HOSTS_CONFIG, SERVICE_OPERATOR, GCLOUD, PRIVILEGED_PROCESSES, SECRETS_MANAGER

    • category: (object)

      Category is the incident category. Range of acceptable values: portScanning, hijackedProcess, dataExfiltration, kubernetes, backdoorAdministrativeAccount, backdoorSSHAccess, cryptoMiner, lateralMovement, bruteForce, serviceViolation, customRule, alteredBinary, suspiciousBinary

    • command: (string)

      Command is the event command

    • effect: (string)

      Effect is the runtime audit effect

    • interactive: (boolean)

      Interactive indicates if the event is interactive

    • listeningStartTime: (datetime)

      ListeningStartTime is the listening port start time

    • message: (string)

      Message is the runtime audit message

    • path: (string)

      Path is the event path

    • pid: (integer)

      Pid is the event process id

    • port: (integer)

      Port is the listening port

    • ppath: (string)

      Path is the event parent path

    • ppid: (integer)

      PPid is the event parent process id

    • process: (string)

      Process is the event process

    • service: (string)

      Service is the event service

    • timestamp: (datetime)

      Timestamp is the event timestamp

    • type: (object)

      Type is the event type. Range of acceptable values: Process spawned, Listening port, Binary created, Runtime audit, Runtime profile, Incident

    • user: (string)

      User is the event user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/host/{id}/forensic/download get

    get

    Downloads the forensic data for a host, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: text/cvs' \
-X GET \
-o host_forensic.csv
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host/{id}/forensic/download"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/host/{id}/forensic/download

    Downloads the forensic data for a host, which can be used to investigate runtime incidents.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: text/cvs' \
-X GET \
-o host_forensic.csv
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/host/{id}/forensic/download"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • format: (string)

      Format is the forensic data format

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname for which data should be fetched

    • incidentID: (string)

      IncidentID is the incident ID in case the request kind is an incident

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit is the number of events to return

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/host/{id}/rule get

    get

    Return the runtime rule/policy that is associated with this host.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/host endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/host/container/<PROFILE_ID>/rule

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    get /profiles/host/{id}/rule

    Return the runtime rule/policy that is associated with this host.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/host endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/host/container/<PROFILE_ID>/rule

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • advancedProtection: (object)

      AdvancedProtection indicates whether advance protection (custom or premium feeds) is enabled. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

    • anomalousAppDetection: (object)

      AnomalousAppsDetection is the anomalous app detection rule

      • blacklist: (string)

        Blacklist is the blacklist app list

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates that anomalous app detection is enabled

      • whitelist: (string)

        Whitelist is the whitelist app list

    • capabilitiesEffect: (object)

      CapabilitiesEffect is the runtime effect when there is no specific rule to apply for the event. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

    • cryptoMiners: (object)

      CryptoMiners indicates whether to detect crypto miners or not and what effect to apply. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

    • customRules: (object)

      CustomRules is a list of custom rules associated with the container runtime policy

      • _id: (integer)

        ID is the custom runtime rule id

      • action: (object)

        Action is the action to apply when the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: audit, incident

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, allow

    • disabled: (boolean)

      Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

    • dns: (object)

      DNS are the runtime DNS rules

      • blacklist: (string)
      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • whitelist: (string)
    • fileIntegrityRules: (object)

      FileIntegrityRules are the file integrity monitoring rules

      • dir: (boolean)

        Dir indicates that the path is a directory

      • exclusions: (string)

        Exclusions are filenames that should be ignored while generating auditsThese filenames may contain a wildcard regex pattern, e.g. foo*.log, *.cache

      • metadata: (boolean)

        Metadata indicates that metadata changes should be monitored (e.g. chmod, chown)

      • path: (string)

        Path is the path to monitor

      • procWhitelist: (string)

        ProcWhitelist are the processes to ignoreFilesystem events caused by these processes DO NOT generate file integrity events

      • read: (boolean)

        Read indicates that reads operations should be monitored

      • recursive: (boolean)

        Recursive indicates that monitoring should be recursive

      • write: (boolean)

        Write indicates that write operations should be monitored

    • forensic: (object)

      Forensic are the host forensic settings

      • activitiesDisabled: (boolean)

        ActivitiesDisabled indicates if the host activity collection is enabled/disabled

      • dockerEnabled: (boolean)

        DockerEnabled indicates whether docker commands are collected

      • readonlyDockerEnabled: (boolean)

        ReadonlyDockerEnabled indicates whether docker readonly commands are collected

      • serviceActivitiesEnabled: (boolean)

        ServiceActivitiesEnabled indicates whether activities from services are collected

      • sshdEnabled: (boolean)

        SshdEnabled indicates whether ssh commands are collected

      • sudoEnabled: (boolean)

        SudoEnabled indicates whether sudo commands are collected

    • logInspectionRules: (object)

      LogInspectionRules is a list of log inspection rules

      • path: (string)

        Path is the log path

      • regex: (string)

        Regex are the regular expressions associated with the rule if it is a custom one

    • modified: (datetime)
    • name: (string)
    • network: (object)

      Network are the networking features that are enabled for this rule

      • blacklistIPs: (string)
      • blacklistListeningPorts: (object)

        BlacklistListeningPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • blacklistOutboundPorts: (object)

        BlacklistOutboundPorts are the blacklist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • detectPortScan: (boolean)

        DetectPortScan indicates whether port scanning detection is enabled

      • effect: (object)

        Effect represents what happens when an event that violates the rule is triggered. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

      • skipModifiedProc: (boolean)

        SkipModifiedProc indicates whether alert should be triggerd when a modified process perform malicious networking activity

      • skipRawSockets: (boolean)

        SkipRawSockets indicates whether raw socket detection should be skipped

      • whitelistIPs: (string)

        WhitelistIPs are the ips to ignore in runtie rules

      • whitelistListeningPorts: (object)

        WhitelistListeningPorts are the whitelist listening ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
      • whitelistOutboundPorts: (object)

        WhitelistOutboundPorts are the whitelist outbound ports

        • deny: (boolean)

          Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

        • end: (integer)
        • start: (integer)
    • notes: (string)

      Notes are the rule's user notes

    • owner: (string)
    • previousName: (string)

      PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    • resources: (object)

      Resources represents the resources for which this rule apply

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)
    • serviceRules: (object)

      ServiceRules is a list of rules how to act when an service attempts to obtain each capability

      • capabilities: (object)

        Capabilities is a list of capability rules

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the runtime effect that will be applied if the model is not used and the capability is not allowed. Range of acceptable values: block, prevent, alert, disable

        • type: (object)

          Type is the capability type. Range of acceptable values: SYSTEM_LOGS, DOCKER, DOCKER_SOCKET, USERS_ADMIN, INSTALLER, KUBERNETES, OPENSHIFT, SSH, SHELL, NET, HOSTS_CONFIG, SERVICE_OPERATOR, GCLOUD, PRIVILEGED_PROCESSES, SECRETS_MANAGER

      • serviceName: (string)

        ServiceName is the name of the service

    • staticProfiles: (boolean)

      StaticProfilesEnabled indicates whether to use Twistlock static service profiles or not

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/service get

    get

    Retrieves the details and state of all host service runtime models. The returned JSON object has the following structure:

    • service1: model
    • service2: model
    • service3: model
    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/service

    Retrieves the details and state of all host service runtime models. The returned JSON object has the following structure:

    • service1: model
    • service2: model
    • service3: model
    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID represents the service name

    • accountIDs: (string)

      AccountIDs are the cloud accounts associated with the profile

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are the applied collections

    • created: (datetime)

      Created is the profile creation time

    • hash: (object)

      Hash is the service profile hash

    • hosts: (object)

      Hosts is a map of hosts in which the service is running on

    • modified: (datetime)

      Modified is the last modification time

    • network: (object)

      Network is the profile networking metadata

      • capabilities: (object)

        Capabilities contains the service networking capabilities (DNS caches and proxy)

        • ci: (boolean)

          CI indicates the container allowed to write binaries to disk and run them

        • cloudMetadata: (boolean)

          CloudMetadata indicates the given container can query cloud metadata api

        • dnsCache: (boolean)

          DNSCache are DNS services that are used by all the pods in the cluster

        • k8s: (boolean)

          Kubernetes indicates the given container can perform k8s networking tasks (e.g., contact to api server)

        • proxy: (boolean)

          Proxy indicates the container can listen on any port and perform multiple outbound connection

        • sshd: (boolean)

          Sshd indicates whether the container can run sshd process

        • unpacker: (boolean)

          Unpacker indicates the container is allowed to write shared libraries to disk

      • listeningPorts: (object)

        ListeningPorts is the learned listening ports

        • all: (boolean)

          All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

        • ports: (object)

          Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

          • port: (integer)

            Port is the port number

          • time: (datetime)

            Time is the learning timestamp of this port

      • outboundPorts: (object)

        OutboundPorts is the learned outbound ports

        • all: (boolean)

          All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

        • ports: (object)

          Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

          • port: (integer)

            Port is the port number

          • time: (datetime)

            Time is the learning timestamp of this port

    • path: (string)

      Path is the service main process path

    • privileged: (boolean)

      Privileged indicates whether the service is privileged (privileged services do not learn or audit on capabilities)

    • relearningCause: (string)

      RelearningCause indicates the cause for relearning state

    • remainingLearningDurationSec: (number)

      RemainingLearningDurationSec represents the total time left that the system need to finish learning the service

    • state: (object)

      State is the service runtime profile state. Range of acceptable values: learning, dryRun, learningExtended, manualLearning, manualRelearning, active, manualActive

    • user: (string)

      User represents the service user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/service/download get

    get

    Retrieves the details and state of all host service runtime models in CSV format

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: text/csv' \
-X GET \
-o profiles-service.csv \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service/download

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/service/download

    Retrieves the details and state of all host service runtime models in CSV format

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: text/csv' \
-X GET \
-o profiles-service.csv \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service/download

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

      Example:

    /profiles/service/learn post

    post

    Specify the learning mode for all host service profiles.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for all host service profiles.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /profiles/service/learn

    Specify the learning mode for all host service profiles.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for all host service profiles.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.
