    /profiles/service/names get

    get

    Retrieves the name of all host service runtime models from withign the app at Monitor > Runtime > Host-models

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve this data:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service/names

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /profiles/service/names

    Retrieves the name of all host service runtime models from withign the app at Monitor > Runtime > Host-models

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve this data:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/service/names

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostName: (string)

      Hosts is the runtime profile hostname filter

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the runtime profile id filter

    • image: (string)

      Images is the runtime profile image filter

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces is the runtime profile k8s namespace filter

    • os: (string)

      OS is the service runtime profile OS filter

    • state: (string)

      States is the runtime profile state filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /profiles/service/{id}/learn post

    post

    Specify the learning mode for a host service profile.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/service endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID. The PROFILE_ID is typically the service's name, such as sshd or ntpd.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a host service profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"state":"manualLearning"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /profiles/service/{id}/learn

    Specify the learning mode for a host service profile.

    To get the PROFILE_ID for a profile:

    1. Retrieve a list of profiles using the GET method on the /api/v1/profiles/service endpoint.

    2. For the profile of interest, copy the value in _id. This is the PROFILE_ID. The PROFILE_ID is typically the service's name, such as sshd or ntpd.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to specify the learning mode for a host service profile.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"state":"manualLearning"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/profiles/container/<PROFILE_ID>/learn

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • profileID: (string)

      ID is the profile ID to relearn

    • state: (object)

      State is the target profile state. Range of acceptable values: learning, dryRun, learningExtended, manualLearning, manualRelearning, active, manualActive

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Projects

    Manage Projects.

    Before you can provision a project using this endpoint, you must designate one instance of Console as master using the POST /api/v1/settings/projects endpoint.

    Accessing the REST API of a supervisor Console

    After enabling projects and provisioning a new project, access to the supervisor Console is proxied through Central Console. You cannot access a supervisor's REST API directly. All API requests to a supervisor must be made through Central Console.

    To retrieve data from a project, add the the following query parameter to your request:

    project=<PROJECT_NAME>

    Where the default value for project is Central+Console. If project is not specified, it is set to Central+Console.

    For example, to retrieve the compliance policies for a tenant project named mobile_payments_division, use the following curl command:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/policies/compliance?project=mobile_payments_division

    Not all REST endpoints are proxied to the supervisor. It largely depends on the project type (tenant or supervisor). In some cases, requests cannot be proxied because management of that system is delegated to Central Console only. Proxying a request to the right project is mostly a concern for tenant projects, which operate with their own policies and settings.

    The following user management endpoints can be accessed from Central Console only. An administrator centrally manages all users, and specifies who has access to which projects. These calls are handled by Central Console only.

    • /api/v1/users
    • /api/v1/groups
    • /api/v1/projects

    The following endpoints are proxied to the relevant supervisor for tenant projects only.

    • /api/v1/policies
    • /api/v1/trust
    • /api/v1/settings
    • /api/v1/collections
    • /api/v1/feeds

    The following endpoints are proxied to the relevant supervisor for both tenant and scale projects:

    • /api/v1/settings/alerts
    • /api/v1/alert-profiles
    • /api/v1/settings/regisry
    • /api/v1/settings/certs
    • /api/v1/settings/secrets
    • /api/v1/policies/secrets

    /projects get post

    get

    Lists all projects visible to the given user.

    Assuming the given user is an admin, the following example curl command would list all projects:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post

    Provisions a new project.

    The following example curl command provisions a new project named my-project.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"_id":"my-project",
"type":"tenant",
"address":"https://<SUPERVISOR_CONSOLE>:8083"
}' \
https://<CENTRAL_CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects

    If you have installed a new instance of Console, and you have already created an initial admin user for it, then you can specify the admin username name and password when you provision the project.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"_id":"my-project",
"type":"tenant",
"address":"https://<SUPERVISOR_CONSOLE>:8083",
"username":"henry",
"password":{"plain":"testing123"}
}' \
https://<CENTRAL_CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /projects

    Lists all projects visible to the given user.

    Assuming the given user is an admin, the following example curl command would list all projects:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the project name (primary index)

    • address: (string)

      Address is the project address

    • ca: (object)

      CACertificate is the remote console CA certificate

    • creationTime: (datetime)

      CreationTime is the remote project creation time

    • err: (string)

      Err are errors that happened during project synchronization / setup

    • password: (object)

      Password is the encrypted remote project password

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • skipCertificateVerification: (boolean)

      SkipCertificateVerification indicates that the connection to the secondary project is done on insecure channel, this is used when secondaryproject is behind a proxy or when customer is using custom certs

    • syncTS: (datetime)

      lastSync is the last sync time for scale projects

    • type: (object)

      Type is either tenant or scale. Range of acceptable values: tenant, scale

    • username: (string)

      Username is the remote project username

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /projects

    Provisions a new project.

    The following example curl command provisions a new project named my-project.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"_id":"my-project",
"type":"tenant",
"address":"https://<SUPERVISOR_CONSOLE>:8083"
}' \
https://<CENTRAL_CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects

    If you have installed a new instance of Console, and you have already created an initial admin user for it, then you can specify the admin username name and password when you provision the project.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"_id":"my-project",
"type":"tenant",
"address":"https://<SUPERVISOR_CONSOLE>:8083",
"username":"henry",
"password":{"plain":"testing123"}
}' \
https://<CENTRAL_CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the project name (primary index)

    • address: (string)

      Address is the project address

    • ca: (object)

      CACertificate is the remote console CA certificate

    • creationTime: (datetime)

      CreationTime is the remote project creation time

    • err: (string)

      Err are errors that happened during project synchronization / setup

    • password: (object)

      Password is the encrypted remote project password

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • skipCertificateVerification: (boolean)

      SkipCertificateVerification indicates that the connection to the secondary project is done on insecure channel, this is used when secondaryproject is behind a proxy or when customer is using custom certs

    • syncTS: (datetime)

      lastSync is the last sync time for scale projects

    • type: (object)

      Type is either tenant or scale. Range of acceptable values: tenant, scale

    • username: (string)

      Username is the remote project username

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the project name (primary index)

    • address: (string)

      Address is the project address

    • ca: (object)

      CACertificate is the remote console CA certificate

    • creationTime: (datetime)

      CreationTime is the remote project creation time

    • err: (string)

      Err are errors that happened during project synchronization / setup

    • password: (object)

      Password is the encrypted remote project password

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • skipCertificateVerification: (boolean)

      SkipCertificateVerification indicates that the connection to the secondary project is done on insecure channel, this is used when secondaryproject is behind a proxy or when customer is using custom certs

    • syncTS: (datetime)

      lastSync is the last sync time for scale projects

    • type: (object)

      Type is either tenant or scale. Range of acceptable values: tenant, scale

    • username: (string)

      Username is the remote project username

    Secured by basicAuth

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /projects/{id} delete put

    delete

    Deletes a project from the system.

    The following example curl command deletes a project named <PROJECT_NAME>. The value for <PROJECT_NAME> can be retrieved from the _id field in the response object from GET /api/v1/projects.

    The DELETE method returns the decommissioned supervisor's admin username and password.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects/<PROJECT_NAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    put

    Updates a project.

    The following example curl command updates a project named <PROJECT_NAME>. The value for <PROJECT_NAME> can be retrieved from the _id field in the response object from GET /api/v1/projects.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects/<PROJECT_NAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    delete /projects/{id}

    Deletes a project from the system.

    The following example curl command deletes a project named <PROJECT_NAME>. The value for <PROJECT_NAME> can be retrieved from the _id field in the response object from GET /api/v1/projects.

    The DELETE method returns the decommissioned supervisor's admin username and password.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects/<PROJECT_NAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • password: (string)

      Password is the password used for the deleted project access

    • user: (string)

      User is the user used for the deleted project access

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /projects/{id}

    Updates a project.

    The following example curl command updates a project named <PROJECT_NAME>. The value for <PROJECT_NAME> can be retrieved from the _id field in the response object from GET /api/v1/projects.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X PUT \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/projects/<PROJECT_NAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the project name (primary index)

    • address: (string)

      Address is the project address

    • ca: (object)

      CACertificate is the remote console CA certificate

    • creationTime: (datetime)

      CreationTime is the remote project creation time

    • err: (string)

      Err are errors that happened during project synchronization / setup

    • password: (object)

      Password is the encrypted remote project password

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • skipCertificateVerification: (boolean)

      SkipCertificateVerification indicates that the connection to the secondary project is done on insecure channel, this is used when secondaryproject is behind a proxy or when customer is using custom certs

    • syncTS: (datetime)

      lastSync is the last sync time for scale projects

    • type: (object)

      Type is either tenant or scale. Range of acceptable values: tenant, scale

    • username: (string)

      Username is the remote project username

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      ID is the project name (primary index)

    • address: (string)

      Address is the project address

    • ca: (object)

      CACertificate is the remote console CA certificate

      CreationTime is the remote project creation time

      Err are errors that happened during project synchronization / setup

      Password is the encrypted remote project password

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • syncTS: (datetime)

      lastSync is the last sync time for scale projects

    • type: (object)

      Type is either tenant or scale. Range of acceptable values: tenant, scale

      Username is the remote project username

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Radar

    Radar is the primary interface for visualizing your environment. It is designed to let you navigate through all the data Twistlock has collected about your environment.

    /radar/container delete get

    delete

    Deletes a learned connection between two containers.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container?dstProfileID=sha256:<IMAGE_HASH>&srcProfileID=sha256:<IMAGE_HASH>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get

    Returns data from Console's Radar page (container view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    delete /radar/container

    Deletes a learned connection between two containers.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container?dstProfileID=sha256:<IMAGE_HASH>&srcProfileID=sha256:<IMAGE_HASH>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • dstProfileID: (string)

      DstProfileID is the connection destination profile ID

    • srcProfileID: (string)

      SrcProfileID is the connection source profile ID

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    get /radar/container

    Returns data from Console's Radar page (container view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostname: (string)

      Hosts is used to filter containers by host

    • id: (string)

      IDs is used to filter container by container ID

    • image: (string)

      Images is used to filter containers by image name

    • imageId: (string)

      ImageIDs is used to filter containers by image ids

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces are the namespaces to filter

    • profileId: (string)

      ProfileIDs is used to filter container by runtime profile ID

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • containerCount: (integer)

      ContainerCount is the total number of containers

    • radar: (object)

      Radar holds all radar entities

      • _id: (string)
      • accountID: (string)

        AccountID is the cloud provider account ID

      • complianceDistribution: (object)

        ComplianceDistribution is the distribution of compliance issues

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • consul: (boolean)

        Consul states whether it is a consul container

      • containerCount: (integer)

        ContainerCount is the amount of containers per entity

      • distro: (string)
      • dns: (boolean)

        DNS states whether this is a DNS node

      • filesystemCount: (integer)
      • firewallProtected: (boolean)

        FirewallProtected indicates the entity is protected by firewall

      • geoip: (object)

        GeoIP is a list of last outgoing ip addresses and their origin countries

        • -: (boolean)

          Throttle indicates that geoip requests should be throttled to avoid burst of requests

        • countries: (object)

          Countries is a list of ip addresses with their corresponding country codes

          • code: (string)

            Code is the country iso code

          • ip: (string)

            IP is the ip address

          • modified: (datetime)

            Modified is the last modified time of this entry

        • modified: (datetime)

          Modified is the last modified time of the cache

      • hasDNSConnection: (boolean)

        HasDNSConnection states whether the node has DNS connection

      • hostCount: (integer)
      • hostname: (string)
      • imageID: (string)

        ImageID is the entity's image ID

      • imageName: (string)

        ImageName is the entity's image name

      • imageNames: (string)

        ImageNames are the names of the image associated with the radar entity

      • incidentCount: (integer)

        IncidentCount is the number of incidents

      • incomingConnections: (object)

        IncomingConnections are the radar entity incoming connections

        • istioConditions: (object)

          Conditions are the match requests for routing rules, the array is ORed together so that it's enough for one Conditions to match

          • matches: (object)

            Matches are the match requests for routing rules, the array is ANDed together so all matches must be met for a full match of the Conditions

            • header: (boolean)

              Header indicates the match is for an HTTP header value

            • name: (string)

              Name is the key of the match request, like "uri", "port" and so on

            • type: (object)

              Type is the type of matching to use (exact, prefix or regex). Range of acceptable values: exact, prefix, regex

            • value: (string)

              Value is the value of the match request like (uri:)"google.com", (port:)"9876"

        • istioWeight: (integer)

          IstioWeight is The proportion of traffic to be forwarded (used for Istio entities)

        • policyRules: (object)

          PolicyRules are the policy rules that are applicable for source/dest. Used for radar display of connections deduced from policy rules.

          • effect: (object)

            Effect is the effect of the port ranges. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

          • portRanges: (object)

            PortRanges specify the ranges of ports

            • deny: (boolean)

              Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

            • end: (integer)
            • start: (integer)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are all the ports used by the sender

          • effect: (object)

            Effect is the effect that was applied on the outgoing connection. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

          • port: (integer)

            Port is the port number

          • protocol: (string)

            Protocol is the protocol used in the port

        • profileHash: (object)

          ProfileHash is the sender's profile hash

        • profileID: (string)

          ProfileID is the sender's profile ID

      • internet: (object)

        Internet are internet connections

        • incoming: (object)

          Incoming is the incoming connections

          • port: (integer)
          • protocol: (string)
          • tls: (boolean)
        • outgoing: (object)

          Outgoing is the outgoing connections

          • port: (integer)
          • protocol: (string)
          • tls: (boolean)
      • istio: (boolean)

        Istio states whether it is an istio-monitored entity

      • istioServiceRoles: (object)

        IstioServiceRoles are the Istio service roles names

        • name: (string)

          Name is the service role name

        • namespace: (string)

          Namespace is the namespace of the service role

        • rules: (object)

          Rules are the access rules this service role grants access to

          • methods: (string)

            Methods are the HTTP methods allowed, such as: "GET", "POST"

          • paths: (string)

            Paths are the HTTP paths that can be accessed, such as: "/books/review"

          • services: (string)

            Services are thr services the rule grants access to

      • k8s: (object)

        K8s holds Kubernetes related data

        • clusterRoles: (object)

          ClusterRoles are the cluster roles of the associated service account

          • labels: (object)

            Labels are the labels associated with the role

            • key: (string)

              Key is the key of the label

            • value: (string)

              Value is the value of the label

          • name: (string)

            Name is the role name

          • roleBinding: (string)

            RoleBinding is the name of the role binding used for display

          • rules: (object)

            Rules are the list of rules associated with the cluster role

            • apiGroups: (string)
            • nonResourceURLs: (string)
            • resourceNames: (string)
            • resources: (string)
            • verbs: (string)
        • roles: (object)

          Roles are the roles of the associated service account

          • labels: (object)

            Labels are the labels associated with the role

            • key: (string)

              Key is the key of the label

            • value: (string)

              Value is the value of the label

          • name: (string)

            Name is the kubernetes role name

          • namespace: (string)

            Namespace is the namespace associated with the role

          • roleBinding: (string)

            RoleBinding is the name of the role binding used for display

          • rules: (object)

            Rules are the policy rules associated with the role

            • apiGroups: (string)
            • nonResourceURLs: (string)
            • resourceNames: (string)
            • resources: (string)
            • verbs: (string)
        • serviceAccount: (string)

          ServiceAccount is the service account used to access Kubernetes apiserverThis field will be empty if the container is not running inside of a Pod

      • label: (string)

        Label is the entity's label

      • labels: (string)

        Labels are the radar entity labels

      • learning: (boolean)

        Learning indicates whether the runtime profile associated with the entity is in learning state

      • namespace: (string)

        Namespace is the kubernetes namespace the entity belongs to (for kubernetes type)

      • networkCount: (integer)
      • processesCount: (integer)
      • profileHash: (object)

        ProfileHash is the profile hash, a unique uint32 value that represents the profile, used mainly for networking

      • region: (string)

        Region is the cloud provider region

      • serviceIP: (string)

        ServiceIP the ip of the kubernetes service (for kubernetes type)

      • serviceName: (string)

        ServiceName is kubernetes service the entity belongs to (for kubernetes type)

      • servicePorts: (integer)

        ServicePorts are the ports the kubernetes service exposes (for kubernetes type)

      • tls: (boolean)

        TLS states whether the entity is configured to use TLS

      • type: (object)

        Type is the type of the entity (docker, k8s, internet)

      • vulnerabilityDistribution: (object)

        VulnerabilityDistribution is the distribution of vulnerability issues

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
    • radarSubnets: (object)

      RadarSubnets holds all the radar subnets

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/container/export get

    get

    Returns the current learned connections from CNNF (for containers) in JSON format.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o cnnf_containers_export.json \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container/export

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /radar/container/export

    Returns the current learned connections from CNNF (for containers) in JSON format.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o cnnf_containers_export.json \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container/export

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • hostname: (string)

      Hosts is used to filter containers by host

    • id: (string)

      IDs is used to filter container by container ID

    • image: (string)

      Images is used to filter containers by image name

    • imageId: (string)

      ImageIDs is used to filter containers by image ids

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces are the namespaces to filter

    • profileId: (string)

      ProfileIDs is used to filter container by runtime profile ID

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • entities: (object)

      Entities are the network firewall entities referenced by the policy

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    • policy: (object)

      Policy is the network firewall policy

      • _id: (string)
      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether network firewall feature is enabled

      • multiHostDetection: (boolean)

        MultiHostDetection enables detecting app to app connections between separated hosts

      • rules: (object)

        Rules is the list of network firewall rule specifications

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

        • dst: (object)

          Dst is the source entity of the firewall rule

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the firewall effect of the rule. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

        • id: (object)

          ID is the rule ID

        • learning: (boolean)

          Learning indicates whether network models should be use as a fallback when resolving rule

        • modified: (datetime)
        • name: (string)
        • notes: (string)

          Notes are the rule's user notes

        • owner: (string)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the entity port range specifications

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • previousName: (string)

          PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

        • src: (object)

          Src is the source entity of the firewall rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/container/filters get

    get

    Returns the namespaces from the container view on the Radar page.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container/filters

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /radar/container/filters

    Returns the namespaces from the container view on the Radar page.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/container/filters

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • fields: (string)

      Select is a list of fields to select from the query (others will be empty)

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit limits the number of documents

    • offset: (integer)

      Offset from query start

    • reverse: (boolean)

      Reverse is the sorting order

    • search: (string)

      Search is the search term

    • sort: (string)

      Sort is the sort key

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces enables filtering radar entities by namespace

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/host delete get

    delete

    Deletes a learned connection between two apps in CNNF for hosts.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/host?dstProfileID=<APP>&srcProfileID=<APP>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get

    Returns data from Console's Radar page (host view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/host

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    delete /radar/host

    Deletes a learned connection between two apps in CNNF for hosts.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/host?dstProfileID=<APP>&srcProfileID=<APP>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • dstProfileID: (string)

      DstProfileID is the connection destination profile ID

    • srcProfileID: (string)

      SrcProfileID is the connection source profile ID

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    get /radar/host

    Returns data from Console's Radar page (host view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/host

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • filterDisconnected: (boolean)

      FilterDisconnected indicates if only entities with connections should be returned

    • profileId: (string)

      ProfileID is used to filter radar by service profile ID

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • appCount: (integer)

      AppCount is the total number of apps

    • hostCount: (integer)

      HostCount is the total number of hosts

    • radar: (object)

      Radar holds all radar entities

      • _id: (string)

        ID is the app name

      • capabilitiesCount: (integer)

        CapabilitiysCount is number of capabilitiys events triggered by the entity

      • created: (datetime)

        Created is the profile creation time

      • filesystemCount: (integer)

        FilesystemCount is number of filesystem events triggered by the entity

      • firewallProtected: (boolean)

        FirewallProtected indicates the entity is protected by firewall

      • hostCount: (integer)

        HostCount are the number of hosts where the app is running

      • incidentCount: (integer)

        IncidentCount is the number of incidents triggered by the entity

      • incoming: (object)

        Incoming are the incoming connections from the app

        • dstAppID: (string)

          DstAppID is the dst app ID

        • policyRules: (object)

          PolicyRules are the policy rules that are applicable for source/dest. Used for radar display of connections deduced from policy rules.

          • effect: (object)

            Effect is the effect of the port ranges. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

          • portRanges: (object)

            PortRanges specify the ranges of ports

            • deny: (boolean)

              Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

            • end: (integer)
            • start: (integer)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the destination ports

          • effect: (object)

            Effect is the effect that was applied on the outgoing connection. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

          • port: (integer)

            Port is the port number

          • protocol: (string)

            Protocol is the protocol used in the port

        • samples: (object)

          Samples are samples of connection instances between the two apps (the different src-dst hostname combinations)

          • instances: (object)

            Instances are connection samples

            • dst: (string)

              Dst is the dst of the connection instance. Typically kept as an IP or a hostname

            • policyRules: (object)

              PolicyRules are the policy rules that are applicable for source/dest. Used for radar display of connections deduced from policy rules.

              • effect: (object)

                Effect is the effect of the port ranges. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

              • portRanges: (object)

                PortRanges specify the ranges of ports

                • deny: (boolean)

                  Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

                • end: (integer)
                • start: (integer)
            • port: (object)

              Port is the destination port

              • effect: (object)

                Effect is the effect that was applied on the outgoing connection. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

              • port: (integer)

                Port is the port number

              • protocol: (string)

                Protocol is the protocol used in the port

            • src: (string)

              Src is the src of the connection instance. Typically kept as an IP or a hostname

            • time: (datetime)

              Time is the time the connection instance was added

            • user: (string)

              User is the user that initiated the connection in case of interactive connection

        • srcAppID: (string)

          SrcAppID is the src app ID

      • internet: (object)

        Internet are the internet connections of the app

        • incomingPorts: (integer)

          IncomingPorts are the incoming internet ports of the app

        • outgoingPorts: (integer)

          OutgoingPorts are the outgoing internet ports of the app

      • learning: (boolean)

        Learning indicates whether the runtime profile associated with the entity is in learning state

      • listeningPorts: (object)

        ListeningPorts are the entity listening ports

        • all: (boolean)

          All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

        • ports: (object)

          Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

          • port: (integer)

            Port is the port number

          • time: (datetime)

            Time is the learning timestamp of this port

      • networkCount: (integer)

        NetworkCount is number of network events triggered by the entity

      • outboundPorts: (object)

        OutboundPorts are the entity outbound ports

        • all: (boolean)

          All indicates that this port data represents any arbitrary ports

        • ports: (object)

          Ports is the list of profile runtime ports

          • port: (integer)

            Port is the port number

          • time: (datetime)

            Time is the learning timestamp of this port

      • processesCount: (integer)

        ProcessesCount is the number of processes events triggered by the entity

      • profileHash: (object)

        ProfileHash is the app hash

      • topHosts: (object)

        TopHosts are the most vulnerable hosts where the app is running

        • hostname: (string)

          Hostname is the name of the host

        • vulnerabilityDistribution: (object)

          VulnerabilityDistribution is the CVE distrubtion of host

          • critical: (integer)
          • high: (integer)
          • low: (integer)
          • medium: (integer)
          • total: (integer)
      • user: (string)

        User represents the service user

    • radarSubnets: (object)

      RadarSubnets holds all the radar subnets

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/host/export get

    get

    Returns the current learned connections from CNNF (for hosts) in JSON format.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o <export.json> \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/host/export

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /radar/host/export

    Returns the current learned connections from CNNF (for hosts) in JSON format.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
-o <export.json> \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/host/export

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • filterDisconnected: (boolean)

      FilterDisconnected indicates if only entities with connections should be returned

    • profileId: (string)

      ProfileID is used to filter radar by service profile ID

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • entities: (object)

      Entities are the network firewall entities referenced by the policy

      • _id: (object)

        ID is the entity ID

      • domains: (string)

        Domains is the list of DNS domain names

      • name: (string)

        Name is the entity name

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the entity resource

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • regions: (string)
        • services: (string)
      • subnets: (object)

        Subnets are the CIDR format network

        • cidr: (string)

          CIDR is the IP range of the defined entity

        • name: (string)

          Name is the given name to represent the range

      • type: (object)

        Type is the entity type. Range of acceptable values: appID, subnet, container, dns

    • policy: (object)

      Policy is the network firewall policy

      • _id: (string)
      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether network firewall feature is enabled

      • multiHostDetection: (boolean)

        MultiHostDetection enables detecting app to app connections between separated hosts

      • rules: (object)

        Rules is the list of network firewall rule specifications

        • disabled: (boolean)

          Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

        • dst: (object)

          Dst is the source entity of the firewall rule

        • effect: (object)

          Effect is the firewall effect of the rule. Range of acceptable values: allow, alert, prevent, monitor

        • id: (object)

          ID is the rule ID

        • learning: (boolean)

          Learning indicates whether network models should be use as a fallback when resolving rule

        • modified: (datetime)
        • name: (string)
        • notes: (string)

          Notes are the rule's user notes

        • owner: (string)
        • ports: (object)

          Ports are the entity port range specifications

          • deny: (boolean)

            Deny indicates whether the connection is denied

          • end: (integer)
          • start: (integer)
        • previousName: (string)

          PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

        • src: (object)

          Src is the source entity of the firewall rule

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/serverless get

    get

    Returns data from Console's Radar page (serverless view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /radar/serverless

    Returns data from Console's Radar page (serverless view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • credentialId: (string)

      CredentialID is the account filter

    • provider: (string)

      Provider is the provider filter

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • serverlessRadar: (object)

      ServerlessRadar holds all radar entities

      • _id: (string)

        ID is unique identifier of the function (for AWS - ARN)

      • accountID: (string)

        AccountID is the cloud account ID

      • alias: (boolean)

        Alias states that the current entity is an alias of the function

      • applicationName: (string)

        ApplicationName is the name of the application the function is associated with

      • associatedVersions: (object)

        AssociatedVersions contain the alias associated versions, or empty if the entity isn't an alias

        • version: (string)

          Version is the function version

        • weight: (string)

          Weight is the possibility that the function will be called when triggering the alias

      • collections: (string)

        Collections are the matched function collections

      • complianceDistribution: (object)

        ComplianceDistribution is the distribution of compliance issues

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • credentialId: (string)

        CredentialID is the id reference of the credential used

      • description: (string)

        Description is the user provided description of the function

      • incidentCount: (integer)

        IncidentCount is the number of incidents

      • lastModified: (datetime)

        LastModified is the modification time of the function

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the function

      • networkCount: (integer)

        NetworkCount contain the runtime network events count

      • permissions: (object)

        Permissions are the function permissions

        • actions: (object)

          Actions is API actions of the service that the function has access to.

          • resources: (object)

            Resources are the resources granted to the action

            • allow: (boolean)

              Allow states if the resource is allowed or denied

            • condition: (object)

              Conditions contain limitations on resources, such as a specific prefix

              • conditions: (object)

                Conditions contain the limitations

                • key: (string)
                • values: (string)
              • name: (string)

                Condition in AWS such as: StringLike, StringNotLike, StringEquals, StringNotEquals, StringEqualsIgnoreCase, StringNotEqualsIgnoreCase, ForAllValues:StringLike,...

            • name: (string)

              Name is the resource name

          • serviceAPI: (object)

            ServiceAPI is the service API that describes the action, e.g. lambda:CreateFunction - service is lambda, API is CreateFunction

            • -: (object)

              RiskType is the API risk type

            • api: (string)

              API is the service API

            • service: (string)

              Service is the AWS service

        • service: (string)

          Service is the service name

      • permissionsBoundary: (object)

        PermissionsBoundary are limitations of the permissions, acting as AND

        • actions: (object)

          Actions is API actions of the service that the function has access to.

          • resources: (object)

            Resources are the resources granted to the action

            • allow: (boolean)

              Allow states if the resource is allowed or denied

            • condition: (object)

              Conditions contain limitations on resources, such as a specific prefix

              • conditions: (object)

                Conditions contain the limitations

                • key: (string)
                • values: (string)
              • name: (string)

                Condition in AWS such as: StringLike, StringNotLike, StringEquals, StringNotEquals, StringEqualsIgnoreCase, StringNotEqualsIgnoreCase, ForAllValues:StringLike,...

            • name: (string)

              Name is the resource name

          • serviceAPI: (object)

            ServiceAPI is the service API that describes the action, e.g. lambda:CreateFunction - service is lambda, API is CreateFunction

            • -: (object)

              RiskType is the API risk type

            • api: (string)

              API is the service API

            • service: (string)

              Service is the AWS service

        • service: (string)

          Service is the service name

      • processesCount: (integer)

        ProcessesCount contain the runtime processes events count

      • protected: (boolean)

        Protected denotes weather the function is protected by a serverless defender

      • provider: (object)

        Provider is the cloud provider for example: AWS, GCP. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region that was scanned, for example: GCP - "us-east-1", Azure - "westus"

      • runtime: (string)

        Runtime is runtime environment for the function, i.e. nodejs

      • scanned: (boolean)

        Scanned indicates if the function was scanned for vulnerabilities and compliance

      • triggers: (object)

        Triggers contain invocation paths for functions

        • service: (string)

          Service is the service name

        • triggers: (object)

          Triggers are the function invocation paths from the service

          • properties: (object)

            Properties are the trigger properties. There may be multiple values per key, for example AWS S3 event types: ObjectCreatedByPost, ObjectCreatedByCopy, ObjectCreatedByPut

            • values: (string)
          • sourceID: (string)

            SourceID is the id of the service instance that caused the trigger. For example AWS S3 bucket ARN, AWS apigateway ARN, etc

      • version: (string)

        Version is the version of the function, or the alias name if it's an alias

      • vulnerabilityDistribution: (object)

        VulnerabilityDistribution is the distribution of vulnerability issues

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/serverless/progress get

    get

    Returns the scan progress from Console's Radar page (serverless view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless/progress

    Example of the return data:

    [
{
"hostname": "",
"id": "",
"type": "serverlessRadar",
"discovery": false,
"total": 1,
"scanned": 1,
"title": ""
}
]

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /radar/serverless/progress

    Returns the scan progress from Console's Radar page (serverless view).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless/progress

    Example of the return data:

    [
{
"hostname": "",
"id": "",
"type": "serverlessRadar",
"discovery": false,
"total": 1,
"scanned": 1,
"title": ""
}
]

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • discovery: (boolean)

      Discovery indicates whether the scan is in discovery phase

    • error: (string)

      Error is the error that happened during scan

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname for which the progress apply

    • id: (string)

      ID is the ID of the entity being scanned

    • scanTime: (datetime)

      ScanTime is the time of scan

    • scanned: (integer)

      Scanned is the number of entities for which the scan completed

    • title: (string)

      Title is the progress title (set by the scanning process)

    • total: (integer)

      Total is the total amount of entities that should be scanned

    • type: (object)

      Type is the scan type (e.g., images/serverless). Range of acceptable values: image, ciImage, container, host, registry, serverlessScan, ciServerless, vm, pcf, cloudDiscovery, cloudCompliance, serverlessRadar, serverlessAutoProtect

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/serverless/scan post

    post

    Initiates a serverless scan of your environments.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /radar/serverless/scan

    Initiates a serverless scan of your environments.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /radar/serverless/stop post

    post

    Stops an in-progress serverless scan.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless/stop

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /radar/serverless/stop

    Stops an in-progress serverless scan.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/radar/serverless/stop

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Registry scan reports

    Scan reports for images in your registry.

    /registry get

    get

    Retrieves all scan reports for registry images that Twistlock has been configured to scan. In the Console UI, these are images that can be found in Monitor > Vulnerabilities > Images > Registries.

    // https://github.com/twistlock/twistlock/issues/16586 Note that the discovered field for each compliance finding (info > allCompliance > compliance > discovered) doesn't contain valid data and will be removed in a future release.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the scan report for all images in the registry:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/registry"

    The compact query can also be used to get a general overview of the number of Vulnerabilities and Compliance issue counts instead of listing all of CVEs and compliance violations. The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the compact scan report for the ubuntu image in the registry. The name query is synonymous with the Search Registry field in the Console UI:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/registry?name=https://<REPO-URL>/uqbuntu:latest&compact=true"

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the scan report for the image in the registry with the matching sha256 hash:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/registry?imageID=sha256:d461f1845c43105d7d686a9cfca9d73b0272b1dcd0381bf105276c978cb02832"

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the scan reports in pages, in a similar way to the Console UI. This example returns the first ten scan reports:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/registry?limit=10&offset=0"

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the scan reports in pages, in a similar way to the UI. This example returns the results in alphabetical order.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
