      • sourceType: (object)

        SourceType is source type

      • timestamp: (datetime)

        Timestamp is the time in which the label was fetched

      • value: (string)

        Value is the label value

    • firstScanTime: (datetime)

      FirstScanTime indicates the first time when this image was scanned (preserved during version updates)

    • hash: (string)

      Hash is the hash of the function

    • history: (object)

      History is the docker image history

      • baseLayer: (boolean)

        BaseLayer indicates this layer originated from the base image

      • created: (integer)

        Created is the creation date of a image layer

      • id: (string)

        ID is the layer ID

      • instruction: (string)

        Instruction is the docker file instruction and arguments which created this layer

      • sizeBytes: (integer)

        SizeBytes is the layer size in bytes

      • tags: (string)

        ImageNames holds the image tags

      • vulnerabilities: (object)

        Vulnerabilities holds the list of the vulnerabilities that originated from this layer

        • -: (string)

          LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

        • applicableRules: (string)

          ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

        • binaryPkgs: (string)

          BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

        • block: (boolean)

          Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

        • cause: (string)

          Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

        • custom: (boolean)

          Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

        • cve: (string)

          CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

        • cvss: (number)

          Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerabilities description.

        • discovered: (datetime)

          Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

        • exploit: (object)

          Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

        • fixLink: (string)

          FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

        • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

          GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

        • id: (integer)

          Unique id to identify the violation

        • layerTime: (integer)

          LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

        • link: (string)

          Link is the vendor link to the CVE

        • packageName: (string)

          PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

        • packageVersion: (string)

          PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

        • published: (integer)

          Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • severity: (string)

          Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

        • status: (string)

          Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

        • templates: (object)

          Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

        • text: (string)

          Text that explains the violation

        • title: (string)

          Title is the compliance title

        • twistlock: (boolean)

          Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

        • type: (object)

          Type is the vulnerability's type.

        • vecStr: (string)

          VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

        • vulnTagInfos: (object)

          VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

          • comment: (string)

            Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

          • name: (string)

            Name is the tag name

    • hostDevices: (object)

      HostDevices is a map from host network device name to IP address

      • ip: (string)

        IP is the network device IPv4 address

      • name: (string)

        Name is the network device name

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname of the scanner

    • id: (string)

      Id is the image id

    • image: (object)

      Image is the image metadata associated with docker inspect

      • created: (datetime)

        Created is the image creation time

      • entrypoint: (string)

        Entrypoint is the combined entrypoint of the image (entrypoint + CMD)

      • env: (string)

        Env is the image environment variables

      • healthcheck: (boolean)

        HealthCheck indicates whether health check is enabled

      • history: (object)

        History holds the image history

        • baseLayer: (boolean)

          BaseLayer indicates this layer originated from the base image

        • created: (integer)

          Created is the creation date of a image layer

        • id: (string)

          ID is the layer ID

        • instruction: (string)

          Instruction is the docker file instruction and arguments which created this layer

        • sizeBytes: (integer)

          SizeBytes is the layer size in bytes

        • tags: (string)

          ImageNames holds the image tags

        • vulnerabilities: (object)

          Vulnerabilities holds the list of the vulnerabilities that originated from this layer

          • -: (string)

            LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

          • applicableRules: (string)

            ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

          • binaryPkgs: (string)

            BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

          • block: (boolean)

            Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

          • cause: (string)

            Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

          • custom: (boolean)

            Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

          • cve: (string)

            CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

          • cvss: (number)

            Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

          • description: (string)

            Description is the vulnerabilities description.

          • discovered: (datetime)

            Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

          • exploit: (object)

            Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

          • fixLink: (string)

            FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

          • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

            GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

          • id: (integer)

            Unique id to identify the violation

          • layerTime: (integer)

            LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

          • link: (string)

            Link is the vendor link to the CVE

          • packageName: (string)

            PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

          • packageVersion: (string)

            PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

          • published: (integer)

            Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

          • riskFactors: (object)

            RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

          • severity: (string)

            Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

          • status: (string)

            Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

          • templates: (object)

            Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

          • text: (string)

            Text that explains the violation

          • title: (string)

            Title is the compliance title

          • twistlock: (boolean)

            Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

          • type: (object)

            Type is the vulnerability's type.

          • vecStr: (string)

            VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

          • vulnTagInfos: (object)

            VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

            • comment: (string)

              Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

            • name: (string)

              Name is the tag name

      • id: (string)

        ID is the image ID

      • layers: (string)

        Layers are the image filesystem layers

      • os: (string)

        OS is the image os type

      • repoDigest: (string)

        RepoDigests are the image repo digests

      • repoTags: (string)

        RepoTags are the image repo tags

      • user: (string)

        User is the image user

      • workingDir: (string)

        WorkingDir is the base working directory of the image

    • installedProducts: (object)

      InstalledProducts contains data about running product in environment

      • apache: (string)

        Apache indicates the apache server version, empty in case apache not running

      • awsCloud: (boolean)

        AWSCloud indicates whether AWS cloud is used

      • docker: (string)

        Docker represents the docker daemon version

      • hasPackageManager: (boolean)

        HasPackageManager indicates whether package manager is installed on the OS

      • k8sApiServer: (boolean)

        K8sApiServer indicates whether a kubernetes api server is running

      • k8sControllerManager: (boolean)

        K8sControllerManager indicates whether a kubernetes controller manager is running

      • k8sEtcd: (boolean)

        K8sEtcd indicates whether etcd is running

      • k8sFederationApiServer: (boolean)

        K8sFederationApiServer indicates whether a federation api server is running

      • k8sFederationControllerManager: (boolean)

        K8sFederationControllerManager indicates whether a federation controller manager is running

      • k8sKubelet: (boolean)

        K8sKubelet indicates whether kubelet is running

      • k8sProxy: (boolean)

        K8sProxy indicates whether a kubernetes proxy is running

      • k8sScheduler: (boolean)

        K8sScheduler indicates whether the a kubernetes scheduler is running

      • kubernetes: (string)

        Kubernetes represents the kubernetes version

      • openshift: (boolean)

        Openshift indicates whether openshift is deployed

      • osDistro: (string)

        OSDistro specify os distribution

      • serverless: (boolean)

        Serverless indicates whether evaluated on a serverless environment

      • swarmManager: (boolean)

        SwarmManager indicates whether a swarm manager is running

      • swarmNode: (boolean)

        SwarmNode indicates whether the node is part of an active swarm

    • k8sClusterAddr: (string)

      K8sClusterAddr is the endpoint for Kubernetes API server

    • labels: (string)

      Labels are the image labels

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      LastModified is the modification time of the function

    • layers: (string)

      Layers is the image's filesystem layers, each layers is a sha256 digest of the filesystem diffSee: https://windsock.io/explaining-docker-image-ids/

    • memory: (integer)

      MemoryMB is the memory size, in MB, configured for the function

    • missingDistroVulnCoverage: (boolean)

      MissingDistroVulnCoverage states whether the image os is covered in the IS

    • name: (string)

      Name is the name of the function

    • namespaces: (string)

      Namespaces are the k8s namespaces of all the containers running this image

    • protected: (boolean)

      Protected indicates runtime protection status (covers both auto-protected and manually protected functions)

    • provider: (object)

      Provider is the cloud provider for the function. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region the function belongs to

    • repoDigests: (string)

      RepoDigests are the digests of the image. Used for content trust (notary). Has a digest per tag.

    • resourceGroupName: (string)

      ResourceGroupName is the name of the resource group to which the resource belongs (only for Azure)

    • riskFactors: (object)

      RiskFactors are the aggregated risk factors of the image

    • role: (string)

      Role is the AWS execution role

    • runtime: (string)

      Runtime is runtime environment for the function, i.e. nodejs

    • scanTime: (datetime)

      ScanTime is the time when the scan of the function was performed

    • scanVersion: (string)

      ScanVersion is the defender version that published the image.

    • scannerVersion: (string)

      ScannerVersion is the scanner version

    • status: (string)

      Status is the status of the function (e.g. running)

    • tags: (object)

      Tags are tags associated with the given image

      • digest: (string)

        Digest is the image digest (requires V2 and later registry)

      • id: (string)

        ID is the id of image

      • registry: (string)

        Registry is the registry name to which the image belongs

      • repo: (string)

        Repository is the repository name to which the image belongs

      • tag: (string)

        Tag is the tag of the image

    • timeout: (integer)

      TimeoutSec is the function execution time at which the function will be terminated

    • topLayer: (string)

      TopLayer is the sha256 of the image's last layer which is the last element of the Layers field

    • twistlockImage: (boolean)

      TwistlockImage indicates if the image is a Twistlock image

    • type: (object)

      Type is the serverless function scan type. Range of acceptable values: image, ciImage, container, host, registry, serverlessScan, ciServerless, vm, pcf, cloudDiscovery, cloudCompliance, serverlessRadar, serverlessAutoProtect

    • version: (string)

      Version is the version of the function

    • vulnerabilities: (object)

      Vulnerabilities are the CVE vulnerabilities of the image

      • -: (string)

        LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

      • applicableRules: (string)

        ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

      • binaryPkgs: (string)

        BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

      • block: (boolean)

        Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

      • cause: (string)

        Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

      • custom: (boolean)

        Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

      • cve: (string)

        CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

      • cvss: (number)

        Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

      • description: (string)

        Description is the vulnerabilities description.

      • discovered: (datetime)

        Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

      • exploit: (object)

        Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

      • fixLink: (string)

        FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

      • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

      • id: (integer)

        Unique id to identify the violation

      • layerTime: (integer)

        LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

      • link: (string)

        Link is the vendor link to the CVE

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

      • packageVersion: (string)

        PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

      • published: (integer)

        Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

      • riskFactors: (object)

        RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

      • severity: (string)

        Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

      • status: (string)

        Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

      • templates: (object)

        Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

      • text: (string)

        Text that explains the violation

      • title: (string)

        Title is the compliance title

      • twistlock: (boolean)

        Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

      • type: (object)

        Type is the vulnerability's type.

      • vecStr: (string)

        VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

      • vulnTagInfos: (object)

        VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

        • comment: (string)

          Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag name

    • vulnerabilitiesCount: (integer)

      VulnerabilitiesCount is the total number of vulnerabilities

    • vulnerabilityDistribution: (object)

      VulnerabilityDistribution is the distribution of vulnerability issues

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • vulnerabilityRiskScore: (number)

      VulnerabilityRiskScore is the image's CVE risk score

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /serverless/download get

    get

    Downloads all serveless scan reports in CSV format.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all Serverless resources that monitored by Twistlock, and save the results to a CSV file:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/download \
> serverless.csv

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /serverless/download

    Downloads all serveless scan reports in CSV format.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of all Serverless resources that monitored by Twistlock, and save the results to a CSV file:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/download \
> serverless.csv

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • cloudControllerAddresses: (string)

      CloudControllerAddresses is the list of cloud controller addresses that holds the functions

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the list of function IDs

    • provider: (string)

      Provider is the provider filter

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region filter

    • runtime: (string)

      Runtime is the runtime environment filter

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /serverless/names get

    get

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of names of all Serverless resources monitored by Twistlock:

    $ curl -k \
-X GET \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-u <USER> \
http://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/names \

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    get /serverless/names

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve a list of names of all Serverless resources monitored by Twistlock:

    $ curl -k \
-X GET \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-u <USER> \
http://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/names \

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • cloudControllerAddresses: (string)

      CloudControllerAddresses is the list of cloud controller addresses that holds the functions

    • id: (string)

      IDs is the list of function IDs

    • provider: (string)

      Provider is the provider filter

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region filter

    • runtime: (string)

      Runtime is the runtime environment filter

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /serverless/progress get

    get

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the last Serverless scan details:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/progress

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devOps.

    get /serverless/progress

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the last Serverless scan details:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/progress

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • discovery: (boolean)

      Discovery indicates whether the scan is in discovery phase

    • error: (string)

      Error is the error that happened during scan

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname for which the progress apply

    • id: (string)

      ID is the ID of the entity being scanned

    • scanTime: (datetime)

      ScanTime is the time of scan

    • scanned: (integer)

      Scanned is the number of entities for which the scan completed

    • title: (string)

      Title is the progress title (set by the scanning process)

    • total: (integer)

      Total is the total amount of entities that should be scanned

    • type: (object)

      Type is the scan type (e.g., images/serverless). Range of acceptable values: image, ciImage, container, host, registry, serverlessScan, ciServerless, vm, pcf, cloudDiscovery, cloudCompliance, serverlessRadar, serverlessAutoProtect

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /serverless/scan post

    post

    Re-scan all serverless functions immediately.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to force Twistlock to re-scan all serverless functions.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /serverless/scan

    Re-scan all serverless functions immediately.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to force Twistlock to re-scan all serverless functions.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /serverless/stop post

    post

    If there is an ongoing serverless scan that is running, this curl command will use basic auth to stop the current serverless scan:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/stop

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post /serverless/stop

    If there is an ongoing serverless scan that is running, this curl command will use basic auth to stop the current serverless scan:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/serverless/stop

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Settings

    Configure your Twistlock installation.

    /settings/alerts get post

    get

    Retrieves a list of your alert settings.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/alerts

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configure alerts.

    The following example curl command sets the aggregation period for alerts to one hour.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"aggregationPeriodMs": 3600000,
"consoleAddress": "https://<CONSOLE>:8083",
"securityAdvisorWebhook": ""   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/alerts

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/alerts

    Retrieves a list of your alert settings.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/alerts

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • aggregationPeriodMs: (integer)

      AggregationPeriodMs is the alert aggregation period in milliseconds

    • securityAdvisorWebhook: (string)

      SecurityAdvisorWebhook is a webhook for IBM security advisor alert wizard, used to authenticate the wizard with the console and to pull data

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/alerts

    Configure alerts.

    The following example curl command sets the aggregation period for alerts to one hour.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"aggregationPeriodMs": 3600000,
"consoleAddress": "https://<CONSOLE>:8083",
"securityAdvisorWebhook": ""   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/alerts

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • aggregationPeriodMs: (integer)

      AggregationPeriodMs is the alert aggregation period in milliseconds

    • securityAdvisorWebhook: (string)

      SecurityAdvisorWebhook is a webhook for IBM security advisor alert wizard, used to authenticate the wizard with the console and to pull data

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/alerts/options get

    get

    This endpoint will return the alert profile configuration options that can be found in the console under the alert type selection when setting up a new alert profile.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve all alert profile configuration options:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/alerts/options

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    get /settings/alerts/options

    This endpoint will return the alert profile configuration options that can be found in the console under the alert type selection when setting up a new alert profile.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve all alert profile configuration options:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/alerts/options

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • alertType: (object)

      Type is the alert type described by this option

    • hasPolicy: (boolean)

      HasPolicy defines whether the alerts are triggered by policy (e.g., this is false for defender alerts)

    • name: (string)

      Name is the display name for the option

    • rules: (string)

      Rules are the rule names for the policy associated with this alert type (only relevant if HasPolicy is true)

    • supportedClients: (object)

      SupportedClients are the supported alert clients for this alert (e.g., jira, email)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/certificates post

    post

    Manage details associated with client certificates. Users employ client certificates to authenticate commands sent from the Docker client through Twistlock.

    This endpoint lets you specify a certificate authority (CA) to trust, and the validity period for client certs.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set the validity period for client certificates to seven days.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"certificatePeriodDays": 7} ' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/certificates

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post /settings/certificates

    Manage details associated with client certificates. Users employ client certificates to authenticate commands sent from the Docker client through Twistlock.

    This endpoint lets you specify a certificate authority (CA) to trust, and the validity period for client certs.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set the validity period for client certificates to seven days.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"certificatePeriodDays": 7} ' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/certificates

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • -: (string)

      JWTKey is the key used to sign JWT tokens

    • accessCaCert: (string)

      AccessCACert is a custom CA certificate

    • address: (string)

      Address is the intelligence service address

    • alerts: (object)

      Alert is the alert settings

      • aggregationPeriodMs: (integer)

        AggregationPeriodMs is the alert aggregation period in milliseconds

      • securityAdvisorWebhook: (string)

        SecurityAdvisorWebhook is a webhook for IBM security advisor alert wizard, used to authenticate the wizard with the console and to pull data

    • certSettings: (object)

      CertSettings are the certificates settings

      • caExpiration: (datetime)

        CAExpiration holds the expiration date of the CA cert

      • consoleSAN: (string)

        ConsoleSAN if specified, use this list as the SAN for the console server certificate. Used for websocket and API

    • certificatePeriodDays: (integer)

      CertificatePeriodDays is the certificates period in days

    • checkRevocation: (boolean)

      CheckRevocation indicates whether cert revocation status is required

    • communicationPort: (integer)

      MgmtPortHttp is the console http port

    • consoleCaCert: (string)

      ConsoleCACert is a custom CA certificate for the console

    • consoleCustomCert: (object)

      ConsoleCustomCert is the custom console cert bundle

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • consoleNames: (string)

      ConsoleNames is a list of names to use when generating the console SAN certificate

    • customLabels: (object)

      CustomLabels are the custom labels settings

      • labels: (string)

        Labels are the custom labels

    • defenderSettings: (object)

      DefenderSettings holds the defender proxy settings

      • admissionControlEnabled: (boolean)

        AdmissionControlEnabled specifies if the admission controller is enabled

      • admissionControlWebhookSuffix: (string)

        AdmissionControlWebhookSuffix is the relative path to the admission control webhook http endpoint

      • automaticUpgrade: (boolean)

        AutomaticUpgrade indicates defenders should be automatically upgraded to the latest version

      • disconnectPeriodDays: (integer)

        DisconnectPeriodDays is the amount of consecutive days a defender must stays disconnected for it to be considered decommissioned

      • listeningPort: (integer)

        ListeningPort is the defender listening port

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether intelligence service is enabled

    • forensic: (object)

      Forensic is the forensic setting

      • collectNetworkFirewall: (boolean)

        CollectNetworkFirewall indicates whether network firewall collection is enabled

      • collectNetworkSnapshot: (boolean)

        CollectNetworkSnapshot indicates whether network snapshot collection is enabled

      • containerDiskUsageMb: (integer)

        ContainerDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used tostore the container historical forensic events

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether host and container forensic data collection is enabled

      • hostDiskUsageMb: (integer)

        HostDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used to storethe host historical forensic events

      • incidentSnapshotsCap: (integer)

        IncidentSnapshotCap is the maximum amount of incident snapshots we store

    • hasAdmin: (boolean)

      HasAdmin indicates whether the admin account is initialized

    • highAvailabilityEnabled: (boolean)

      Properties that are not stored in the DB

    • highAvailabilityHosts: (string)

      HighAvailabilityHosts is the list of hosts that participate in the high availability cluster

    • hpkp: (object)

      HPKP is the HTTP Public Key Pinning settings

      • certs: (string)

        Certs are the public certs used for fingerprinting

      • enabled: (boolean)
      • fingerprints: (string)

        SHA256 fingerprints of the certificates

    • kubernetesAudit: (object)

      KubernetesAuditSettings is the kubernetes audit settings

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the credential that is used to fetch k8s audit data from external resources (e.g., Stackdriver)

      • deploymentType: (object)

        DeploymentType indicates the type of the Kubernetes deployment audits source. Range of acceptable values: default, gke

      • stackdriverFilter: (string)

        StackdriverFilter is the advanced filter used for Stackdriver querying

      • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

        WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    • lastInitializedVersion: (string)

      LastInitializedVersion is the current version of the product

    • ldap: (object)

      LdapSettings are the ldap authentication settings

      • accountPassword: (object)

        AccountPassword is the UPN password used to connect to active directory server

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • accountUpn: (string)

        AccountUpn is the user principle name used to connect to the active directory server

      • caCert: (string)

        CaCert is cert in PEM format (optional, if not specified, skip_verify flag will be used)

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether LDAP is enabled

      • groupSearchBase: (string)

        GroupSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for groups

      • searchBase: (string)

        SearchBase is the LDAP search pattern

      • type: (string)

        Type specifies the LDAP server type (AD or OpenLDAP)

      • url: (string)

        Url is the ldap server url

      • userSearchBase: (string)

        UserSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for users

      • userSearchIdentifier: (string)

        UserSearchIdentifier is the user identifier to use for querying open ldap (e.g., cn -> cn=user)

    • ldapEnabled: (boolean)

      LdapEnabled indicates whether ldap is enabled

    • licenseKey: (string)

      LicenseKey is the license key

    • logging: (object)

      Logging is the logging setting

      • consoleAddress: (string)

        ConsoleAddress is the console address used by the admin to access the console, used for creating links for runtime events

      • enableMetricsCollection: (boolean)

        EnableMetricsCollection indicates whether metric collections feature is enabled

      • includeRuntimeLink: (boolean)

        IncludeRuntimeLink indicates whether link to forensic event should be included in the output

      • stdout: (object)

        Stdout holds the stdout logging settings

        • allProcEvents: (boolean)

          AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

        • verboseScan: (boolean)

          VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

      • syslog: (object)

        Syslog holds the syslog logging settings

        • addr: (string)

          Addr is the remote address for sending events

        • allProcEvents: (boolean)

          AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID represents the user's custom identifier string

        • verboseScan: (boolean)

          VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    • logon: (object)

      Logon settings holds all logon settings

      • basicAuthDisabled: (boolean)

        Indicates whether the user can use basic auth

      • includeTLS: (boolean)

        IncludeTLS indicates that TLS checks should be included in copy links

      • sessionTimeoutSec: (integer)

        SessionTimeoutSec defines the session timeout in seconds

      • strongPassword: (boolean)

        StrongPassword indicates whether strong password enforcment is applied

      • useSupportCredentials: (boolean)

        UseSupportCredentials indicates whether to include credentials in the URL

    • pcfDroplets: (object)

      PCFDropletsSpecification is the pcf droplets scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • cloudControllerAddress: (string)

        CloudControllerAddress is the address of the cloud controller that provides the droplets

      • pattern: (string)

        Name is the droplet name

    • projects: (object)

      ProjectSettings are the project settings

      • master: (boolean)

        Master indicates that project feature is enabled and that this console is the master console and that

      • redirectURL: (string)

        RedirectURL is the redirectURL for the given project

    • proxy: (object)

      ProxySettings are the proxy settings

      • ca: (string)

        CA is the user proxy's CA

      • httpProxy: (string)

        HttpProxy is the http proxy to use

      • noProxy: (string)

        NoProxy is a list of addresses for which the proxy should not be used

      • password: (object)

        Password is the password to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • user: (string)

        User is the username to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

    • registry: (object)

      RegistrySettings holds credentials and configuration per registry

      • specifications: (object)

        Registries is the information for connecting to local/remote registries

        • cap: (integer)

          Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

        • credential: (object)

          Credential is the service provider authentication data

          • _id: (string)

            ID is a unique name for the credential

          • accountGUID: (string)

            AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

          • accountID: (string)

            AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

          • apiToken: (object)

            APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

            • encrypted: (string)
            • plain: (string)

              Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

          • caCert: (string)

            CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

          • lastModified: (datetime)

            Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

          • owner: (string)

            Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

          • secret: (object)

            Secret is the credential secret data

            • encrypted: (string)
            • plain: (string)

              Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

          • type: (object)

            Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

        • excludedRepositories: (string)

          ExcludedRepositories indicates which repositories are excluded in the registry scanning

        • excludedTags: (string)

          ExcludedTags indicates which tags are excluded in the registry scanning

        • hostname: (string)

          Hostname is the hostname of the defender that is used as registry scanner

        • jfrogRepoTypes: (object)

          JFrogRepoTypes indicates which JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan. Range of acceptable values: local, remote, virtual

        • namespace: (string)

          Namespace is the IBM Bluemix Namespace https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/Registry/registry_overview.html#registry_planning

        • os: (object)

          OS indicates the registry images base OS. Range of acceptable values: linux, windows

        • registry: (string)

          Registry contains either the registry name (e.g., gcr.io) or url (e.g., https://gcr.io)

        • repository: (string)
        • roleArn: (string)

          RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

        • scanners: (integer)

          Scanners indicates the amount of defenders assigned to scan this registry, this applies only for registries with auto-selected defenders

        • tag: (string)
        • useAWSRole: (boolean)

          UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

        • version: (string)
        • versionPattern: (string)

          VersionPattern indicates the version naming pattern heuristic for quickly filtering registry tags without querying all images for modification dates

      • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

        WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    • saml: (object)

      SamlSettings are the saml authentication settings

      • appId: (string)

        AppID is the Azure application ID

      • appSecret: (object)

        AppSecret is an Azure secret used in the identification process

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • audience: (string)

        Audience specifies the SAML audience used in the verification of the SAML response

      • cert: (string)

        Cert is idp certificate in PEM format

      • consoleURL: (string)

        ConsoleURL is the external Console URL that is used by the IDP for routing the browser after login

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether saml settings are enabled

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is idp issuer id

      • tenantId: (string)

        TenantID is the Azure Tenant ID

      • type: (object)

        Type specifies the SAML provider type. Range of acceptable values: okta, gsuite, ping, shibboleth, azure, adfs

      • url: (string)

        Url is idp sso url

    • samlEnabled: (boolean)

      SamlEnabled indicates whether saml is enabled

    • scan: (object)

      ScanSettings are the global settings for scanning

      • cloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        CloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs is the cloud platforms scan period in ms

      • containersScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ContainersScanPeriodMs is the container scan period in ms

      • disableCLIScanResults: (boolean)

        DisableCLIScanResults indicates that cli scan results should not be stored in the database

      • extractArchive: (boolean)

        ExtractArchive indicates whether to search within archive during scan is enabled

      • imagesScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ImageScanPeriodMs is the image scan period in ms

      • includeJsDependencies: (boolean)

        IncludeJsDependencies indicates whether to include packages from the "dependencies"

      • pcfDropletsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        PCFDropletsScanPeriodMs is the pcf scan period in ms

      • registryScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        RegistryScanPeriodMs is the registry scan period in ms

      • scanRunningImages: (boolean)

        ScanRunningImages indicates only images that are used by containers should be used

      • serverlessScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ServerlessScanPeriodMs is the serverless vulnerability scan period in ms

      • showInfraContainers: (boolean)

        ShowInfraContainers indicates infra containers should be shown

      • showNegligibleVulnerabilities: (boolean)

        ShowNegligibleVulnerabilities indicates whether to display negligible vulnerabilities (low severity)

      • systemScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        SystemScanPeriodMs is the host scan period in ms

      • vmScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        VMScanPeriodMs is the VM image scan period in ms

    • scapEnabled: (boolean)

      ScapEnabled indicates whether scap scanning is enabled

    • secretsStores: (object)

      SecretsStores is the secrets store settings

      • refreshPeriodHours: (integer)

        RefreshPeriodHours is the secret stores refresh time in hours

      • secretsStores: (object)

        Stores is the list of stores to fetch secrets from

        • appID: (string)

          AppID is the twistlock application id, as set in Cyberark store

        • caCert: (object)

          CaCert is a CA cert in PEM format, used to authenticate the store

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • clientCert: (object)

          ClientCert is the client cert bundle (key and cert)

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • credentialId: (string)

          CredentialID is the authentication credential id

        • name: (string)

          Name is the name of the secret store defined by the user

        • region: (string)

          Region is the secrets store's region

        • roleArn: (string)

          RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

        • type: (object)

          Type is the type of the secret store. Range of acceptable values: hashicorp, hashicorp010, cyberark, awsParameterStore, awsSecretsManager, azure

        • url: (string)

          URL is the secrets store's endpoint point

        • useAWSRole: (boolean)

          UseAWSRole is a flag indicates if local IAM role should be used for authentication, than all other credentials would be ignored

    • securedConsolePort: (integer)

      MgmtPortHttps is the console https port

    • serverlessAutoProtect: (object)

      ServerlessAutoProtectSpecs is the serverless auto-protection settings

      • consoleAddr: (string)

        ConsoleAddr represents the hostname of the console to connect to

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

      • lastModified: (datetime)

        LastModified is the last modified time of the specification

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the spec

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the runtime resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • runtimes: (string)

        Runtimes is the list of runtimes to which the spec applies

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • serverlessScan: (object)

      ServerlessScan is the serverless scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • credential: (object)

        Credential is the service provider authentication data

        • _id: (string)

          ID is a unique name for the credential

        • accountGUID: (string)

          AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

        • accountID: (string)

          AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

        • apiToken: (object)

          APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • caCert: (string)

          CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

        • lastModified: (datetime)

          Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

        • owner: (string)

          Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

        • secret: (object)

          Secret is the credential secret data

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • type: (object)

          Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

      • pattern: (string)

        Pattern is a pattern used when filtering function names

      • provider: (object)

        Provider is the serverless provider. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • telemetry: (object)

      TelemtrySettings determines whether to send telemetry data

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled determines whether the telemetry settings are enabled

    • token: (string)

      Token is the token used to access intelligence service

    • trustedCerts: (object)

      TrustedCerts is the list of trusted cert to allow in docker access scenarios

      • cn: (string)

        CN is the certificate common name

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is the certificate issuer

      • notAfter1: (datetime)

        NotAfter is the certificate expiration timeRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • notBefore1: (datetime)

        NotBefore is the minimum time for which the cert is validRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • raw: (string)

        Raw is the raw certificate (in PEM format)

    • trustedCertsEnabled: (boolean)

      TrustedCertsEnabled indicates whether to enable the trusted certificate feature

    • uploadDisabled: (boolean)

      UploadDisabled indicates whether logs uploading is disabled

    • version: (string)

      Version is the current console version

    • vms: (object)

      VMSettings is the VM scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • consoleAddr: (string)

        ConsoleAddr is the address the scanner agent uses to publish the results

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

      • excludedImages: (string)

        ExcludedImages indicates which images are excluded in the VM scanning

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the image resides

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the runtime resource associated with the data

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • scanners: (integer)

        Scanners indicates the amount of VMs that will be scanned concurrently

      • version: (string)

        Version indicates the type of the VM

    • windowsFeedEnabled: (boolean)

      WindowsFeedEnabled indicates whether windows feed is enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/certs get post

    get

    Gets the Subject Alternative Name(s) (SANs) in Console's certificate. Defenders use these names to connect to Console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the SANs in Console's cert:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/certs

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Adds or deletes Subject Alternative Name(s) (SANs) in Console's certificate. Defenders use these names to connect to Console.

    SANs are set in a single shot. You should first retrieve the list of SANs with the GET method. Then add or remove entries from the consoleSAN array, and post the updated JSON object.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to add node-01.example.com to the subjectAltName field in Console's certificate.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '
{
"consoleSAN": [
  "10.240.0.34",
  "172.17.0.1",
  "ian-23.c.cto-sandbox.internal",
  "127.0.0.1",
  "node-01.example.com"
]
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/certs

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/certs

    Gets the Subject Alternative Name(s) (SANs) in Console's certificate. Defenders use these names to connect to Console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the SANs in Console's cert:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/certs

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • caExpiration: (datetime)

      CAExpiration holds the expiration date of the CA cert

    • consoleSAN: (string)

      ConsoleSAN if specified, use this list as the SAN for the console server certificate. Used for websocket and API

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/certs

    Adds or deletes Subject Alternative Name(s) (SANs) in Console's certificate. Defenders use these names to connect to Console.

    SANs are set in a single shot. You should first retrieve the list of SANs with the GET method. Then add or remove entries from the consoleSAN array, and post the updated JSON object.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to add node-01.example.com to the subjectAltName field in Console's certificate.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '
{
"consoleSAN": [
  "10.240.0.34",
  "172.17.0.1",
  "ian-23.c.cto-sandbox.internal",
  "127.0.0.1",
  "node-01.example.com"
]
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/certs

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • caExpiration: (datetime)

      CAExpiration holds the expiration date of the CA cert

    • consoleSAN: (string)

      ConsoleSAN if specified, use this list as the SAN for the console server certificate. Used for websocket and API

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/console-certificate post

    post

    This endpoint will enter custom certificates for securing browser access to the Console. These settings can be seen in the console under Manage > Authentication > System Certificates.

    For the custom TLS certificate for securing browser access, this file must be in the cocatenated public cert and private key in PEM format. For more information about this configuration, see Custom certs for Console access

    The following example curl command uses basic auth enter the custom certificate to use for securing browser access to the console:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"consoleCustomCert":"....."}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/console-certificate

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post /settings/console-certificate

    This endpoint will enter custom certificates for securing browser access to the Console. These settings can be seen in the console under Manage > Authentication > System Certificates.

    For the custom TLS certificate for securing browser access, this file must be in the cocatenated public cert and private key in PEM format. For more information about this configuration, see Custom certs for Console access

    The following example curl command uses basic auth enter the custom certificate to use for securing browser access to the console:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"consoleCustomCert":"....."}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/console-certificate

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • -: (string)

      JWTKey is the key used to sign JWT tokens

    • accessCaCert: (string)

      AccessCACert is a custom CA certificate

    • address: (string)

      Address is the intelligence service address

    • alerts: (object)

      Alert is the alert settings

      • aggregationPeriodMs: (integer)

        AggregationPeriodMs is the alert aggregation period in milliseconds

      • securityAdvisorWebhook: (string)

        SecurityAdvisorWebhook is a webhook for IBM security advisor alert wizard, used to authenticate the wizard with the console and to pull data

    • certSettings: (object)

      CertSettings are the certificates settings

      • caExpiration: (datetime)

        CAExpiration holds the expiration date of the CA cert

      • consoleSAN: (string)

        ConsoleSAN if specified, use this list as the SAN for the console server certificate. Used for websocket and API

    • certificatePeriodDays: (integer)

      CertificatePeriodDays is the certificates period in days

    • checkRevocation: (boolean)

      CheckRevocation indicates whether cert revocation status is required

    • communicationPort: (integer)

      MgmtPortHttp is the console http port

    • consoleCaCert: (string)

      ConsoleCACert is a custom CA certificate for the console

    • consoleCustomCert: (object)

      ConsoleCustomCert is the custom console cert bundle

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • consoleNames: (string)

      ConsoleNames is a list of names to use when generating the console SAN certificate

    • customLabels: (object)

      CustomLabels are the custom labels settings

      • labels: (string)

        Labels are the custom labels

    • defenderSettings: (object)

      DefenderSettings holds the defender proxy settings

      • admissionControlEnabled: (boolean)

        AdmissionControlEnabled specifies if the admission controller is enabled

      • admissionControlWebhookSuffix: (string)

        AdmissionControlWebhookSuffix is the relative path to the admission control webhook http endpoint

      • automaticUpgrade: (boolean)

        AutomaticUpgrade indicates defenders should be automatically upgraded to the latest version

      • disconnectPeriodDays: (integer)

        DisconnectPeriodDays is the amount of consecutive days a defender must stays disconnected for it to be considered decommissioned

      • listeningPort: (integer)

        ListeningPort is the defender listening port

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether intelligence service is enabled

    • forensic: (object)

      Forensic is the forensic setting

      • collectNetworkFirewall: (boolean)

        CollectNetworkFirewall indicates whether network firewall collection is enabled

      • collectNetworkSnapshot: (boolean)

        CollectNetworkSnapshot indicates whether network snapshot collection is enabled

      • containerDiskUsageMb: (integer)

        ContainerDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used tostore the container historical forensic events

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether host and container forensic data collection is enabled

      • hostDiskUsageMb: (integer)

        HostDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used to storethe host historical forensic events

      • incidentSnapshotsCap: (integer)

        IncidentSnapshotCap is the maximum amount of incident snapshots we store

    • hasAdmin: (boolean)

      HasAdmin indicates whether the admin account is initialized

    • highAvailabilityEnabled: (boolean)

      Properties that are not stored in the DB

    • highAvailabilityHosts: (string)

      HighAvailabilityHosts is the list of hosts that participate in the high availability cluster

    • hpkp: (object)

      HPKP is the HTTP Public Key Pinning settings

      • certs: (string)

        Certs are the public certs used for fingerprinting

      • enabled: (boolean)
      • fingerprints: (string)

        SHA256 fingerprints of the certificates

    • kubernetesAudit: (object)

      KubernetesAuditSettings is the kubernetes audit settings

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the credential that is used to fetch k8s audit data from external resources (e.g., Stackdriver)

      • deploymentType: (object)

        DeploymentType indicates the type of the Kubernetes deployment audits source. Range of acceptable values: default, gke

      • stackdriverFilter: (string)

        StackdriverFilter is the advanced filter used for Stackdriver querying

      • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

        WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    • lastInitializedVersion: (string)

      LastInitializedVersion is the current version of the product

    • ldap: (object)

      LdapSettings are the ldap authentication settings

      • accountPassword: (object)

        AccountPassword is the UPN password used to connect to active directory server

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)
