          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • accountUpn: (string)

        AccountUpn is the user principle name used to connect to the active directory server

      • caCert: (string)

        CaCert is cert in PEM format (optional, if not specified, skip_verify flag will be used)

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether LDAP is enabled

      • groupSearchBase: (string)

        GroupSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for groups

      • searchBase: (string)

        SearchBase is the LDAP search pattern

      • type: (string)

        Type specifies the LDAP server type (AD or OpenLDAP)

      • url: (string)

        Url is the ldap server url

      • userSearchBase: (string)

        UserSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for users

      • userSearchIdentifier: (string)

        UserSearchIdentifier is the user identifier to use for querying open ldap (e.g., cn -> cn=user)

    • ldapEnabled: (boolean)

      LdapEnabled indicates whether ldap is enabled

    • licenseKey: (string)

      LicenseKey is the license key

    • logging: (object)

      Logging is the logging setting

      • consoleAddress: (string)

        ConsoleAddress is the console address used by the admin to access the console, used for creating links for runtime events

      • enableMetricsCollection: (boolean)

        EnableMetricsCollection indicates whether metric collections feature is enabled

      • includeRuntimeLink: (boolean)

        IncludeRuntimeLink indicates whether link to forensic event should be included in the output

      • stdout: (object)

        Stdout holds the stdout logging settings

        • allProcEvents: (boolean)

          AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

        • verboseScan: (boolean)

          VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

      • syslog: (object)

        Syslog holds the syslog logging settings

        • addr: (string)

          Addr is the remote address for sending events

        • allProcEvents: (boolean)

          AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID represents the user's custom identifier string

        • verboseScan: (boolean)

          VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    • logon: (object)

      Logon settings holds all logon settings

      • basicAuthDisabled: (boolean)

        Indicates whether the user can use basic auth

      • includeTLS: (boolean)

        IncludeTLS indicates that TLS checks should be included in copy links

      • sessionTimeoutSec: (integer)

        SessionTimeoutSec defines the session timeout in seconds

      • strongPassword: (boolean)

        StrongPassword indicates whether strong password enforcment is applied

      • useSupportCredentials: (boolean)

        UseSupportCredentials indicates whether to include credentials in the URL

    • pcfDroplets: (object)

      PCFDropletsSpecification is the pcf droplets scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • cloudControllerAddress: (string)

        CloudControllerAddress is the address of the cloud controller that provides the droplets

      • pattern: (string)

        Name is the droplet name

    • projects: (object)

      ProjectSettings are the project settings

      • master: (boolean)

        Master indicates that project feature is enabled and that this console is the master console and that

      • redirectURL: (string)

        RedirectURL is the redirectURL for the given project

    • proxy: (object)

      ProxySettings are the proxy settings

      • ca: (string)

        CA is the user proxy's CA

      • httpProxy: (string)

        HttpProxy is the http proxy to use

      • noProxy: (string)

        NoProxy is a list of addresses for which the proxy should not be used

      • password: (object)

        Password is the password to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • user: (string)

        User is the username to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

    • registry: (object)

      RegistrySettings holds credentials and configuration per registry

      • specifications: (object)

        Registries is the information for connecting to local/remote registries

        • cap: (integer)

          Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

        • credential: (object)

          Credential is the service provider authentication data

          • _id: (string)

            ID is a unique name for the credential

          • accountGUID: (string)

            AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

          • accountID: (string)

            AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

          • apiToken: (object)

            APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

            • encrypted: (string)
            • plain: (string)

              Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

          • caCert: (string)

            CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

          • lastModified: (datetime)

            Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

          • owner: (string)

            Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

          • secret: (object)

            Secret is the credential secret data

            • encrypted: (string)
            • plain: (string)

              Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

          • type: (object)

            Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

        • excludedRepositories: (string)

          ExcludedRepositories indicates which repositories are excluded in the registry scanning

        • excludedTags: (string)

          ExcludedTags indicates which tags are excluded in the registry scanning

        • hostname: (string)

          Hostname is the hostname of the defender that is used as registry scanner

        • jfrogRepoTypes: (object)

          JFrogRepoTypes indicates which JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan. Range of acceptable values: local, remote, virtual

        • namespace: (string)

          Namespace is the IBM Bluemix Namespace https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/Registry/registry_overview.html#registry_planning

        • os: (object)

          OS indicates the registry images base OS. Range of acceptable values: linux, windows

        • registry: (string)

          Registry contains either the registry name (e.g., gcr.io) or url (e.g., https://gcr.io)

        • repository: (string)
        • roleArn: (string)

          RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

        • scanners: (integer)

          Scanners indicates the amount of defenders assigned to scan this registry, this applies only for registries with auto-selected defenders

        • tag: (string)
        • useAWSRole: (boolean)

          UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

        • version: (string)
        • versionPattern: (string)

          VersionPattern indicates the version naming pattern heuristic for quickly filtering registry tags without querying all images for modification dates

      • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

        WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    • saml: (object)

      SamlSettings are the saml authentication settings

      • appId: (string)

        AppID is the Azure application ID

      • appSecret: (object)

        AppSecret is an Azure secret used in the identification process

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • audience: (string)

        Audience specifies the SAML audience used in the verification of the SAML response

      • cert: (string)

        Cert is idp certificate in PEM format

      • consoleURL: (string)

        ConsoleURL is the external Console URL that is used by the IDP for routing the browser after login

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether saml settings are enabled

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is idp issuer id

      • tenantId: (string)

        TenantID is the Azure Tenant ID

      • type: (object)

        Type specifies the SAML provider type. Range of acceptable values: okta, gsuite, ping, shibboleth, azure, adfs

      • url: (string)

        Url is idp sso url

    • samlEnabled: (boolean)

      SamlEnabled indicates whether saml is enabled

    • scan: (object)

      ScanSettings are the global settings for scanning

      • cloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        CloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs is the cloud platforms scan period in ms

      • containersScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ContainersScanPeriodMs is the container scan period in ms

      • disableCLIScanResults: (boolean)

        DisableCLIScanResults indicates that cli scan results should not be stored in the database

      • extractArchive: (boolean)

        ExtractArchive indicates whether to search within archive during scan is enabled

      • imagesScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ImageScanPeriodMs is the image scan period in ms

      • includeJsDependencies: (boolean)

        IncludeJsDependencies indicates whether to include packages from the "dependencies"

      • pcfDropletsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        PCFDropletsScanPeriodMs is the pcf scan period in ms

      • registryScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        RegistryScanPeriodMs is the registry scan period in ms

      • scanRunningImages: (boolean)

        ScanRunningImages indicates only images that are used by containers should be used

      • serverlessScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ServerlessScanPeriodMs is the serverless vulnerability scan period in ms

      • showInfraContainers: (boolean)

        ShowInfraContainers indicates infra containers should be shown

      • showNegligibleVulnerabilities: (boolean)

        ShowNegligibleVulnerabilities indicates whether to display negligible vulnerabilities (low severity)

      • systemScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        SystemScanPeriodMs is the host scan period in ms

      • vmScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        VMScanPeriodMs is the VM image scan period in ms

    • scapEnabled: (boolean)

      ScapEnabled indicates whether scap scanning is enabled

    • secretsStores: (object)

      SecretsStores is the secrets store settings

      • refreshPeriodHours: (integer)

        RefreshPeriodHours is the secret stores refresh time in hours

      • secretsStores: (object)

        Stores is the list of stores to fetch secrets from

        • appID: (string)

          AppID is the twistlock application id, as set in Cyberark store

        • caCert: (object)

          CaCert is a CA cert in PEM format, used to authenticate the store

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • clientCert: (object)

          ClientCert is the client cert bundle (key and cert)

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • credentialId: (string)

          CredentialID is the authentication credential id

        • name: (string)

          Name is the name of the secret store defined by the user

        • region: (string)

          Region is the secrets store's region

        • roleArn: (string)

          RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

        • type: (object)

          Type is the type of the secret store. Range of acceptable values: hashicorp, hashicorp010, cyberark, awsParameterStore, awsSecretsManager, azure

        • url: (string)

          URL is the secrets store's endpoint point

        • useAWSRole: (boolean)

          UseAWSRole is a flag indicates if local IAM role should be used for authentication, than all other credentials would be ignored

    • securedConsolePort: (integer)

      MgmtPortHttps is the console https port

    • serverlessAutoProtect: (object)

      ServerlessAutoProtectSpecs is the serverless auto-protection settings

      • consoleAddr: (string)

        ConsoleAddr represents the hostname of the console to connect to

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

      • lastModified: (datetime)

        LastModified is the last modified time of the specification

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the spec

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the runtime resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • runtimes: (string)

        Runtimes is the list of runtimes to which the spec applies

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • serverlessScan: (object)

      ServerlessScan is the serverless scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • credential: (object)

        Credential is the service provider authentication data

        • _id: (string)

          ID is a unique name for the credential

        • accountGUID: (string)

          AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

        • accountID: (string)

          AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

        • apiToken: (object)

          APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • caCert: (string)

          CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

        • lastModified: (datetime)

          Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

        • owner: (string)

          Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

        • secret: (object)

          Secret is the credential secret data

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • type: (object)

          Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

      • pattern: (string)

        Pattern is a pattern used when filtering function names

      • provider: (object)

        Provider is the serverless provider. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • telemetry: (object)

      TelemtrySettings determines whether to send telemetry data

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled determines whether the telemetry settings are enabled

    • token: (string)

      Token is the token used to access intelligence service

    • trustedCerts: (object)

      TrustedCerts is the list of trusted cert to allow in docker access scenarios

      • cn: (string)

        CN is the certificate common name

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is the certificate issuer

      • notAfter1: (datetime)

        NotAfter is the certificate expiration timeRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • notBefore1: (datetime)

        NotBefore is the minimum time for which the cert is validRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • raw: (string)

        Raw is the raw certificate (in PEM format)

    • trustedCertsEnabled: (boolean)

      TrustedCertsEnabled indicates whether to enable the trusted certificate feature

    • uploadDisabled: (boolean)

      UploadDisabled indicates whether logs uploading is disabled

    • version: (string)

      Version is the current console version

    • vms: (object)

      VMSettings is the VM scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • consoleAddr: (string)

        ConsoleAddr is the address the scanner agent uses to publish the results

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

      • excludedImages: (string)

        ExcludedImages indicates which images are excluded in the VM scanning

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the image resides

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the runtime resource associated with the data

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • scanners: (integer)

        Scanners indicates the amount of VMs that will be scanned concurrently

      • version: (string)

        Version indicates the type of the VM

    • windowsFeedEnabled: (boolean)

      WindowsFeedEnabled indicates whether windows feed is enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/custom-labels get post

    get

    Retrieves the list of alert labels configured in Console.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/custom-label

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    post

    Adds alert labels to the system. The following example designates the labels first and second as alert labels.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"labels": ["first","second"]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/custom-labels

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/custom-labels

    Retrieves the list of alert labels configured in Console.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/custom-label

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • labels: (string)

      Labels are the custom labels

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/custom-labels

    Adds alert labels to the system. The following example designates the labels first and second as alert labels.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"labels": ["first","second"]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/custom-labels

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Headers

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    /settings/defender post

    post

    This endpoint will allow you to manage the advanced settings from Manage > Defenders > Mangage page in the console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set the local defender API port to 9998, turn on Defender runc proxy, and set the number of days to automatically remove disconnected defenders to 4:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"disconnectPeriodDays":4,"listeningPort":9998,"runcProxyEnabled":true}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/defender

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post /settings/defender

    This endpoint will allow you to manage the advanced settings from Manage > Defenders > Mangage page in the console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set the local defender API port to 9998, turn on Defender runc proxy, and set the number of days to automatically remove disconnected defenders to 4:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"disconnectPeriodDays":4,"listeningPort":9998,"runcProxyEnabled":true}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/defender

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • admissionControlEnabled: (boolean)

      AdmissionControlEnabled specifies if the admission controller is enabled

    • admissionControlWebhookSuffix: (string)

      AdmissionControlWebhookSuffix is the relative path to the admission control webhook http endpoint

    • automaticUpgrade: (boolean)

      AutomaticUpgrade indicates defenders should be automatically upgraded to the latest version

    • disconnectPeriodDays: (integer)

      DisconnectPeriodDays is the amount of consecutive days a defender must stays disconnected for it to be considered decommissioned

    • listeningPort: (integer)

      ListeningPort is the defender listening port

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/forensic get post

    get

    Retrieves the settings for the forensics system.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/forensic

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configures the forensics system.

    The following example curl command allocates 100 MB of local disk space for container forensic data and 10 MB for host forensics data.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"enabled": true,
"containerDiskUsageMb": 100,
"hostDiskUsageMb": 10   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/forensic

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/forensic

    Retrieves the settings for the forensics system.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/forensic

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • collectNetworkFirewall: (boolean)

      CollectNetworkFirewall indicates whether network firewall collection is enabled

    • collectNetworkSnapshot: (boolean)

      CollectNetworkSnapshot indicates whether network snapshot collection is enabled

    • containerDiskUsageMb: (integer)

      ContainerDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used tostore the container historical forensic events

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether host and container forensic data collection is enabled

    • hostDiskUsageMb: (integer)

      HostDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used to storethe host historical forensic events

    • incidentSnapshotsCap: (integer)

      IncidentSnapshotCap is the maximum amount of incident snapshots we store

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/forensic

    Configures the forensics system.

    The following example curl command allocates 100 MB of local disk space for container forensic data and 10 MB for host forensics data.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"enabled": true,
"containerDiskUsageMb": 100,
"hostDiskUsageMb": 10   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/forensic

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • collectNetworkFirewall: (boolean)

      CollectNetworkFirewall indicates whether network firewall collection is enabled

    • collectNetworkSnapshot: (boolean)

      CollectNetworkSnapshot indicates whether network snapshot collection is enabled

    • containerDiskUsageMb: (integer)

      ContainerDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used tostore the container historical forensic events

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether host and container forensic data collection is enabled

    • hostDiskUsageMb: (integer)

      HostDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used to storethe host historical forensic events

    • incidentSnapshotsCap: (integer)

      IncidentSnapshotCap is the maximum amount of incident snapshots we store

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/initialized get

    get

    Checks whether Console has been configured with an initial admin account. After first installing Console, the first thing you must do is create an admin account.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/initialized

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: none.

    get /settings/initialized

    Checks whether Console has been configured with an initial admin account. After first installing Console, the first thing you must do is create an admin account.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/initialized

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: none.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • initialized: (boolean)

      Initialized indicates whether the console is initialized

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    /settings/intelligence get post

    get

    Gets details about the Intelligence Stream configuration.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve your Intelligence Stream configuration settings.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/intelligence

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configures the Intelligence Stream.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to configure settings of your Intelligence Stream.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"windowsFeedEnabled": true,
"enabled": true,
"address": "https://intelligence.twistlock.com",
"token": "<TOKEN>",   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/intelligence

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/intelligence

    Gets details about the Intelligence Stream configuration.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve your Intelligence Stream configuration settings.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/intelligence

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • address: (string)

      Address is the intelligence service address

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether intelligence service is enabled

    • token: (string)

      Token is the token used to access intelligence service

    • uploadDisabled: (boolean)

      UploadDisabled indicates whether logs uploading is disabled

    • windowsFeedEnabled: (boolean)

      WindowsFeedEnabled indicates whether windows feed is enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to configure settings of your Intelligence Stream.

-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"windowsFeedEnabled": true,
"enabled": true,
"address": "https://intelligence.twistlock.com",
"token": "<TOKEN>",   
}' \

    Body

    Type: object

    Properties

      Address is the intelligence service address

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether intelligence service is enabled

    • token: (string)

      Token is the token used to access intelligence service

      UploadDisabled indicates whether logs uploading is disabled

      WindowsFeedEnabled indicates whether windows feed is enabled

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    /settings/intelligence-windows post

    post

    This endpoint will enable or disable the Windows Intelligence Service from Manage > System > Intelligence page in the console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to enable online updates of Windows vulnerabilities from the intelligence stream:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"windowsFeedEnabled":true}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/intelligence-windows

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post /settings/intelligence-windows

    This endpoint will enable or disable the Windows Intelligence Service from Manage > System > Intelligence page in the console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to enable online updates of Windows vulnerabilities from the intelligence stream:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"windowsFeedEnabled":true}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/intelligence-windows

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • address: (string)

      Address is the intelligence service address

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether intelligence service is enabled

    • token: (string)

      Token is the token used to access intelligence service

    • uploadDisabled: (boolean)

      UploadDisabled indicates whether logs uploading is disabled

    • windowsFeedEnabled: (boolean)

      WindowsFeedEnabled indicates whether windows feed is enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/kubernetes-audit get post

    get

    KubernetesAuditSettings returns the Kubernetes audit settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    SetKubernetesAuditSettings validates and sets the given Kubernetes audit settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/kubernetes-audit

    KubernetesAuditSettings returns the Kubernetes audit settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • credentialID: (string)

      CredentialID is the credential that is used to fetch k8s audit data from external resources (e.g., Stackdriver)

    • deploymentType: (object)

      DeploymentType indicates the type of the Kubernetes deployment audits source. Range of acceptable values: default, gke

    • stackdriverFilter: (string)

      StackdriverFilter is the advanced filter used for Stackdriver querying

    • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

      WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/kubernetes-audit

    SetKubernetesAuditSettings validates and sets the given Kubernetes audit settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

      CredentialID is the credential that is used to fetch k8s audit data from external resources (e.g., Stackdriver)

    • deploymentType: (object)

      DeploymentType indicates the type of the Kubernetes deployment audits source. Range of acceptable values: default, gke

    • stackdriverFilter: (string)

      StackdriverFilter is the advanced filter used for Stackdriver querying

    • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

      WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/latest-version get

    get

    This endpoint will return the latest version of the product.

-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/latest-version

    Success

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • latestVersion: (string)

      LatestVersion is the latest official product version

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    /settings/ldap get post

    get

    Retrieves your LDAP integration settings.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/ldap

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configures the LDAP integration.

    The following example curl command enables LDAP integration and specifies the parameters required to integrate with an Active Directory service.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"enabled": true,
"url": "ldap://ldapserver.example.com:3268",
"searchBase": "dc=example,dc=com",
"accountUpn": "twistlock_service@example.com",
"accountPassword": {
 "plain": "pass!-W0RD"
},
"type": "activedirectory",
"userSearchIdentifier": "userprincipalname"   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/ldap

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/ldap

    Retrieves your LDAP integration settings.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/ldap

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • accountPassword: (object)

      AccountPassword is the UPN password used to connect to active directory server

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • accountUpn: (string)

      AccountUpn is the user principle name used to connect to the active directory server

    • caCert: (string)

      CaCert is cert in PEM format (optional, if not specified, skip_verify flag will be used)

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether LDAP is enabled

    • groupSearchBase: (string)

      GroupSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for groups

    • searchBase: (string)

      SearchBase is the LDAP search pattern

    • type: (string)

      Type specifies the LDAP server type (AD or OpenLDAP)

    • url: (string)

      Url is the ldap server url

    • userSearchBase: (string)

      UserSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for users

    • userSearchIdentifier: (string)

      UserSearchIdentifier is the user identifier to use for querying open ldap (e.g., cn -> cn=user)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/ldap

    Configures the LDAP integration.

    The following example curl command enables LDAP integration and specifies the parameters required to integrate with an Active Directory service.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"enabled": true,
"url": "ldap://ldapserver.example.com:3268",
"searchBase": "dc=example,dc=com",
"accountUpn": "twistlock_service@example.com",
"accountPassword": {
 "plain": "pass!-W0RD"
},
"type": "activedirectory",
"userSearchIdentifier": "userprincipalname"   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/ldap

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • accountPassword: (object)

      AccountPassword is the UPN password used to connect to active directory server

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • accountUpn: (string)

      AccountUpn is the user principle name used to connect to the active directory server

    • caCert: (string)

      CaCert is cert in PEM format (optional, if not specified, skip_verify flag will be used)

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether LDAP is enabled

    • groupSearchBase: (string)

      GroupSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for groups

    • searchBase: (string)

      SearchBase is the LDAP search pattern

    • type: (string)

      Type specifies the LDAP server type (AD or OpenLDAP)

    • url: (string)

      Url is the ldap server url

    • userSearchBase: (string)

      UserSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for users

    • userSearchIdentifier: (string)

      UserSearchIdentifier is the user identifier to use for querying open ldap (e.g., cn -> cn=user)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/license get post

    get

    Gets details about the installed license.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve your license details.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/license

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: user.

    post

    Sets up your Twistlock license. Use this endpoint, along with /api/v1/signup, as part of the initial set up flow after Twistlock is first installed.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set your license.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"key": "<LICENSE_KEY>"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/license

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/license

    Gets details about the installed license.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve your license details.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/license

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: user.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • access_token: (string)

      AccessToken is the customer access token

    • contract_id: (string)

      ContractID is the customer contract ID

    • customer_email: (string)

      CustomerEmail is the customer email address

    • customer_id: (string)

      CustomerID is the customer ID

    • defender_details: (object)

      DefenderDetails respresents the defenders license details

      • category: (object)

        Category is the licensed defender category. Range of acceptable values: container, host, serverless, appEmbedded

      • count: (integer)

        Count is the amount of licensed defenders

    • defenders: (integer)

      Defenders is the maximum number of defender allowed in this license. Deprecated: use DefenderDetails field instead

    • expiration_date: (datetime)

      ExpirationDate is the license expiration date

    • issue_date: (datetime)

      IssueDate is the license issue date

    • type: (object)

      LicenseTiers represents the customer license tier. Range of acceptable values: developer, enterprise, evaluation, oem

    • workloads: (integer)

      Workloads is the number of workloads per license

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/license

    Sets up your Twistlock license. Use this endpoint, along with /api/v1/signup, as part of the initial set up flow after Twistlock is first installed.

      Key is the license key

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/logging get post

    get

    Gets the logging settings.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve your logging details.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logging

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configure your logging settings. This includes Syslog, Stdout, and Prometheus instrumentation.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to turn on "syslog" with "VerboseScan" and "stdout" with "VerboseScan".

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"syslog": {
 "enabled": true,
 "verboseScan": true,
 "allProcEvents": false,
 "addr": ""
 },
"stdout": {
 "enabled": true,
 "verboseScan": true,
 "allProcEvents": false,
 }   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logging

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/logging

    Gets the logging settings.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve your logging details.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logging

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • consoleAddress: (string)

      ConsoleAddress is the console address used by the admin to access the console, used for creating links for runtime events

    • enableMetricsCollection: (boolean)

      EnableMetricsCollection indicates whether metric collections feature is enabled

    • includeRuntimeLink: (boolean)

      IncludeRuntimeLink indicates whether link to forensic event should be included in the output

    • stdout: (object)

      Stdout holds the stdout logging settings

      • allProcEvents: (boolean)

        AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

      • verboseScan: (boolean)

        VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    • syslog: (object)

      Syslog holds the syslog logging settings

      • addr: (string)

        Addr is the remote address for sending events

      • allProcEvents: (boolean)

        AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

      • id: (string)

        ID represents the user's custom identifier string

      • verboseScan: (boolean)

        VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/logging

    Configure your logging settings. This includes Syslog, Stdout, and Prometheus instrumentation.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to turn on "syslog" with "VerboseScan" and "stdout" with "VerboseScan".

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"syslog": {
 "enabled": true,
 "verboseScan": true,
 "allProcEvents": false,
 "addr": ""
 },
"stdout": {
 "enabled": true,
 "verboseScan": true,
 "allProcEvents": false,
 }   
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logging

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • consoleAddress: (string)

      ConsoleAddress is the console address used by the admin to access the console, used for creating links for runtime events

    • enableMetricsCollection: (boolean)

      EnableMetricsCollection indicates whether metric collections feature is enabled

    • includeRuntimeLink: (boolean)

      IncludeRuntimeLink indicates whether link to forensic event should be included in the output

    • stdout: (object)

      Stdout holds the stdout logging settings

      • allProcEvents: (boolean)

        AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

      • verboseScan: (boolean)

        VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    • syslog: (object)

      Syslog holds the syslog logging settings

      • addr: (string)

        Addr is the remote address for sending events

      • allProcEvents: (boolean)

        AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

      • id: (string)

        ID represents the user's custom identifier string

      • verboseScan: (boolean)

        VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/logon get post

    get

    Configures various logon settings.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve all current logon settings.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logon

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configures the timeout for Console sessions.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set the timeout to 900 seconds (15 minutes).

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"sessionTimeoutSec": 900}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logon

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/logon

    Configures various logon settings.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve all current logon settings.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logon

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • basicAuthDisabled: (boolean)

      Indicates whether the user can use basic auth

    • includeTLS: (boolean)

      IncludeTLS indicates that TLS checks should be included in copy links

    • sessionTimeoutSec: (integer)

      SessionTimeoutSec defines the session timeout in seconds

    • strongPassword: (boolean)

      StrongPassword indicates whether strong password enforcment is applied

    • useSupportCredentials: (boolean)

      UseSupportCredentials indicates whether to include credentials in the URL

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

-X POST \
-d '{"sessionTimeoutSec": 900}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/logon

    • strongPassword: (boolean)

    • useSupportCredentials: (boolean)

      UseSupportCredentials indicates whether to include credentials in the URL

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    /settings/pcf get post

    get

    This endpoint will return settings for PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry)Blobstore scanning, which can be found in the console under Defend > Vulnerabilities > PCF Blobstore. This requires that you have a defender configured for PCF Blobstore scanning. For more information, see PCF blobstore scanning.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the current PCF Blobstore scanning settings:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/pcf

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    This endpoint will allow for updating settings for PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry) Blobstore scanning.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set up a PCF Blobstore scanner that scans the last 5 droplets for every droplet in the PCF Blobstore:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"cap":"5","cloudControllerAddress":"https://my-cloud-controller.twistlock.com","pattern":"*"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/pcf

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/pcf

    This endpoint will return settings for PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry)Blobstore scanning, which can be found in the console under Defend > Vulnerabilities > PCF Blobstore. This requires that you have a defender configured for PCF Blobstore scanning. For more information, see PCF blobstore scanning.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve the current PCF Blobstore scanning settings:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/pcf

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cap: (integer)

      Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

    • cloudControllerAddress: (string)

      CloudControllerAddress is the address of the cloud controller that provides the droplets

    • pattern: (string)

      Name is the droplet name

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/pcf

    This endpoint will allow for updating settings for PCF (Pivotal Cloud Foundry) Blobstore scanning.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set up a PCF Blobstore scanner that scans the last 5 droplets for every droplet in the PCF Blobstore:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"cap":"5","cloudControllerAddress":"https://my-cloud-controller.twistlock.com","pattern":"*"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/pcf

    • pattern: (string)

      Name is the droplet name

    Secured by basicAuth

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    /settings/projects get post

    get

    Tells you whether the Projects feature is enabled. Projects are enabled when an instance of Console is designated as master.

    The following example curl command retrieves the state of the Projects feature from Console.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/projects

    If you direct the request to a supervisor Console, the response object tells you the URL Central Console (master) uses to communicate with the supervisor Console. All API calls must be proxied through Central Console, where the request is automatically rerouted to the appropriate supervisor Console. To retrieve the Projects settings from a supervisor Console, append the project query parameter to your request.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CENTRAL-CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/projects?project=<PROJECT_NAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post

    Enables or disables the Projects feature. Projects are enabled when an instance of Console is designated as master.

    The following example curl command designates <CONSOLE> as master.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"master":true
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/projects

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/projects

    Tells you whether the Projects feature is enabled. Projects are enabled when an instance of Console is designated as master.

    The following example curl command retrieves the state of the Projects feature from Console.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/projects

    If you direct the request to a supervisor Console, the response object tells you the URL Central Console (master) uses to communicate with the supervisor Console. All API calls must be proxied through Central Console, where the request is automatically rerouted to the appropriate supervisor Console. To retrieve the Projects settings from a supervisor Console, append the project query parameter to your request.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CENTRAL-CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/projects?project=<PROJECT_NAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • master: (boolean)

      Master indicates that project feature is enabled and that this console is the master console and that

    • redirectURL: (string)

      RedirectURL is the redirectURL for the given project

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Enables or disables the Projects feature. Projects are enabled when an instance of Console is designated as master.

    The following example curl command designates <CONSOLE> as master.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \

"master":true

https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/projects
