    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • master: (boolean)

      Master indicates that project feature is enabled and that this console is the master console and that

    • redirectURL: (string)

      RedirectURL is the redirectURL for the given project

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/proxy get post

    get

    Retrieves the proxy settings for Twistlock containers to access the Internet.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/proxy

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configures the proxy settings.

    The following example curl command specifies the proxy to use to access the Internet.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"httpProxy":"http://proxyserver.example.com:8282"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/proxy

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/proxy

    Retrieves the proxy settings for Twistlock containers to access the Internet.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/proxy

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • ca: (string)

      CA is the user proxy's CA

    • httpProxy: (string)

      HttpProxy is the http proxy to use

    • noProxy: (string)

      NoProxy is a list of addresses for which the proxy should not be used

    • password: (object)

      Password is the password to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • user: (string)

      User is the username to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/proxy

    Configures the proxy settings.

    The following example curl command specifies the proxy to use to access the Internet.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"httpProxy":"http://proxyserver.example.com:8282"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/proxy

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    Type: object

    Properties
    • ca: (string)

      CA is the user proxy's CA

    • httpProxy: (string)

      HttpProxy is the http proxy to use

    • noProxy: (string)

      NoProxy is a list of addresses for which the proxy should not be used

    • password: (object)

      Password is the password to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • user: (string)

      User is the username to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/registry get post put

    get

    Retrieves a list of registries Twistlock has been configured to scan.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Specifies a single registry to scan.

    Each registry to scan is specified as an item in the specifications array. The POST method appends an entry to the specifications array. In contrast, the PUT method adds all registries in a single shot, completely overwriting any previous configuration by replacing the contents of the specifications array. For more information about the specifications array, see the GET endpoint.

    The following example curl command configures Twistlock to scan the Ubuntu 16.04 repository on Docker Hub.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '
{
"version": "2",
"registry": "",
"repository": "library/alpine",
"tag": "16.04",
"os": "linux",
"cap": 5,
"hostname": "",
"scanners": 2
} ' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    put

    Specifies the registries to scan. The list of registries is set in a single shot. Any previous settings are completely overwritten.

    Each registry to scan is specified as an item in the specifications array.

    The following example curl command configures Twistlock to scan the Ubuntu 18.04 and Alpine 3.10 images in Docker Hub.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '
{
"specifications": [
  {
    "version": "2",
    "registry": "",
    "repository": "library/ubuntu",
    "tag": "18.04",
    "os": "linux",
    "cap": 5,
    "hostname": "",
    "scanners": 2
  },
  {
    "version": "2",
    "registry": "",
    "repository": "library/alpine",
    "tag": "3.10",
    "os": "linux",
    "cap": 5,
    "hostname": "",
    "scanners": 2
  }
]
} ' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    To remove a registry from the list, retrieve the current list using the GET method. Then remove the entry from the specifications array, and PUT the updated JSON object.

    To delete all entries, submit an empty specifications array:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '{"specifications":[]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/registry

    Retrieves a list of registries Twistlock has been configured to scan.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • specifications: (object)

      Registries is the information for connecting to local/remote registries

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • credential: (object)

        Credential is the service provider authentication data

        • _id: (string)

          ID is a unique name for the credential

        • accountGUID: (string)

          AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

        • accountID: (string)

          AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

        • apiToken: (object)

          APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • caCert: (string)

          CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

        • lastModified: (datetime)

          Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

        • owner: (string)

          Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

        • secret: (object)

          Secret is the credential secret data

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • type: (object)

          Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

      • excludedRepositories: (string)

        ExcludedRepositories indicates which repositories are excluded in the registry scanning

      • excludedTags: (string)

        ExcludedTags indicates which tags are excluded in the registry scanning

      • hostname: (string)

        Hostname is the hostname of the defender that is used as registry scanner

      • jfrogRepoTypes: (object)

        JFrogRepoTypes indicates which JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan. Range of acceptable values: local, remote, virtual

      • namespace: (string)

        Namespace is the IBM Bluemix Namespace https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/Registry/registry_overview.html#registry_planning

      • os: (object)

        OS indicates the registry images base OS. Range of acceptable values: linux, windows

      • registry: (string)

        Registry contains either the registry name (e.g., gcr.io) or url (e.g., https://gcr.io)

      • repository: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • scanners: (integer)

        Scanners indicates the amount of defenders assigned to scan this registry, this applies only for registries with auto-selected defenders

      • tag: (string)
      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

      • version: (string)
      • versionPattern: (string)

        VersionPattern indicates the version naming pattern heuristic for quickly filtering registry tags without querying all images for modification dates

    • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

      WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/registry

    Specifies a single registry to scan.

    Each registry to scan is specified as an item in the specifications array. The POST method appends an entry to the specifications array. In contrast, the PUT method adds all registries in a single shot, completely overwriting any previous configuration by replacing the contents of the specifications array. For more information about the specifications array, see the GET endpoint.

    The following example curl command configures Twistlock to scan the Ubuntu 16.04 repository on Docker Hub.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '
{
"version": "2",
"registry": "",
"repository": "library/alpine",
"tag": "16.04",
"os": "linux",
"cap": 5,
"hostname": "",
"scanners": 2
} ' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cap: (integer)

      Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

    • credential: (object)

      Credential is the service provider authentication data

      • _id: (string)

        ID is a unique name for the credential

      • accountGUID: (string)

        AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

      • accountID: (string)

        AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

      • apiToken: (object)

        APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • caCert: (string)

        CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

      • lastModified: (datetime)

        Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

      • owner: (string)

        Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

      • secret: (object)

        Secret is the credential secret data

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • type: (object)

        Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

    • excludedRepositories: (string)

      ExcludedRepositories indicates which repositories are excluded in the registry scanning

    • excludedTags: (string)

      ExcludedTags indicates which tags are excluded in the registry scanning

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the hostname of the defender that is used as registry scanner

    • jfrogRepoTypes: (object)

      JFrogRepoTypes indicates which JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan. Range of acceptable values: local, remote, virtual

    • namespace: (string)

      Namespace is the IBM Bluemix Namespace https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/Registry/registry_overview.html#registry_planning

    • os: (object)

      OS indicates the registry images base OS. Range of acceptable values: linux, windows

    • registry: (string)

      Registry contains either the registry name (e.g., gcr.io) or url (e.g., https://gcr.io)

    • repository: (string)
    • roleArn: (string)

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • scanners: (integer)

      Scanners indicates the amount of defenders assigned to scan this registry, this applies only for registries with auto-selected defenders

    • tag: (string)
    • useAWSRole: (boolean)

      UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • version: (string)
    • versionPattern: (string)

      VersionPattern indicates the version naming pattern heuristic for quickly filtering registry tags without querying all images for modification dates

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /settings/registry

    Specifies the registries to scan. The list of registries is set in a single shot. Any previous settings are completely overwritten.

    Each registry to scan is specified as an item in the specifications array.

    The following example curl command configures Twistlock to scan the Ubuntu 18.04 and Alpine 3.10 images in Docker Hub.

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '
{
"specifications": [
  {
    "version": "2",
    "registry": "",
    "repository": "library/ubuntu",
    "tag": "18.04",
    "os": "linux",
    "cap": 5,
    "hostname": "",
    "scanners": 2
  },
  {
    "version": "2",
    "registry": "",
    "repository": "library/alpine",
    "tag": "3.10",
    "os": "linux",
    "cap": 5,
    "hostname": "",
    "scanners": 2
  }
]
} ' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    To remove a registry from the list, retrieve the current list using the GET method. Then remove the entry from the specifications array, and PUT the updated JSON object.

    To delete all entries, submit an empty specifications array:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '{"specifications":[]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/registry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • specifications: (object)

      Registries is the information for connecting to local/remote registries

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • credential: (object)

        Credential is the service provider authentication data

        • _id: (string)

          ID is a unique name for the credential

        • accountGUID: (string)

          AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

        • accountID: (string)

          AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

        • apiToken: (object)

          APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • caCert: (string)

          CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

        • lastModified: (datetime)

          Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

        • owner: (string)

          Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

        • secret: (object)

          Secret is the credential secret data

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • type: (object)

          Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

      • excludedRepositories: (string)

        ExcludedRepositories indicates which repositories are excluded in the registry scanning

      • excludedTags: (string)

        ExcludedTags indicates which tags are excluded in the registry scanning

      • hostname: (string)

        Hostname is the hostname of the defender that is used as registry scanner

      • jfrogRepoTypes: (object)

        JFrogRepoTypes indicates which JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan. Range of acceptable values: local, remote, virtual

      • namespace: (string)

        Namespace is the IBM Bluemix Namespace https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/Registry/registry_overview.html#registry_planning

      • os: (object)

        OS indicates the registry images base OS. Range of acceptable values: linux, windows

      • registry: (string)

        Registry contains either the registry name (e.g., gcr.io) or url (e.g., https://gcr.io)

      • repository: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • scanners: (integer)

        Scanners indicates the amount of defenders assigned to scan this registry, this applies only for registries with auto-selected defenders

      • tag: (string)
      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

      • version: (string)
      • versionPattern: (string)

        VersionPattern indicates the version naming pattern heuristic for quickly filtering registry tags without querying all images for modification dates

    • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

      WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/saml get post

    get

    This endpoint will return the configured SAML settings configured to authenticate to the Twistlock console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve you SAML settings:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/saml

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    This endpoint let's you configure SAML settings configured to authenticate to the Twistlock console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set up enable SAML integration with Twistlock, set the Identity provider to ADFS, set the Identity provide single sign-on URL to https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/SSO, set the Identity provider issuer to https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/services/trust, set the x.509 Certificate to CERTIFICATE, and to set the audience to twistlock:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{
"enabled": true,
"url": "https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/SSO",
"cert": "<CERTIFICATE>",
"issuer": "https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/services/trust",
"type": "adfs",
"audience": "twistlock",
"appId": "",
"tenantId": "",
"appSecret": {
    "encrypted": ""
}
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/saml

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/saml

    This endpoint will return the configured SAML settings configured to authenticate to the Twistlock console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve you SAML settings:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/saml

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • appId: (string)

      AppID is the Azure application ID

    • appSecret: (object)

      AppSecret is an Azure secret used in the identification process

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • audience: (string)

      Audience specifies the SAML audience used in the verification of the SAML response

    • cert: (string)

      Cert is idp certificate in PEM format

    • consoleURL: (string)

      ConsoleURL is the external Console URL that is used by the IDP for routing the browser after login

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether saml settings are enabled

    • issuer: (string)

      Issuer is idp issuer id

    • tenantId: (string)

      TenantID is the Azure Tenant ID

    • type: (object)

      Type specifies the SAML provider type. Range of acceptable values: okta, gsuite, ping, shibboleth, azure, adfs

    • url: (string)

      Url is idp sso url

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/saml

    This endpoint let's you configure SAML settings configured to authenticate to the Twistlock console.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to set up enable SAML integration with Twistlock, set the Identity provider to ADFS, set the Identity provide single sign-on URL to https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/SSO, set the Identity provider issuer to https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/services/trust, set the x.509 Certificate to CERTIFICATE, and to set the audience to twistlock:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{
"enabled": true,
"url": "https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/SSO",
"cert": "<CERTIFICATE>",
"issuer": "https://my-adfs-server.twistlock.com/adfs/services/trust",
"type": "adfs",
"audience": "twistlock",
"appId": "",
"tenantId": "",
"appSecret": {
    "encrypted": ""
}
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/saml

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • appId: (string)

      AppID is the Azure application ID

    • appSecret: (object)

      AppSecret is an Azure secret used in the identification process

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • audience: (string)

      Audience specifies the SAML audience used in the verification of the SAML response

    • cert: (string)

      Cert is idp certificate in PEM format

    • consoleURL: (string)

      ConsoleURL is the external Console URL that is used by the IDP for routing the browser after login

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether saml settings are enabled

    • issuer: (string)

      Issuer is idp issuer id

    • tenantId: (string)

      TenantID is the Azure Tenant ID

    • type: (object)

      Type specifies the SAML provider type. Range of acceptable values: okta, gsuite, ping, shibboleth, azure, adfs

    • url: (string)

      Url is idp sso url

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/scan get post

    get

    Retrieves the global settings for image, host, container, and registry scanning.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Configures the Twistlock scanner.

    The following example curl command configures the following scan intervals:

    • Scan registries and serverless functions once per week.
    • Scan images, containers, and hosts once per day.
    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"imagesScanPeriodMs":86400000,
"containersScanPeriodMs": 86400000,
"systemScanPeriodMs": 86400000,
"serverlessScanPeriodMs": 604800000,
"registryScanPeriodMs":604800000
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/scan

    Retrieves the global settings for image, host, container, and registry scanning.

    Example curl command:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      CloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs is the cloud platforms scan period in ms

    • containersScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      ContainersScanPeriodMs is the container scan period in ms

    • disableCLIScanResults: (boolean)

      DisableCLIScanResults indicates that cli scan results should not be stored in the database

    • extractArchive: (boolean)

      ExtractArchive indicates whether to search within archive during scan is enabled

    • imagesScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      ImageScanPeriodMs is the image scan period in ms

    • includeJsDependencies: (boolean)

      IncludeJsDependencies indicates whether to include packages from the "dependencies"

    • pcfDropletsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      PCFDropletsScanPeriodMs is the pcf scan period in ms

    • registryScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      RegistryScanPeriodMs is the registry scan period in ms

    • scanRunningImages: (boolean)

      ScanRunningImages indicates only images that are used by containers should be used

    • serverlessScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      ServerlessScanPeriodMs is the serverless vulnerability scan period in ms

    • showInfraContainers: (boolean)

      ShowInfraContainers indicates infra containers should be shown

    • showNegligibleVulnerabilities: (boolean)

      ShowNegligibleVulnerabilities indicates whether to display negligible vulnerabilities (low severity)

    • systemScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      SystemScanPeriodMs is the host scan period in ms

    • vmScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      VMScanPeriodMs is the VM image scan period in ms

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/scan

    Configures the Twistlock scanner.

    The following example curl command configures the following scan intervals:

    • Scan registries and serverless functions once per week.
    • Scan images, containers, and hosts once per day.
    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"imagesScanPeriodMs":86400000,
"containersScanPeriodMs": 86400000,
"systemScanPeriodMs": 86400000,
"serverlessScanPeriodMs": 604800000,
"registryScanPeriodMs":604800000
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/scan

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      CloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs is the cloud platforms scan period in ms

    • containersScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      ContainersScanPeriodMs is the container scan period in ms

    • disableCLIScanResults: (boolean)

      DisableCLIScanResults indicates that cli scan results should not be stored in the database

    • extractArchive: (boolean)

      ExtractArchive indicates whether to search within archive during scan is enabled

    • imagesScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      ImageScanPeriodMs is the image scan period in ms

    • includeJsDependencies: (boolean)

      IncludeJsDependencies indicates whether to include packages from the "dependencies"

    • pcfDropletsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      PCFDropletsScanPeriodMs is the pcf scan period in ms

    • registryScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      RegistryScanPeriodMs is the registry scan period in ms

    • scanRunningImages: (boolean)

      ScanRunningImages indicates only images that are used by containers should be used

    • serverlessScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      ServerlessScanPeriodMs is the serverless vulnerability scan period in ms

    • showInfraContainers: (boolean)

      ShowInfraContainers indicates infra containers should be shown

    • showNegligibleVulnerabilities: (boolean)

      ShowNegligibleVulnerabilities indicates whether to display negligible vulnerabilities (low severity)

    • systemScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      SystemScanPeriodMs is the host scan period in ms

    • vmScanPeriodMs: (integer)

      VMScanPeriodMs is the VM image scan period in ms

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/secrets get post

    get

    This endpoint will return configured secret store already configured in the console. This can be found in the console under Manage > Authentication > Secrets.

    The following example curl command retrieves any configured secret stores, as well as the refresh period in hours:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    This endpoint will updates your secret store settings found in the console under Manage > Authentication > Secrets.

    Please note the data structure returned from endpoint /settings/secrets GET to set in POST

    The following example curl command adds a cyberark secret store to the console with the appID set to Twistlock_Console and the URL set to https://services-myca.twistlock.com:10882:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{
"secretsStores": [
{
  "name": "Cyberark",
  "type": "cyberark",
  "appID": "Twistlock_Console",
  "url": "https://services-myca.twistlock.com:10882",
  "caCert": {
    "encrypted": ""
  },
  "clientCert": {
    "encrypted": ""
  },
  "useAWSRole": false,
  "region": "",
  "credentialId": "",
  "roleArn": ""
}
]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/secrets

    This endpoint will return configured secret store already configured in the console. This can be found in the console under Manage > Authentication > Secrets.

    The following example curl command retrieves any configured secret stores, as well as the refresh period in hours:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • refreshPeriodHours: (integer)

      RefreshPeriodHours is the secret stores refresh time in hours

    • secretsStores: (object)

      Stores is the list of stores to fetch secrets from

      • appID: (string)

        AppID is the twistlock application id, as set in Cyberark store

      • caCert: (object)

        CaCert is a CA cert in PEM format, used to authenticate the store

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clientCert: (object)

        ClientCert is the client cert bundle (key and cert)

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • credentialId: (string)

        CredentialID is the authentication credential id

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the secret store defined by the user

      • region: (string)

        Region is the secrets store's region

      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • type: (object)

        Type is the type of the secret store. Range of acceptable values: hashicorp, hashicorp010, cyberark, awsParameterStore, awsSecretsManager, azure

      • url: (string)

        URL is the secrets store's endpoint point

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole is a flag indicates if local IAM role should be used for authentication, than all other credentials would be ignored

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/secrets

    This endpoint will updates your secret store settings found in the console under Manage > Authentication > Secrets.

    Please note the data structure returned from endpoint /settings/secrets GET to set in POST

    The following example curl command adds a cyberark secret store to the console with the appID set to Twistlock_Console and the URL set to https://services-myca.twistlock.com:10882:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{
"secretsStores": [
{
  "name": "Cyberark",
  "type": "cyberark",
  "appID": "Twistlock_Console",
  "url": "https://services-myca.twistlock.com:10882",
  "caCert": {
    "encrypted": ""
  },
  "clientCert": {
    "encrypted": ""
  },
  "useAWSRole": false,
  "region": "",
  "credentialId": "",
  "roleArn": ""
}
]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • refreshPeriodHours: (integer)

      RefreshPeriodHours is the secret stores refresh time in hours

    • secretsStores: (object)

      Stores is the list of stores to fetch secrets from

      • appID: (string)

        AppID is the twistlock application id, as set in Cyberark store

      • caCert: (object)

        CaCert is a CA cert in PEM format, used to authenticate the store

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • clientCert: (object)

        ClientCert is the client cert bundle (key and cert)

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • credentialId: (string)

        CredentialID is the authentication credential id

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the secret store defined by the user

      • region: (string)

        Region is the secrets store's region

      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • type: (object)

        Type is the type of the secret store. Range of acceptable values: hashicorp, hashicorp010, cyberark, awsParameterStore, awsSecretsManager, azure

      • url: (string)

        URL is the secrets store's endpoint point

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole is a flag indicates if local IAM role should be used for authentication, than all other credentials would be ignored

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/serverless-auto-protect get post

    get

    ServerlessAutoProtectSettings returns the serverless auto-protect settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    post

    SetServerlessAutoProtectSpec sets the serverless auto-protect specification settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/serverless-auto-protect

    ServerlessAutoProtectSettings returns the serverless auto-protect settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • consoleAddr: (string)

      ConsoleAddr represents the hostname of the console to connect to

    • credentialID: (string)

      CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      LastModified is the last modified time of the specification

    • name: (string)

      Name is the name of the spec

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

    • resource: (object)

      Resource is the runtime resources

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)
    • roleArn: (string)

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • runtimes: (string)

      Runtimes is the list of runtimes to which the spec applies

    • useAWSRole: (boolean)

      UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/serverless-auto-protect

    SetServerlessAutoProtectSpec sets the serverless auto-protect specification settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    • resource: (object)

      • functions: (string)

      • images: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • runtimes: (string)

      Runtimes is the list of runtimes to which the spec applies

    • useAWSRole: (boolean)

      UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/serverless-scan get post

    get

    ServerlessScanSettings returns the serverless scan settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    SetServerlessScanSettings sets the serverless settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/serverless-scan

    ServerlessScanSettings returns the serverless scan settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cap: (integer)

      Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

    • credential: (object)

      Credential is the service provider authentication data

      • _id: (string)

        ID is a unique name for the credential

      • accountGUID: (string)

        AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

      • accountID: (string)

        AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

      • apiToken: (object)

        APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • caCert: (string)

        CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

      • lastModified: (datetime)

        Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

      • owner: (string)

        Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

      • secret: (object)

        Secret is the credential secret data

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • type: (object)

        Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

    • pattern: (string)

      Pattern is a pattern used when filtering function names

    • provider: (object)

      Provider is the serverless provider. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

    • roleArn: (string)

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • useAWSRole: (boolean)

      UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/serverless-scan

    SetServerlessScanSettings sets the serverless settings. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties

      Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      Credential is the service provider authentication data

      • _id: (string)

        ID is a unique name for the credential

      • accountGUID: (string)

        AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

      • accountID: (string)

        AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

      • apiToken: (object)

        APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

        Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

        Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • type: (object)

        Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

    • pattern: (string)

      Pattern is a pattern used when filtering function names

    • provider: (object)

      Provider is the serverless provider. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

    • roleArn: (string)

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • useAWSRole: (boolean)

      UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)
