      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/system get

    get

    This endpoint will return all system settings in JSON format.

    The following example curl command does exactly that:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/system

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: user.

    get /settings/system

    This endpoint will return all system settings in JSON format.

    The following example curl command does exactly that:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/system

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: user.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • -: (string)

      JWTKey is the key used to sign JWT tokens

    • accessCaCert: (string)

      AccessCACert is a custom CA certificate

    • address: (string)

      Address is the intelligence service address

    • alerts: (object)

      Alert is the alert settings

      • aggregationPeriodMs: (integer)

        AggregationPeriodMs is the alert aggregation period in milliseconds

      • securityAdvisorWebhook: (string)

        SecurityAdvisorWebhook is a webhook for IBM security advisor alert wizard, used to authenticate the wizard with the console and to pull data

    • certSettings: (object)

      CertSettings are the certificates settings

      • caExpiration: (datetime)

        CAExpiration holds the expiration date of the CA cert

      • consoleSAN: (string)

        ConsoleSAN if specified, use this list as the SAN for the console server certificate. Used for websocket and API

    • certificatePeriodDays: (integer)

      CertificatePeriodDays is the certificates period in days

    • checkRevocation: (boolean)

      CheckRevocation indicates whether cert revocation status is required

    • communicationPort: (integer)

      MgmtPortHttp is the console http port

    • consoleCaCert: (string)

      ConsoleCACert is a custom CA certificate for the console

    • consoleCustomCert: (object)

      ConsoleCustomCert is the custom console cert bundle

      • encrypted: (string)
      • plain: (string)

        Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

    • consoleNames: (string)

      ConsoleNames is a list of names to use when generating the console SAN certificate

    • customLabels: (object)

      CustomLabels are the custom labels settings

      • labels: (string)

        Labels are the custom labels

    • defenderSettings: (object)

      DefenderSettings holds the defender proxy settings

      • admissionControlEnabled: (boolean)

        AdmissionControlEnabled specifies if the admission controller is enabled

      • admissionControlWebhookSuffix: (string)

        AdmissionControlWebhookSuffix is the relative path to the admission control webhook http endpoint

      • automaticUpgrade: (boolean)

        AutomaticUpgrade indicates defenders should be automatically upgraded to the latest version

      • disconnectPeriodDays: (integer)

        DisconnectPeriodDays is the amount of consecutive days a defender must stays disconnected for it to be considered decommissioned

      • listeningPort: (integer)

        ListeningPort is the defender listening port

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether intelligence service is enabled

    • forensic: (object)

      Forensic is the forensic setting

      • collectNetworkFirewall: (boolean)

        CollectNetworkFirewall indicates whether network firewall collection is enabled

      • collectNetworkSnapshot: (boolean)

        CollectNetworkSnapshot indicates whether network snapshot collection is enabled

      • containerDiskUsageMb: (integer)

        ContainerDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used tostore the container historical forensic events

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether host and container forensic data collection is enabled

      • hostDiskUsageMb: (integer)

        HostDiskUsageMb is the maximum amount of disk space used to storethe host historical forensic events

      • incidentSnapshotsCap: (integer)

        IncidentSnapshotCap is the maximum amount of incident snapshots we store

    • hasAdmin: (boolean)

      HasAdmin indicates whether the admin account is initialized

    • highAvailabilityEnabled: (boolean)

      Properties that are not stored in the DB

    • highAvailabilityHosts: (string)

      HighAvailabilityHosts is the list of hosts that participate in the high availability cluster

    • hpkp: (object)

      HPKP is the HTTP Public Key Pinning settings

      • certs: (string)

        Certs are the public certs used for fingerprinting

      • enabled: (boolean)
      • fingerprints: (string)

        SHA256 fingerprints of the certificates

    • kubernetesAudit: (object)

      KubernetesAuditSettings is the kubernetes audit settings

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the credential that is used to fetch k8s audit data from external resources (e.g., Stackdriver)

      • deploymentType: (object)

        DeploymentType indicates the type of the Kubernetes deployment audits source. Range of acceptable values: default, gke

      • stackdriverFilter: (string)

        StackdriverFilter is the advanced filter used for Stackdriver querying

      • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

        WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    • lastInitializedVersion: (string)

      LastInitializedVersion is the current version of the product

    • ldap: (object)

      LdapSettings are the ldap authentication settings

      • accountPassword: (object)

        AccountPassword is the UPN password used to connect to active directory server

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • accountUpn: (string)

        AccountUpn is the user principle name used to connect to the active directory server

      • caCert: (string)

        CaCert is cert in PEM format (optional, if not specified, skip_verify flag will be used)

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether LDAP is enabled

      • groupSearchBase: (string)

        GroupSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for groups

      • searchBase: (string)

        SearchBase is the LDAP search pattern

      • type: (string)

        Type specifies the LDAP server type (AD or OpenLDAP)

      • url: (string)

        Url is the ldap server url

      • userSearchBase: (string)

        UserSearchBase is the LDAP search pattern for users

      • userSearchIdentifier: (string)

        UserSearchIdentifier is the user identifier to use for querying open ldap (e.g., cn -> cn=user)

    • ldapEnabled: (boolean)

      LdapEnabled indicates whether ldap is enabled

    • licenseKey: (string)

      LicenseKey is the license key

    • logging: (object)

      Logging is the logging setting

      • consoleAddress: (string)

        ConsoleAddress is the console address used by the admin to access the console, used for creating links for runtime events

      • enableMetricsCollection: (boolean)

        EnableMetricsCollection indicates whether metric collections feature is enabled

      • includeRuntimeLink: (boolean)

        IncludeRuntimeLink indicates whether link to forensic event should be included in the output

      • stdout: (object)

        Stdout holds the stdout logging settings

        • allProcEvents: (boolean)

          AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

        • verboseScan: (boolean)

          VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

      • syslog: (object)

        Syslog holds the syslog logging settings

        • addr: (string)

          Addr is the remote address for sending events

        • allProcEvents: (boolean)

          AllProcEvents indicates whether any new spawned container process should generate an event source entry

        • enabled: (boolean)

          Enabled indicates whether log feature is enabled

        • id: (string)

          ID represents the user's custom identifier string

        • verboseScan: (boolean)

          VerboseScan indicates whether detailed scan (Compliance/Vulnerability) result should be written to event logger

    • logon: (object)

      Logon settings holds all logon settings

      • basicAuthDisabled: (boolean)

        Indicates whether the user can use basic auth

      • includeTLS: (boolean)

        IncludeTLS indicates that TLS checks should be included in copy links

      • sessionTimeoutSec: (integer)

        SessionTimeoutSec defines the session timeout in seconds

      • strongPassword: (boolean)

        StrongPassword indicates whether strong password enforcment is applied

      • useSupportCredentials: (boolean)

        UseSupportCredentials indicates whether to include credentials in the URL

    • pcfDroplets: (object)

      PCFDropletsSpecification is the pcf droplets scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • cloudControllerAddress: (string)

        CloudControllerAddress is the address of the cloud controller that provides the droplets

      • pattern: (string)

        Name is the droplet name

    • projects: (object)

      ProjectSettings are the project settings

      • master: (boolean)

        Master indicates that project feature is enabled and that this console is the master console and that

      • redirectURL: (string)

        RedirectURL is the redirectURL for the given project

    • proxy: (object)

      ProxySettings are the proxy settings

      • ca: (string)

        CA is the user proxy's CA

      • httpProxy: (string)

        HttpProxy is the http proxy to use

      • noProxy: (string)

        NoProxy is a list of addresses for which the proxy should not be used

      • password: (object)

        Password is the password to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • user: (string)

        User is the username to be used in authentication in front of the user's proxy

    • registry: (object)

      RegistrySettings holds credentials and configuration per registry

      • specifications: (object)

        Registries is the information for connecting to local/remote registries

        • cap: (integer)

          Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

        • credential: (object)

          Credential is the service provider authentication data

          • _id: (string)

            ID is a unique name for the credential

          • accountGUID: (string)

            AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

          • accountID: (string)

            AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

          • apiToken: (object)

            APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

            • encrypted: (string)
            • plain: (string)

              Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

          • caCert: (string)

            CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

          • lastModified: (datetime)

            Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

          • owner: (string)

            Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

          • secret: (object)

            Secret is the credential secret data

            • encrypted: (string)
            • plain: (string)

              Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

          • type: (object)

            Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

        • excludedRepositories: (string)

          ExcludedRepositories indicates which repositories are excluded in the registry scanning

        • excludedTags: (string)

          ExcludedTags indicates which tags are excluded in the registry scanning

        • hostname: (string)

          Hostname is the hostname of the defender that is used as registry scanner

        • jfrogRepoTypes: (object)

          JFrogRepoTypes indicates which JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan. Range of acceptable values: local, remote, virtual

        • namespace: (string)

          Namespace is the IBM Bluemix Namespace https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/Registry/registry_overview.html#registry_planning

        • os: (object)

          OS indicates the registry images base OS. Range of acceptable values: linux, windows

        • registry: (string)

          Registry contains either the registry name (e.g., gcr.io) or url (e.g., https://gcr.io)

        • repository: (string)
        • roleArn: (string)

          RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

        • scanners: (integer)

          Scanners indicates the amount of defenders assigned to scan this registry, this applies only for registries with auto-selected defenders

        • tag: (string)
        • useAWSRole: (boolean)

          UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

        • version: (string)
        • versionPattern: (string)

          VersionPattern indicates the version naming pattern heuristic for quickly filtering registry tags without querying all images for modification dates

      • webhookUrlSuffix: (string)

        WebhookSuffix is the relative path to the webhook http endpoint

    • saml: (object)

      SamlSettings are the saml authentication settings

      • appId: (string)

        AppID is the Azure application ID

      • appSecret: (object)

        AppSecret is an Azure secret used in the identification process

        • encrypted: (string)
        • plain: (string)

          Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

      • audience: (string)

        Audience specifies the SAML audience used in the verification of the SAML response

      • cert: (string)

        Cert is idp certificate in PEM format

      • consoleURL: (string)

        ConsoleURL is the external Console URL that is used by the IDP for routing the browser after login

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled indicates whether saml settings are enabled

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is idp issuer id

      • tenantId: (string)

        TenantID is the Azure Tenant ID

      • type: (object)

        Type specifies the SAML provider type. Range of acceptable values: okta, gsuite, ping, shibboleth, azure, adfs

      • url: (string)

        Url is idp sso url

    • samlEnabled: (boolean)

      SamlEnabled indicates whether saml is enabled

    • scan: (object)

      ScanSettings are the global settings for scanning

      • cloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        CloudPlatformsScanPeriodMs is the cloud platforms scan period in ms

      • containersScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ContainersScanPeriodMs is the container scan period in ms

      • disableCLIScanResults: (boolean)

        DisableCLIScanResults indicates that cli scan results should not be stored in the database

      • extractArchive: (boolean)

        ExtractArchive indicates whether to search within archive during scan is enabled

      • imagesScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ImageScanPeriodMs is the image scan period in ms

      • includeJsDependencies: (boolean)

        IncludeJsDependencies indicates whether to include packages from the "dependencies"

      • pcfDropletsScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        PCFDropletsScanPeriodMs is the pcf scan period in ms

      • registryScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        RegistryScanPeriodMs is the registry scan period in ms

      • scanRunningImages: (boolean)

        ScanRunningImages indicates only images that are used by containers should be used

      • serverlessScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        ServerlessScanPeriodMs is the serverless vulnerability scan period in ms

      • showInfraContainers: (boolean)

        ShowInfraContainers indicates infra containers should be shown

      • showNegligibleVulnerabilities: (boolean)

        ShowNegligibleVulnerabilities indicates whether to display negligible vulnerabilities (low severity)

      • systemScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        SystemScanPeriodMs is the host scan period in ms

      • vmScanPeriodMs: (integer)

        VMScanPeriodMs is the VM image scan period in ms

    • scapEnabled: (boolean)

      ScapEnabled indicates whether scap scanning is enabled

    • secretsStores: (object)

      SecretsStores is the secrets store settings

      • refreshPeriodHours: (integer)

        RefreshPeriodHours is the secret stores refresh time in hours

      • secretsStores: (object)

        Stores is the list of stores to fetch secrets from

        • appID: (string)

          AppID is the twistlock application id, as set in Cyberark store

        • caCert: (object)

          CaCert is a CA cert in PEM format, used to authenticate the store

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • clientCert: (object)

          ClientCert is the client cert bundle (key and cert)

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • credentialId: (string)

          CredentialID is the authentication credential id

        • name: (string)

          Name is the name of the secret store defined by the user

        • region: (string)

          Region is the secrets store's region

        • roleArn: (string)

          RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

        • type: (object)

          Type is the type of the secret store. Range of acceptable values: hashicorp, hashicorp010, cyberark, awsParameterStore, awsSecretsManager, azure

        • url: (string)

          URL is the secrets store's endpoint point

        • useAWSRole: (boolean)

          UseAWSRole is a flag indicates if local IAM role should be used for authentication, than all other credentials would be ignored

    • securedConsolePort: (integer)

      MgmtPortHttps is the console https port

    • serverlessAutoProtect: (object)

      ServerlessAutoProtectSpecs is the serverless auto-protection settings

      • consoleAddr: (string)

        ConsoleAddr represents the hostname of the console to connect to

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

      • lastModified: (datetime)

        LastModified is the last modified time of the specification

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the spec

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the runtime resources

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • runtimes: (string)

        Runtimes is the list of runtimes to which the spec applies

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • serverlessScan: (object)

      ServerlessScan is the serverless scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • credential: (object)

        Credential is the service provider authentication data

        • _id: (string)

          ID is a unique name for the credential

        • accountGUID: (string)

          AccountGUID is the unique ID for an IBM Cloud account

        • accountID: (string)

          AccountID is the account identifier, e.g., username, access key, account GUID, etc

        • apiToken: (object)

          APIToken is token used to authenticate to GCP

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • caCert: (string)

          CACert is the CA certificate used for cert-based auth

        • lastModified: (datetime)

          Modified represents the last time the credentials data changed

        • owner: (string)

          Owner represents the user who added/modified the credentials

        • secret: (object)

          Secret is the credential secret data

          • encrypted: (string)
          • plain: (string)

            Plain is the plain text value (remark: marshalling to JSON will be converted to encrypted value)

        • type: (object)

          Type is the cloud provider/external service the credentials are associated with. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp, ibmCloud, apiToken, basic, dtr, kubeconfig, certificate

      • pattern: (string)

        Pattern is a pattern used when filtering function names

      • provider: (object)

        Provider is the serverless provider. Range of acceptable values: aws, azure, gcp

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the serverless function is deployed

      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • useAWSRole: (boolean)

        UseAWSRole indicates that for AWS ECR, credentials should be retrieved by role (instead of static username/password)

    • telemetry: (object)

      TelemtrySettings determines whether to send telemetry data

      • enabled: (boolean)

        Enabled determines whether the telemetry settings are enabled

    • token: (string)

      Token is the token used to access intelligence service

    • trustedCerts: (object)

      TrustedCerts is the list of trusted cert to allow in docker access scenarios

      • cn: (string)

        CN is the certificate common name

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is the certificate issuer

      • notAfter1: (datetime)

        NotAfter is the certificate expiration timeRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • notBefore1: (datetime)

        NotBefore is the minimum time for which the cert is validRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • raw: (string)

        Raw is the raw certificate (in PEM format)

    • trustedCertsEnabled: (boolean)

      TrustedCertsEnabled indicates whether to enable the trusted certificate feature

    • uploadDisabled: (boolean)

      UploadDisabled indicates whether logs uploading is disabled

    • version: (string)

      Version is the current console version

    • vms: (object)

      VMSettings is the VM scanning settings

      • cap: (integer)

        Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

      • consoleAddr: (string)

        ConsoleAddr is the address the scanner agent uses to publish the results

      • credentialID: (string)

        CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

      • excludedImages: (string)

        ExcludedImages indicates which images are excluded in the VM scanning

      • region: (string)

        Region is the region where the image resides

      • resource: (object)

        Resource is the runtime resource associated with the data

        • accountIDs: (string)

          AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

        • appIDs: (string)

          AppIDs is a list of application IDs

        • containers: (string)
        • functions: (string)
        • hosts: (string)
        • images: (string)
        • labels: (string)
        • namespaces: (string)

          Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

        • services: (string)
      • roleArn: (string)

        RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

      • scanners: (integer)

        Scanners indicates the amount of VMs that will be scanned concurrently

      • version: (string)

        Version indicates the type of the VM

    • windowsFeedEnabled: (boolean)

      WindowsFeedEnabled indicates whether windows feed is enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/telemetry get post

    get

    This endpoint will report if "Anonymously report threats and vulnerabilities to Twistlock" is enabled in the console or not. You can find more about this in our telemetry article.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve whether or not telemetry is enabled or not:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/telemetry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    This endpoint will allow you to enable or disable telemetry. You can find more about this in our telemetry article.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to turn off telemetry:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"enabled":false}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/telemetry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /settings/telemetry

    This endpoint will report if "Anonymously report threats and vulnerabilities to Twistlock" is enabled in the console or not. You can find more about this in our telemetry article.

    The following curl command uses basic auth to retrieve whether or not telemetry is enabled or not:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/telemetry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled determines whether the telemetry settings are enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /settings/telemetry

    This endpoint will allow you to enable or disable telemetry. You can find more about this in our telemetry article.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to turn off telemetry:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"enabled":false}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/telemetry

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled determines whether the telemetry settings are enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/trusted-certificate post

    post

    Adds a certificate to the list of explicitly trusted certificates.

    Use this endpoint to control how users authenticate to Twistlock. Users employ client certificates to authenticate commands sent from a Docker client through Twistlock.

    NOTE: You can only add a custom certificate if the trusted certificates mode is enabled. For more information, see the /settings/trusted-certificates endpoint.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to add a ceritificate to the list:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"certificate": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIDUTCCAjmgAwIBAgI......XMKXJA==\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----" }'
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/trusted-certificate

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post /settings/trusted-certificate

    Adds a certificate to the list of explicitly trusted certificates.

    Use this endpoint to control how users authenticate to Twistlock. Users employ client certificates to authenticate commands sent from a Docker client through Twistlock.

    NOTE: You can only add a custom certificate if the trusted certificates mode is enabled. For more information, see the /settings/trusted-certificates endpoint.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to add a ceritificate to the list:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"certificate": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIDUTCCAjmgAwIBAgI......XMKXJA==\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----" }'
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/trusted-certificate

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • certificate: (string)

      Data is the certificate pem data

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cn: (string)

      CN is the certificate common name

    • issuer: (string)

      Issuer is the certificate issuer

    • notAfter1: (datetime)

      NotAfter is the certificate expiration timeRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

    • notBefore1: (datetime)

      NotBefore is the minimum time for which the cert is validRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

    • raw: (string)

      Raw is the raw certificate (in PEM format)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/trusted-certificates post

    post

    Enables authentication for just an explicit list of trusted certificates.

    Use this endpoint to control how users authenticate to Twistlock. Users employ client certificates to authenticate commands sent from a Docker client through Twistlock.

    NOTE: This feature can only be enabled if a custom certificate authority has been configured. For more information, see the /settings/certificates endpoint.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to enable this feature:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"enabled" : true }'
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/trusted-certificates

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    post /settings/trusted-certificates

    Enables authentication for just an explicit list of trusted certificates.

    Use this endpoint to control how users authenticate to Twistlock. Users employ client certificates to authenticate commands sent from a Docker client through Twistlock.

    NOTE: This feature can only be enabled if a custom certificate authority has been configured. For more information, see the /settings/certificates endpoint.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to enable this feature:

    curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-w "\nResponse code: %{http_code}\n" \
-X POST \
-d '{"enabled" : true }'
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/trusted-certificates

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • certs: (object)

      Certs are the list of trusted certificates to use in access scenarios

      • cn: (string)

        CN is the certificate common name

      • issuer: (string)

        Issuer is the certificate issuer

      • notAfter1: (datetime)

        NotAfter is the certificate expiration timeRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • notBefore1: (datetime)

        NotBefore is the minimum time for which the cert is validRemark: the 1 suffix required for backward compatibility (previous values were strings and cannot be serialized)

      • raw: (string)

        Raw is the raw certificate (in PEM format)

    • checkRevocation: (boolean)

      CheckRevocation indicates whether to check the certificate revocation

    • enabled: (boolean)

      Enabled indicates whether the trusted certificate feature is enabled

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /settings/vm get put

    get

    Retrieves a list of VM image scopes Prisma Cloud has been configured to scan.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/vm

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    put

    Specifies the VM images to scan. The list of VM images settings is set in a single shot. Any previous settings are completely overwritten. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /settings/vm

    Retrieves a list of VM image scopes Prisma Cloud has been configured to scan.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/settings/vm

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • cap: (integer)

      Cap indicates only the last k images should be fetched

    • consoleAddr: (string)

      ConsoleAddr is the address the scanner agent uses to publish the results

    • credentialID: (string)

      CredentialID is the service provider authentication data

    • excludedImages: (string)

      ExcludedImages indicates which images are excluded in the VM scanning

    • region: (string)

      Region is the region where the image resides

    • resource: (object)

      Resource is the runtime resource associated with the data

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)
    • roleArn: (string)

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • scanners: (integer)

      Scanners indicates the amount of VMs that will be scanned concurrently

    • version: (string)

      Version indicates the type of the VM

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

      Region is the region where the image resides

    • resource: (object)

      Resource is the runtime resource associated with the data

      • accountIDs: (string)

        AccountIDs is a list of the cloud account IDs

      • appIDs: (string)

        AppIDs is a list of application IDs

      • containers: (string)
      • functions: (string)
      • hosts: (string)
      • images: (string)
      • labels: (string)
      • namespaces: (string)

        Namespaces are the k8s namespaces

      • services: (string)

      RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume

    • scanners: (integer)

      Scanners indicates the amount of VMs that will be scanned concurrently

    • version: (string)

      Version indicates the type of the VM

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Signup

    Automate Console set up by creating an initial user after Twistlock is first installed.

    /signup post

    post

    Create the initial admin user after Console is first installed. Use this endpoint, among others, to automate the installation and set up of Twistlock.

    Related: See POST /api/v1/settings/license to automate the submission of your license key.

    The following example curl command creates the initial admin user.

    $ curl -k \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"username": "butterbean", "password": "<PASSWORD>"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/signup

    The sign up process can only be executed once, whether from the Console UI or the API. Calling this endpoint after the initial sign up has been completed results in a 400 error response. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: none.

    post /signup

    Create the initial admin user after Console is first installed. Use this endpoint, among others, to automate the installation and set up of Twistlock.

    Related: See POST /api/v1/settings/license to automate the submission of your license key.

    The following example curl command creates the initial admin user.

    $ curl -k \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"username": "butterbean", "password": "<PASSWORD>"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/signup

    The sign up process can only be executed once, whether from the Console UI or the API. Calling this endpoint after the initial sign up has been completed results in a 400 error response. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: none.

    • Request

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • password: (string)

      Password is the password used for authentication

    • token: (string)

      Token is the Prisma JWT token used for authentication

    • username: (string)

      Username is the username used for authentication

    Static

    Return lists of constants used throughout the product.

    /static/capabilities get

    get

    Returns a list of capabilities used in host models.

     $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/static/capabilities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /static/capabilities

    Returns a list of capabilities used in host models.

     $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/static/capabilities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • description: (string)

      Description is the capability description

    • preventDisabled: (boolean)

      PreventDisabled indicates prevent is not supported for this capability

    • type: (object)

      CapabilityType is the capability type. Range of acceptable values: SYSTEM_LOGS, DOCKER, DOCKER_SOCKET, USERS_ADMIN, INSTALLER, KUBERNETES, OPENSHIFT, SSH, SHELL, NET, HOSTS_CONFIG, SERVICE_OPERATOR, GCLOUD, PRIVILEGED_PROCESSES, SECRETS_MANAGER

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /static/serverless-runtimes get

    get

    AvailableServerlessRuntimes returns the available serverless runtimes for auto protect. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    get /static/serverless-runtimes

    AvailableServerlessRuntimes returns the available serverless runtimes for auto protect. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /static/vulnerabilities get

    get

    Returns a list of static compliance and vulnerability data. This data can be used in building out reports with the API. This data can be correlated with the endpoint /images specifically complianceVulnerabilities and cveVulnerabilities within, to more thoroughly generate the reports.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/static/vulnerabilities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /static/vulnerabilities

    Returns a list of static compliance and vulnerability data. This data can be used in building out reports with the API. This data can be correlated with the endpoint /images specifically complianceVulnerabilities and cveVulnerabilities within, to more thoroughly generate the reports.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/static/vulnerabilities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • complianceVulnerabilities: (object)

      Compliance is the list of all available compliance issues

      • -: (string)

        LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

      • applicableRules: (string)

        ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

      • binaryPkgs: (string)

        BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

      • block: (boolean)

        Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

      • cause: (string)

        Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

      • custom: (boolean)

        Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

      • cve: (string)

        CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

      • cvss: (number)

        Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

      • description: (string)

        Description is the vulnerabilities description.

      • discovered: (datetime)

        Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

      • exploit: (object)

        Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

      • fixLink: (string)

        FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

      • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

      • id: (integer)

        Unique id to identify the violation

      • layerTime: (integer)

        LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

      • link: (string)

        Link is the vendor link to the CVE

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

      • packageVersion: (string)

        PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

      • published: (integer)

        Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

      • riskFactors: (object)

        RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

      • severity: (string)

        Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

      • status: (string)

        Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

      • templates: (object)

        Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

      • text: (string)

        Text that explains the violation

      • title: (string)

        Title is the compliance title

      • twistlock: (boolean)

        Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

      • type: (object)

        Type is the vulnerability's type.

      • vecStr: (string)

        VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

      • vulnTagInfos: (object)

        VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

        • comment: (string)

          Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag name

    • cveVulnerabilities: (object)

      CVE is all available cve vulnerabilities

      • -: (string)

        LinkId is the id required to construct the vendor link to the CVE

      • applicableRules: (string)

        ApplicableRules are the applied rules on the package

      • binaryPkgs: (string)

        BinaryPkgs are the names of distro binary packages names (packages that are built from the source of the package)

      • block: (boolean)

        Block indicates if the vulnerability has block effect

      • cause: (string)

        Cause provides additional information regarding the root cause for the vulnerability

      • custom: (boolean)

        Custom indicates whether vulnerability is a custom vulnerability, for example: openscap, sandbox

      • cve: (string)

        CVE is the cve id of the vulnerability (if applied)

      • cvss: (number)

        Cvss is the cvss score of the vulnerability.

      • description: (string)

        Description is the vulnerabilities description.

      • discovered: (datetime)

        Discovered indicates when the vulnerability was discovered

      • exploit: (object)

        Exploit indicates if an exploit exists and its type. Range of acceptable values: exploit-db, exploit-windows

      • fixLink: (string)

        FixLink is a link to the vendor fixed version info

      • gracePeriodDays: (integer)

        GraceDays is the amount of grace days left for a vulnerability based on the configured grace period

      • id: (integer)

        Unique id to identify the violation

      • layerTime: (integer)

        LayerTime is the layer to which the CVE belongs - layer creation time

      • link: (string)

        Link is the vendor link to the CVE

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the name of the package that caused the vulnerability

      • packageVersion: (string)

        PackageVersion is the version of the package that caused the vulnerability (or null)

      • published: (integer)

        Published is the vulnerability publish date (unix time)

      • riskFactors: (object)

        RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

      • severity: (string)

        Severity is a textual representation of the vulnerability's severity.

      • status: (string)

        Status is the vendor status for the vulnerability

      • templates: (object)

        Templates is a list of templates that the vulnerability is associated with. Range of acceptable values: PCI, HIPAA, NIST SP 800-190, GDPR

      • text: (string)

        Text that explains the violation

      • title: (string)

        Title is the compliance title

      • twistlock: (boolean)

        Twistlock indicates that this is a Twistlock specific vulnerability

      • type: (object)

        Type is the vulnerability's type.

      • vecStr: (string)

        VectorString is a textual representation of the metric values used to score the vulnerability

      • vulnTagInfos: (object)

        VulnTagInfos are the tags info the vulnerability has

        • comment: (string)

          Comment is the tag comment in a specific vulnerability context

        • name: (string)

          Name is the tag name

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Statistics

    Return vulnerability and compliance stats for your environment.

    /stats/compliance get

    get

    Returns a summary count of compliance issues for the images, containers, hosts, and serverless functions in your environment, organized by day (_id).

    The response also includes a detailed list of compliance issues for each running container and host at the time of the last scan.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve compliance statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/compliance

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /stats/compliance

    Returns a summary count of compliance issues for the images, containers, hosts, and serverless functions in your environment, organized by day (_id).

    The response also includes a detailed list of compliance issues for each running container and host at the time of the last scan.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve compliance statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/compliance

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • fields: (string)

      Select is a list of fields to select from the query (others will be empty)

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit limits the number of documents

    • offset: (integer)

      Offset from query start

    • reverse: (boolean)

      Reverse is the sorting order

    • search: (string)

      Search is the search term

    • sort: (string)

      Sort is the sort key

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Date hold the date for which the stats were collected

    • containerCnt: (integer)

      ContainerCnt represents the number of containers

    • containerComplianceCnt: (integer)

      ContainerComplianceCnt are the number of containers with compliance issues

    • hostCnt: (integer)

      HostCnt represents the number of hosts

    • hostComplianceCnt: (integer)

      HostComplianceCnt are the number of hosts with compliance issues

    • imageCnt: (integer)

      ImageCnt is the number of impacted images

    • imageComplianceCnt: (integer)

      ImageComplianceCnt are the number of images with compliance issues

    • impacted: (object)

      Impacted are the impacted entities by the compliance

      • collections: (string)

        Collections are collections to which this entity applies

      • id: (string)

        ID is the ID of the impacted entity

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the impacted entity

      • vulnerabilities: (integer)

        Vulnerabilities is the list of compliance vulnerability IDs

    • impactedContainers: (object)

      ImpactedContainers is the number of impacted containers distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • impactedHosts: (object)

      ImpactedHosts is the number of impacted hosts distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • impactedImages: (object)

      ImpactedImages is the number of impacted images distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • impactedServerless: (object)

      ImpactedServerless is the number of impacted serverless functions distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • istioServiceCnt: (integer)

      IstioServiceCnt is the number of Istio services found according to Istio destination rules

    • modified: (datetime)

      Modified is the modification time of the compliance stats

    • serverlessCnt: (integer)

      ServerlessCnt represents the number of serverless functions

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/compliance/refresh post

    post

    Refreshes the current day's list and counts of compliance issues, as well as the list of affected running resources.

    This endpoint returns the same response as /api/v1/stats/compliance, but with updated data for the current day.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to refresh compliance statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/compliance

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    post /stats/compliance/refresh

    Refreshes the current day's list and counts of compliance issues, as well as the list of affected running resources.

    This endpoint returns the same response as /api/v1/stats/compliance, but with updated data for the current day.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to refresh compliance statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/compliance

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

      Limit limits the number of documents

    • offset: (integer)

      Offset from query start

    • reverse: (boolean)

      Reverse is the sorting order

    • search: (string)

      Search is the search term

    • sort: (string)

      Sort is the sort key

      HostComplianceCnt are the number of hosts with compliance issues

      ImageCnt is the number of impacted images

    • imageComplianceCnt: (integer)

      ImageComplianceCnt are the number of images with compliance issues

    • impacted: (object)

      Impacted are the impacted entities by the compliance

      • collections: (string)

        Collections are collections to which this entity applies

      • id: (string)

        ID is the ID of the impacted entity

      • name: (string)

        Name is the name of the impacted entity

      • vulnerabilities: (integer)

        Vulnerabilities is the list of compliance vulnerability IDs

      ImpactedContainers is the number of impacted containers distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)
    • impactedHosts: (object)

      ImpactedHosts is the number of impacted hosts distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)

      ImpactedImages is the number of impacted images distributed by severity

      • critical: (integer)
      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)

      ImpactedServerless is the number of impacted serverless functions distributed by severity

      • high: (integer)
      • low: (integer)
      • medium: (integer)
      • total: (integer)

      IstioServiceCnt is the number of Istio services found according to Istio destination rules

    • modified: (datetime)

      Modified is the modification time of the compliance stats

    • serverlessCnt: (integer)

      ServerlessCnt represents the number of serverless functions

      Example:

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/daily get

    get

    Returns a historical list of per-day statistics for the resources protected by Twistlock, including the total number of runtime audits, image vulnerabilities, and compliance violations.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to retrieve the daily stats:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/daily

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /stats/daily

    Returns a historical list of per-day statistics for the resources protected by Twistlock, including the total number of runtime audits, image vulnerabilities, and compliance violations.

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to retrieve the daily stats:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/daily

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Id is the metric type

    • access: (object)

      Access are the access stats

      • docker: (object)

        Docker are docker access statistics

        • allowed: (integer)
        • denied: (integer)
      • sshd: (object)

        Docker are sshd access statistics

        • allowed: (integer)
        • denied: (integer)
      • sudo: (object)

        Sudo are sudo commands access statistics

        • allowed: (integer)
        • denied: (integer)
    • appEmbeddedAppFirewall: (object)

      AppEmbeddedAppFirewall is the e app firewall stats

    • container: (object)

      Container is the container stats

      • capabilities: (integer)
      • filesystem: (integer)
      • kubernetes: (integer)
      • network: (integer)
      • processes: (integer)
    • containerAppFirewall: (object)

      ContainerAppFirewall is the container app firewall stats

    • containerNetworkFirewall: (object)

      ContainerNetworkFirewall is the container network firewall stats

      • alerted: (integer)
      • blocked: (integer)
    • host: (object)

      Host is the host stats

      • capabilities: (integer)
      • filesystem: (integer)
      • kubernetes: (integer)
      • network: (integer)
      • processes: (integer)
    • hostAppFirewall: (object)

      HostAppFirewall is the host app firewall stats

    • hostComplianceCount: (integer)

      HostComplianceCount is the host compliance count

    • hostNetworkFirewall: (object)

      HostNetworkFirewall is the host network firewall stats

      • alerted: (integer)
      • blocked: (integer)
    • incidentsCount: (integer)

      IncidentsCount is the incidents count

    • serverless: (object)

      Serverless is the serverless stats

      • capabilities: (integer)
      • filesystem: (integer)
      • kubernetes: (integer)
      • network: (integer)
      • processes: (integer)
    • serverlessAppFirewall: (object)

      ServerlessAppFirewall is the serverless app firewall stats

    • time: (integer)

      UnixTimestamp is the unix timestamp

    • vulnerabilities: (object)

      Vulnerabilities are the vulnerabilities stats

      • containerCompliance: (integer)

        ContainerCompliance is the sum of all compliance issues for all running containers

      • imageCompliance: (integer)

        ImageCompliance is the sum of all compliance issues of all running images

      • imageCve: (integer)

        ImageCVE is the sum of cve vulnerabilities of all running images

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/dashboard get

    get

    Returns statistics about the resources protected by Twistlock, including the total number of runtime audits, image vulnerabilities, and compliance violations.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve dashboard stats:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/dashboard

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /stats/dashboard

    Returns statistics about the resources protected by Twistlock, including the total number of runtime audits, image vulnerabilities, and compliance violations.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve dashboard stats:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/dashboard

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • complianceSummary: (object)

      ComplianceSummary represents the compliance stats of impacted entities for the last 24 hours

      • containers: (object)

        Containers represents the number of impacted containers distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • functions: (object)

        Functions represents the number of impacted serverless functions distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • hosts: (object)

        Hosts represents the number of impacted hosts distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • images: (object)

        Images represents the number of impacted images distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
    • defendersActive: (integer)

      DefendersActive is the total number of active defenders

    • defendersTotal: (integer)

      DefendersTotal is the total number of defenders

    • vulnerabilitySummary: (object)

      VulnerabilitySummary represents the vulnerabilities stats of impacted entities for the last 24 hours

      • containers: (object)

        Containers represents the number of impacted containers distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • functions: (object)

        Functions represents the number of impacted serverless functions distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • hosts: (object)

        Hosts represents the number of impacted hosts distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • images: (object)

        Images represents the number of impacted images distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/events get

    get

    Returns events statistics for your environment.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve daily stats:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/events

    Here is an example of what would be returned:

    {
"containerAppFirewall": 0,
"hostAppFirewall": 0,
"containerRuntime": 0,
"containerNetworkFirewall": 0,
"hostRuntime": 0,
"hostNetworkFirewall": 0,
"hostActivities": 0,
"raspAppFirewall": 0,
"raspRuntime": 0,
"serverlessRuntime": 0,
"logInspection": 0,
"fileIntegrity": 0,
"dockerAccess": 0,
"kubernetesAudits": 0,
"trustAudits": 0
}

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /stats/events

    Returns events statistics for your environment.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve daily stats:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/events

    Here is an example of what would be returned:

    {
"containerAppFirewall": 0,
"hostAppFirewall": 0,
"containerRuntime": 0,
"containerNetworkFirewall": 0,
"hostRuntime": 0,
"hostNetworkFirewall": 0,
"hostActivities": 0,
"raspAppFirewall": 0,
"raspRuntime": 0,
"serverlessRuntime": 0,
"logInspection": 0,
"fileIntegrity": 0,
"dockerAccess": 0,
"kubernetesAudits": 0,
"trustAudits": 0
}

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Success

    Media type: application/json
