    • admissionAudits: (integer)
    • appEmbeddedAppFirewall: (integer)
    • appEmbeddedRuntime: (integer)
    • containerAppFirewall: (integer)
    • containerNetworkFirewall: (integer)
    • containerRuntime: (integer)
    • dockerAccess: (integer)
    • fileIntegrity: (integer)
    • hostActivities: (integer)
    • hostAppFirewall: (integer)
    • hostNetworkFirewall: (integer)
    • hostRuntime: (integer)
    • kubernetesAudits: (integer)
    • logInspection: (integer)
    • serverlessAppFirewall: (integer)
    • serverlessRuntime: (integer)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/vulnerabilities get

    get

    Returns a summary count of CVEs in the images, containers, hosts, and serverless functions your environment, organized by day (_id).

    The response also includes detailed descriptions for each CVE currently affecting the resources in your environment at the time of the last scan.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve vulnerability statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /stats/vulnerabilities

    Returns a summary count of CVEs in the images, containers, hosts, and serverless functions your environment, organized by day (_id).

    The response also includes detailed descriptions for each CVE currently affecting the resources in your environment at the time of the last scan.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to retrieve vulnerability statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • fields: (string)

      Select is a list of fields to select from the query (others will be empty)

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit limits the number of documents

    • offset: (integer)

      Offset from query start

    • reverse: (boolean)

      Reverse is the sorting order

    • search: (string)

      Search is the search term

    • sort: (string)

      Sort is the sort key

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Date hold the date for which the stats were collected

    • containers: (object)

      Containers holds containers vulnerability stats

      • cves: (object)

        CVEs is the number of resource CVEs distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • impacted: (object)

        Impacted is the number of impacted resource instances distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • vulnerabilities: (object)

        Vulnerabilities holds all resource vulnerabilities

        • cve: (string)
        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerability description

        • highestRiskFactors: (object)

          HighestRiskFactors refers to the most vulnerable running container, impacted by this vulnerability

          • internet: (boolean)

            Internet indicates whether a container has internet access

          • network: (boolean)

            Network indicates whether a container is listening to ports

          • noSecurityProfile: (boolean)

            NoSecurityProfile indicates whether a container has security profile issue

          • privilegedContainer: (boolean)

            PrivilegedContainer indicates whether a container runs using the --privileged flag

          • rootPrivilege: (boolean)

            RootPrivilege indicates whether a container runs as root

        • impactedPkgs: (string)
        • impactedResourcesCnt: (integer)

          ImpactedResourcesCnt is the number of impacted resources by this vulnerability

        • link: (string)
        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • riskScore: (number)
        • status: (string)
    • functions: (object)

      Functions holds functions vulnerability stats

      • cves: (object)

        CVEs is the number of resource CVEs distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • impacted: (object)

        Impacted is the number of impacted resource instances distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • vulnerabilities: (object)

        Vulnerabilities holds all resource vulnerabilities

        • cve: (string)
        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerability description

        • highestRiskFactors: (object)

          HighestRiskFactors refers to the most vulnerable running container, impacted by this vulnerability

          • internet: (boolean)

            Internet indicates whether a container has internet access

          • network: (boolean)

            Network indicates whether a container is listening to ports

          • noSecurityProfile: (boolean)

            NoSecurityProfile indicates whether a container has security profile issue

          • privilegedContainer: (boolean)

            PrivilegedContainer indicates whether a container runs using the --privileged flag

          • rootPrivilege: (boolean)

            RootPrivilege indicates whether a container runs as root

        • impactedPkgs: (string)
        • impactedResourcesCnt: (integer)

          ImpactedResourcesCnt is the number of impacted resources by this vulnerability

        • link: (string)
        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • riskScore: (number)
        • status: (string)
    • hosts: (object)

      Hosts holds hosts vulnerability stats

      • cves: (object)

        CVEs is the number of resource CVEs distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • impacted: (object)

        Impacted is the number of impacted resource instances distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • vulnerabilities: (object)

        Vulnerabilities holds all resource vulnerabilities

        • cve: (string)
        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerability description

        • highestRiskFactors: (object)

          HighestRiskFactors refers to the most vulnerable running container, impacted by this vulnerability

          • internet: (boolean)

            Internet indicates whether a container has internet access

          • network: (boolean)

            Network indicates whether a container is listening to ports

          • noSecurityProfile: (boolean)

            NoSecurityProfile indicates whether a container has security profile issue

          • privilegedContainer: (boolean)

            PrivilegedContainer indicates whether a container runs using the --privileged flag

          • rootPrivilege: (boolean)

            RootPrivilege indicates whether a container runs as root

        • impactedPkgs: (string)
        • impactedResourcesCnt: (integer)

          ImpactedResourcesCnt is the number of impacted resources by this vulnerability

        • link: (string)
        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • riskScore: (number)
        • status: (string)
    • images: (object)

      Images holds images vulnerability stats

      • cves: (object)

        CVEs is the number of resource CVEs distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • impacted: (object)

        Impacted is the number of impacted resource instances distributed by severity

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)
      • vulnerabilities: (object)

        Vulnerabilities holds all resource vulnerabilities

        • cve: (string)
        • description: (string)

          Description is the vulnerability description

        • highestRiskFactors: (object)

          HighestRiskFactors refers to the most vulnerable running container, impacted by this vulnerability

          • internet: (boolean)

            Internet indicates whether a container has internet access

          • network: (boolean)

            Network indicates whether a container is listening to ports

          • noSecurityProfile: (boolean)

            NoSecurityProfile indicates whether a container has security profile issue

          • privilegedContainer: (boolean)

            PrivilegedContainer indicates whether a container runs using the --privileged flag

          • rootPrivilege: (boolean)

            RootPrivilege indicates whether a container runs as root

        • impactedPkgs: (string)
        • impactedResourcesCnt: (integer)

          ImpactedResourcesCnt is the number of impacted resources by this vulnerability

        • link: (string)
        • riskFactors: (object)

          RiskFactors are the vulnerability's risk factors

        • riskScore: (number)
        • status: (string)
    • modified: (datetime)

      Modified is the entity modification time

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/vulnerabilities/impacted-resources get

    get

    Generates a risk tree, which is a map of your exposure to a specific vulnerability. This endpoint returns a list of all images and containers affected by a given CVE.

    The data in this endpoint is updated every time a scan runs. By default, Twistlock rescans your environment every 24 hours. Alternatively, you can manually update the stats by clicking the Refresh button in Vulnerability Explorer.

    The following example command retrieves a risk tree for CVE-2015-0313.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities/impacted-resources?cve=CVE-2015-0313

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /stats/vulnerabilities/impacted-resources

    Generates a risk tree, which is a map of your exposure to a specific vulnerability. This endpoint returns a list of all images and containers affected by a given CVE.

    The data in this endpoint is updated every time a scan runs. By default, Twistlock rescans your environment every 24 hours. Alternatively, you can manually update the stats by clicking the Refresh button in Vulnerability Explorer.

    The following example command retrieves a risk tree for CVE-2015-0313.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities/impacted-resources?cve=CVE-2015-0313

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • cve: (string)

      CVE is used to as a pivot for the impacted resource search

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Id is the CVE ID (index for the impacted resources)

    • hosts: (string)

      Hosts is the list of impacted hosts

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /stats/vulnerabilities/refresh post

    post

    Refreshes the current day's CVE counts and CVE list, as well as their descriptions.

    This endpoint returns the same response as /api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities, but with updated data for the current day.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to refresh the vulnerability statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities/refresh

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    post /stats/vulnerabilities/refresh

    Refreshes the current day's CVE counts and CVE list, as well as their descriptions.

    This endpoint returns the same response as /api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities, but with updated data for the current day.

    The following example command that uses curl and basic auth to refresh the vulnerability statistics:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/vulnerabilities/refresh

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • collections: (string)

      Collections are collections scoping the query

    • fields: (string)

      Select is a list of fields to select from the query (others will be empty)

    • limit: (integer)

      Limit limits the number of documents

    • offset: (integer)

      Offset from query start

    • reverse: (boolean)

      Reverse is the sorting order

    • search: (string)

      Search is the search term

    • sort: (string)

      Sort is the sort key

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Date hold the date for which the stats were collected

      Containers holds containers vulnerability stats

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)

        • critical: (integer)
        • high: (integer)
        • low: (integer)
        • medium: (integer)
        • total: (integer)

          Description is the vulnerability description

          HighestRiskFactors refers to the most vulnerable running container, impacted by this vulnerability

            Internet indicates whether a container has internet access

          • network: (boolean)

            NoSecurityProfile indicates whether a container has security profile issue

          • privilegedContainer: (boolean)

    /stats/workload get

    get

    Returns the workload statistics from Console.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/workload

    Here is an example of when would be returned:

    {
"Timestamp": "0001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
"HourSamples": 0,
"HourAvg": 0,
"DailySamples": null,
"exceeded": false,
"avg": 0,
"msg": ""
}

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    get /stats/workload

    Returns the workload statistics from Console.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/stats/workload

    Here is an example of when would be returned:

    {
"Timestamp": "0001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
"HourSamples": 0,
"HourAvg": 0,
"DailySamples": null,
"exceeded": false,
"avg": 0,
"msg": ""
}

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: defenderManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • avg: (number)

      Avg is the average number of workloads

    • containerDefenders: (integer)

      ContainerDefenders is the total number of container defenders

    • exceeded: (boolean)

      Exceeded indicates the number of workloads exceeded license

    • hostDefenders: (integer)

      HostDefenders is the total number of host defenders

    • msg: (string)

      Msg is the license exceeded error/warning message to show

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Status

    Return connection and scan statuses for the various Twistlock subsystems.

    /statuses/intelligence get

    get

    Returns the connection status for the Intelligence Stream, along with the time of the last update.

    The following is an example curl using basic auth to find the intelligence stream status:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/statuses/intelligence

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    get /statuses/intelligence

    Returns the connection status for the Intelligence Stream, along with the time of the last update.

    The following is an example curl using basic auth to find the intelligence stream status:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/statuses/intelligence

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devSecOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Id is the defender identifier if the status is per defender or the type for global statuses

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      Modified is the time the event was modified

    • type: (object)

      Type is the status type

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /statuses/registry get

    get

    Returns the status of the registry scans.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/statuses/registry

    Here is an example of what is returned:

    {
"scanTime": "2019-07-31T19:42:49.036311567Z",
"completed": true
}
```Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /statuses/registry

    Returns the status of the registry scans.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/statuses/registry

    Here is an example of what is returned:

    {
"scanTime": "2019-07-31T19:42:49.036311567Z",
"completed": true
}
```Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.
    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • completed: (boolean)

      Completed indicates whether scanning has successfully completed

    • errors: (string)

      Errors are the list of errors that happened during the last scan

    • hostname: (string)

      Hostname is the defender's hostname

    • scanTime: (datetime)

      Time is the scan time

    • scanning: (boolean)

      Scanning indicates whether scanning is running

    • selective: (boolean)

      Selective indicates whether the scan is for a specific resource

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /statuses/secrets get

    get

    Returns the connection status of any secret stores you have configured, as well as the last update to the secret store.

    The following is an example curl using basic auth to find the secret store status:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/statuses/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    get /statuses/secrets

    Returns the connection status of any secret stores you have configured, as well as the last update to the secret store.

    The following is an example curl using basic auth to find the secret store status:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/statuses/secrets

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (string)

      Id is the defender identifier if the status is per defender or the type for global statuses

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      Modified is the time the event was modified

    • type: (object)

      Type is the status type

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Tags

    Tags are predefined labels that help you manage your vulnerabilities via the Console UI and Twistlock API.

    /tags get post

    get

    Retrieves the list of tags.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devOps.

    post

    Creates a new tag. Any field left unspecified is assigned the value of "" (i.e. an emtpy string).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"name": "my tag",
"color": "#ff0000",
"description": "A test collection"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /tags

    Retrieves the list of tags.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devOps.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • color: (string)

      Color is the color code for the tag

    • description: (string)

      Description is the tag description

    • name: (string)

      Name is the tag name

    • vulns: (object)

      Vulns are the tagged vulnerabilities

      • comment: (string)

        Comment is the tag comment

      • id: (string)

        ID is the vulnerability ID

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the package name

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /tags

    Creates a new tag. Any field left unspecified is assigned the value of "" (i.e. an emtpy string).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"name": "my tag",
"color": "#ff0000",
"description": "A test collection"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • color: (string)

      Color is the color code for the tag

    • description: (string)

      Description is the tag description

    • name: (string)

      Name is the tag name

    • vulns: (object)

      Vulns are the tagged vulnerabilities

      • comment: (string)

        Comment is the tag comment

      • id: (string)

        ID is the vulnerability ID

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the package name

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /tags/{id} delete put

    delete

    Deletes a tag from the system.

    The following example curl command deletes a tag named my tag. Because spaces are considered unsafe characters in a URL, they must be encoded with the value %20.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X DELETE \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/my%20tag"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    put

    Updates the parameters that define a given tag.

    The following example curl command updates the parameters that define the tag named my_tag. In general, all parameters in your PUT request should be defined or redefined. Any field left unspecified is assigned the value of "" (i.e. an emtpy string).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d \
'{
"name": "my_tag2",
"color": "#ff0000",
"description": "A super cool tag"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/my_tag

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    delete /tags/{id}

    Deletes a tag from the system.

    The following example curl command deletes a tag named my tag. Because spaces are considered unsafe characters in a URL, they must be encoded with the value %20.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-X DELETE \
"https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/my%20tag"

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /tags/{id}

    Updates the parameters that define a given tag.

    The following example curl command updates the parameters that define the tag named my_tag. In general, all parameters in your PUT request should be defined or redefined. Any field left unspecified is assigned the value of "" (i.e. an emtpy string).

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d \
'{
"name": "my_tag2",
"color": "#ff0000",
"description": "A super cool tag"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/my_tag

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • color: (string)

      Color is the color code for the tag

    • description: (string)

      Description is the tag description

    • name: (string)

      Name is the tag name

    • vulns: (object)

      Vulns are the tagged vulnerabilities

      • comment: (string)

        Comment is the tag comment

      • id: (string)

        ID is the vulnerability ID

      • packageName: (string)

        PackageName is the package name

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /tags/{id}/vuln delete post

    delete

    Remove a tag from a CVE.

    The following example curl command removes the tag named ignored from the CVE CVE-2017-15088.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
-d \
'{
"id": "CVE-2017-15088",
"packageName": "krb5"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/ignored/vuln

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devOps.

    post

    Set a tag to a CVE.

    The following example curl command adds the tag named ignored to the CVE CVE-2017-15088.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d \
'{
"id": "CVE-2017-15088",
"packageName": "krb5",
"comment": "my super cool comment"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/ignored/vuln

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: devOps.

    delete /tags/{id}/vuln

    Remove a tag from a CVE.

    The following example curl command removes the tag named ignored from the CVE CVE-2017-15088.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
-d \
'{
"id": "CVE-2017-15088",
"packageName": "krb5"
}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/tags/ignored/vuln

    Trusted images

    Manage the list of registries, repositories, and images that are considered trusted. You can create a compliance policy that permits just the images in this list to execute in your environment.

    /trust/data get put

    get

    TrustData returns the trust data. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    put

    SetTrustData replaces the trust policy and groups with the given trust data. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    get /trust/data

    TrustData returns the trust data. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • groups: (object)

      Groups are the trust groups

      • _id: (string)

        ID is the name of the group

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • images: (string)

        Images are the image names or IDs (e.g., docker.io/library/ubuntu:16.04 / SHA264@...)

      • layers: (string)

        Layers are filesystem layers, the image is trusted if it's layers have a prefix of the trusted groups layerin the same order

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /trust/data

    SetTrustData replaces the trust policy and groups with the given trust data. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: operator.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • groups: (object)

      Groups are the trust groups

      • _id: (string)

        ID is the name of the group

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • images: (string)

        Images are the image names or IDs (e.g., docker.io/library/ubuntu:16.04 / SHA264@...)

      • layers: (string)

        Layers are filesystem layers, the image is trusted if it's layers have a prefix of the trusted groups layerin the same order

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /trust/result get

    get

    TrustResult returns the trust status for a given image. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    get /trust/result

    TrustResult returns the trust status for a given image. Minimum role required to access this endpoint: vulnerabilityManager.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Response
    • Security

    Query Parameters

    • imageID: (string)

      ImageID is the image ID that should be evaluated

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • -: (object)

      Status is the image general trust status. Range of acceptable values: trusted, untrusted

    • groups: (object)

      Groups are the trust groups that apply to the image

      • _id: (string)

        ID is the name of the group

      • disabled: (boolean)

        Disabled states if the rule is currently disabled

      • images: (string)

        Images are the image names or IDs (e.g., docker.io/library/ubuntu:16.04 / SHA264@...)

      • layers: (string)

        Layers are filesystem layers, the image is trusted if it's layers have a prefix of the trusted groups layerin the same order

      • modified: (datetime)
      • name: (string)
      • notes: (string)

        Notes are the rule's user notes

      • owner: (string)
      • previousName: (string)

        PreviousName is the rule previous name, required for rule renaming

    • hostsStatuses: (object)

      HostsStatuses represents the image trust status on each host

      • host: (string)

        Host is the host name

      • status: (object)

        Status is the trust status. Range of acceptable values: trusted, untrusted

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Users

    Create and manage local users. If you integrated Twistlock with Active Directory, OpenLDAP, or SAML, use these endpoints to assign roles to individual users. (Note that groups are a better way to assign roles when you have a large number of users).

    /users get post put

    get

    Retrieves a list of all users.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve all users.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    post

    Adds a new user to the system.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"username":"<USERNAME>","password":",<PASSWORD>","role":"user","authType":"basic","projects":[],"collections":["All"]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    put

    Updates an existing user in the system.

    The following example command changes the role of user butterbean to defenderManager:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '{"username":"butterbean","role":"defenderManager"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    get /users

    Retrieves a list of all users.

    The following example curl command uses basic auth to retrieve all users.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X GET \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: auditor.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Response
    • Security

    HTTP status code 200

    Success

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (object)

      ID is the internal id of the user

    • authType: (object)

      AuthType is the method used to authenticate the user. Range of acceptable values: saml, ldap, basic

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      LastModified is the last modification time of the user

    • password: (string)

      Password is the user's password

    • permissions: (object)

      Permissions is the set of projects and collections the user is assigned to

    • role: (object)

      Role is the user role

    • username: (string)

      Username is the name of the user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    post /users

    Adds a new user to the system.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X POST \
-d '{"username":"<USERNAME>","password":",<PASSWORD>","role":"user","authType":"basic","projects":[],"collections":["All"]}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (object)

      ID is the internal id of the user

    • authType: (object)

      AuthType is the method used to authenticate the user. Range of acceptable values: saml, ldap, basic

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      LastModified is the last modification time of the user

    • password: (string)

      Password is the user's password

    • permissions: (object)

      Permissions is the set of projects and collections the user is assigned to

    • role: (object)

      Role is the user role

    • username: (string)

      Username is the name of the user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    put /users

    Updates an existing user in the system.

    The following example command changes the role of user butterbean to defenderManager:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '{"username":"butterbean","role":"defenderManager"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • _id: (object)

      ID is the internal id of the user

    • authType: (object)

      AuthType is the method used to authenticate the user. Range of acceptable values: saml, ldap, basic

    • lastModified: (datetime)

      LastModified is the last modification time of the user

    • password: (string)

      Password is the user's password

    • permissions: (object)

      Permissions is the set of projects and collections the user is assigned to

    • role: (object)

      Role is the user role

    • username: (string)

      Username is the name of the user

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /users/password put

    put

    Changes a user's password (i.e. the user that is invoking the API).

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to reaplce user's password with:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '{"oldPassword": "<OLDPASSWORD>", "newPassword": "<NEWPASSWORD>"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users/password

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: user.

    put /users/password

    Changes a user's password (i.e. the user that is invoking the API).

    The following example command uses curl and basic auth to reaplce user's password with:

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X PUT \
-d '{"oldPassword": "<OLDPASSWORD>", "newPassword": "<NEWPASSWORD>"}' \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users/password

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: user.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    Body

    Media type: application/json

    Type: object

    Properties
    • newPassword: (string)

      New is the new user password

    • oldPassword: (string)

      Old is the old user password

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    /users/{id} delete

    delete

    Deletes a user from the system by username.

    The following example command deletes a specific user from the system.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users/<USERNAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    delete /users/{id}

    Deletes a user from the system by username.

    The following example command deletes a specific user from the system.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-X DELETE \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/users/<USERNAME>

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: admin.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Request
    • Security

    URI Parameters

    • id: required(string)

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Bad parameters. Either the provided access token is invalid, the token is expired, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Utilities

    Download Twistlock utilities.

    /util/osx/twistcli get

    get

    Download twistcli for macOS platforms.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-L \
-o twistcli \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/util/osx/twistcli

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    get /util/osx/twistcli

    Download twistcli for macOS platforms.

    $ curl -k \
-u <USER> \
-L \
-o twistcli \
https://<CONSOLE>:8083/api/v1/util/osx/twistcli

    Minimum role required to access this endpoint: ci.

    Secured by basicAuth

    Authenticate each request with a username and password.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Authenticate each request with an access token. Request authorization and retrieve an access token using the /api/v1/authenticate endpoint.

    • Security

    Secured by basicAuth

    Headers

    • Authorization: required(string)

      Used to send the Base64-encoded "username:password" credentials.

    HTTP status code 401

    Unauthorized. Either the provided username and password combination is invalid, or the user is not allowed to access the content provided by the requested URL.

    Secured by jwtAccessToken

    Headers

      When sending the access token in the Authorization header field, use the Bearer authentication scheme to transmit the access token.

      Example:

      Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJkYXRhIjp7ImF1dGhUeXBlIjoiYmFzaWMiLCJ1c2VybmFtZSI6ImFkbWluIiwicm9sZSI6ImFkbWluIn0sImlhdCI6MTQ3NzQ5MTU4MywiZXhwIjoxNDc3NTc3OTgzfQ.X4ExX7bFWa4m_WXKImmLO9rYDmxnLrBnoAHAA-vulik
